description: This earthy Chardonnay from a limestone plot has more to do with texture and tight acidity than fruit. It presents a sharp, too-crisp edge.
title: Gérard Charvet 2020 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This simple wine is full of fruit. There is no wood aging here, just ripe pear and apricot flavors that are gently textured. The wine, with its crisp final acidity, is ready to drink.
title: Ropiteau 2021 Les Plants Nobles Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Off dry in character, this wine is ripe, soft and with a buttery flavor. Green plums and apricots combine to give a wine that is round in texture with a tang of citrus at the end.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Marquis de Brim Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a soft wine from a major Rhône valley producer. Attractive acidity gives it a crisp, bright feel. Tangy citrus and clean, light fruitiness are all there, balanced and ready to drink. Drink now.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2021 La Châsse Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: A soft, rich wine with delicious flavors of pear and red apples, lifted by pineapple acidity. It is ripe, but still young, with touches of yeast and almond. It will age well over the medium-term.
title: Duval-Leroy 2011 Blanc de Blancs Brut Millesimé Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Rich and rounded with a creamy texture, this wine is ripe with apricots and has a strongly mineral character. Full of fruit, the wine also has a texture that means it needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2021 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a cool wine, with acidity and citrus fruits well in evidence. It comes from one of the higher premier-cru vineyards, giving a crisp and textured wine even in this warm vintage. It needs time. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2021 Goutte d'Or Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This crisp wine comes from one of upper vineyards of the village. It is packed with apples and citrus, plus a touch of toast. With lively acidity, this wine will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2021 La Grande Montagne Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This young, textured wine shows a mix of strong minerality and ripe white fruits. The Albert Bichot Chablis domaine has a fine parcel from this premier cru. Refreshing citrus and tight acidity contrast with the warmer vanilla and yellow fruits. Drink from 2021.
designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaillons Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2021 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Powerful wine, structured with apple skin tannins, layers of ripe, spicy toast and a taut, mineral character. There is something of the Meursault richness here, in the full white fruit flavors, but this is also a wine that needs to age.
title: Pierre Morey 2011 Les Tessons  (Meursault)

description: Grapefruit, toast and white peach aromas give this wine a great start. It is not powerful but is deliciously balanced with fresh green plum and pink grapefruit flavors rounded out with just the perfect amount of wood. Drink 2014.
title: Morey-Blanc 2011 Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This is a new wine from this negociant house that specializes in limited production wines. It is a smooth and rounded wine, ripe with apples and yellow fruits as well as being cut with acidity. The wine is refreshing and crisp at the end with a touch of minerality.
title: Roche de Bellene 2020  Saint-Véran

description: Fresh and bright, dominated by its citrus and almond flavors. It has a soft, creamy texture, with highlights of orange zest, green plums and a great burst of acidity.
title: Louis Jadot 2014  Mâcon-Lugny

description: Ripe wine, pushing its toast, pear and apricot flavors. Smooth, with an English walnut taste, and green herb acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a soft, flavorful wine full of creamy yellow fruit. Hints of wood aging and a delicate mineral texture add depth to the palate, but this wine will age quickly, so drink now–2024.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2018 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: On the bright and crisp side, this is a lively, fresh wine, mingling green fruits with toast and a more opulent richness.
title: Bret Brothers 2014 Climat la Côte Rôtie  (Saint-Véran)

description: A stunning white with superb balance and layer upon layer of aromas and flavors. An expressive white-flower note accents the solid backbone of ripe red apple and firm nectarine fruit. The medium-weight palate is slightly creamy but not overdone, with hints of toast, sweet spice and almond-flavored nuttiness that unfold on the finish.
title: Château Rives-Blanques 2016 Odyssée Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: Bright and fruity with touches of wood, this is a complex wine with good acidity, a crisp texture and a strong mineral strain. It is rich and will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Ferret 2020 Hors Classe Les Ménétrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Tight, crisp and fruity, this is a refreshing and bright wine. Lively acidity cuts right through the lightly mineral texture. Full of fruit, fresh and lively, this should be drunk now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2019 Domaine Lenoir  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Rich, deliciously fruity and ripe, this combines warmth with a more mineral undertow that cuts through the palate, creating a wine that is refreshing and mouth-filling. It would be worth aging for two years or more.
title: Albert Bichot 2016 Domaine Long-Depaquit  (Chablis)

description: Exhibiting the roundness of the vintage, this is rich and soft. With notes of almond, yeast and yellow fruit, this is already maturing into a bold, open wine. Ready to drink.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2015 En Vesvau  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Soft, full and very rounded, this has yellow fruit flavors that are ripe and open, with its acidity emerging slowly. The finish is more focused and fresh.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2016  Mercurey

description: Oaky aromas of baked apple and toasted wood are upfront on the nose of this wine, but are grounded by ample ripe peach, apple flesh and orange. The medium-weight palate is lushly textured and slightly round in feel, though ample acidity helps to keep the flavors fresh and vibrant through the spicy finish.
title: La Forge Estate 2021 Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is generous and smooth. Spice and toastiness are balanced by the apricot and citrus fruits. One gives richness, the other crispness. It is a wine with a future. Drink from 2024.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021 Les Reversées Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This crisp wine is packed with delicious fruit and balanced acidity. It shows some of the richness of the vintage, but goes more in a tangy, mineral direction. With lively acidity, it is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2021  Pouilly-Vinzelles

description: With its spice and wood flavors, this wine is rich and deliciously concentrated. It has a bold yellow fruit and spice character that is warm and rounded. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcel Couturier 2021 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: A rounded, ripe wine, this is packed with yellow fruits and touched with melon softness. It has toast as well as a mineral texture that give strong backing to the ripe fruitiness. This is likely to develop quickly, drink from 2023.
title: Jaffelin 2021 Passetemps Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This wine is full of acidity, with a crisp edge that's a delicious part of the riper fruit. The wood-aging spiciness is well judged to give a balanced wine that is generous and ready to drink.
title: Château de Beauregard 2021 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Rich and structured, this firm wine has concentration from dense white and yellow fruits plus richness from the wood aging. This intense wine is still developing, so drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2021  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: The lightest touch of wood gives this wine a full, rich character. Weight and density are balanced by the intense acidity. Melon, apricots and citrus are all blended in this ripe wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2021  Meursault

description: The wine is light but it also has very fine fruitiness and great balanced acidity. With a creamy texture and touches of yellow fruit as well as citrus, the wine is refreshingly fruity with great final acidity in a ripe rounded context. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2022 Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A very buttery wine, it is soft, smooth and creamy in texture. Contrasting citrus flavors add a crisp touch. The acidity winds through the ripe fruit to give a bright edge.
title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2018  Saint-Véran

description: A structured, cool wine that is poised and elegant, it has a lightly creamy texture cut by apple and pear flavors. Definitely mineral, it is textured with fruit skins and flavored with the oak aging. It needs to be aged, so don't drink before 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2018 Réserve Personelle  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This attractive village wine has ripe fruits as well as a more steely texture. Wood flavors give smoothness that rounds out the wine and enhances the yellow fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2017  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Bright and fruity, it's full of fresh acidity and has a strongly mineral texture. Green fruits, apples and pears partner with a strong citrus element. Wait until 2019.
title: Bret Brothers 2018 La Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Structured, mineral and tense, this is a classic Pouilly Fuissé. It has lemon and crisp sliced white fruits, very linear in character with a bright, tight texture. The wine is young and could age until 2020.
title: Jaffelin 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Jadot's take on Burgundy Chardonnay is fruity and creamy. Juicy, intense acidity comes from the crisp apple and white peach fruits. A touch of wood aging softens the fruit and broadens the character of the wine. Drink now.
title: Louis Jadot 2019  Bourgogne

description: This example shows a bit more character than many Pays d'Oc Chardonnays. Pretty scents of lemon and honeysuckle lead to a palate with above-average concentration and lovely lemon meringue pie flavors. Tangy acidity renders this a good choice for salmon.
title: Robert Skalli 2011 South of France Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Light and crisp, this wine has citrus and green-plum flavors. It is still developing, with plenty of acidity as well a perfumed character. Drink this attractive wine from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2022 Petit Vallons  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This wine is very soft and only lightly fruity. Some spice and touches of acidity give a crisp edge to the otherwise dull wine.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Collection  (Mercurey)

description: This rounded, creamy wine is attractive, with rich apricots and balanced zesty acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Verchères 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: Mealy apple and orange custard aromas set the stage for this ripe, fleshy white. There's a roundness to the mouthfeel, as those notes continue through to the palate, though the finish offers a pithy citrus astringency that helps to enliven the experience.
title: Domaine Saint-Nabor 2022 Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: Named after the church which is next to the Brocard winery, this crisp fruity wine is lively with acidity, lemon and apple fruits and a light tangy texture. The wine becomes more ripe as it opens up showing peach and apricot flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2021 Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)

description: The wine is soft and creamy. Made from fruit grown in the Mâcon region, it is ripe and with a good balance between citrus and melon flavors. The acidity and the attractive fruitiness have produced a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2021  Bourgogne

description: This is a fresh, fruity and apple-crisp wine that is light, buoyant with acidity and shot with citrus. It is lightly mineral, textured and with attractive crispness at the end. The Devillard family bottles this wine on behalf the estate's owners. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2020 Domaine de la Garenne  (Mâcon-Azé)

description: A deliciously rich wine, this is full of ripe fruit and rich wood and spice flavors. It is generous, layering peach and pear fruitiness cut with acidity. A tangy edge gives the wine an attractive bite. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Domaine de la Garenne  (Mâcon-Azé)

description: This wine is crisp and refreshingly fruity. A lively texture gives brightness, and a light touch of acidity finishes the wine on a citrus note. Drink now.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: Spiced-apple aromas lead to a soft, perfumed wine that has a crisp, fruity edge. The apple and green-plum flavors give attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Marcel Couturier 2021 La Cour des Bois  (Saint-Véran)

description: One in a range of wines under the Xavier Flouret brand, this wine is made by Domaine Hamelin in Chablis. It is deliciously refreshing, with just the right edge of crispness to give it a lift. At the same time, its ripe, creamy texture blends with spiced-apple fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
title: Xavier Flouret 2021 Marly  (Chablis)

description: This soft, ripe wine has good apricot and peach flavors alongside the crisper citrus acidity. It is spicy, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château de Beauregard 2021 Vignes Blances  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Beaujolais Blanc is effectively Burgundy-type Chardonnay but from the southern neighbor Beaujolais region. This wine, with its ripe and creamy texture, has the same rich character as a Mâcon wine. It is smooth and soft from a warm vintage for white wines. Drink this wine now.
title: Château de Lavernette 2021 Les Vignes de la Roche  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This fruity wine is full of bright acidity. Crisp and clean, it shows yellow fruits and a shot of citrus. The aftertaste is lively and bright. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2022 Clos de la Bressande  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Bright and fruity, this delicious wine is crisp, clean and refreshing. With yellow fruits followed by zesty acidity, it's both open and textured. Drink now.
title: Domaine Touzot 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: From vines in the vineyards behind the Côtes de Nuits, this wine is warm, smooth and ripe. It offers yellow fruits as well as rich apple and enough acidity to give a crisp edge. It's attractive and will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: A touch of wood aging gives this wine richness, aided by the ripe fruit of the vintage. The wine is full with citrus, crisp apple and ripe pear. With its nervy texture and acidity, it needs to age a bit more. Drink from 2022.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2021 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne)

description: The grandest of all white Burgundy vineyards, Montrachet has produced a powerful, great wine, with impressive ripe, dense fruit. There is still elegance, a sense of proportion, but the opulence of the Chardonnay here is impossible to resist.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Montrachet

description: Intense fruit and acidity give this wine a brightly refreshing character. It's about lemon and lime flavors with slices of red apple to bring out more sweetness. The aftertaste has a mineral edge that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2019  Saint-Véran

description: Named after the almost gold appearance of the Chardonnay vines at harvest time, this is a soft wine, with hints of the mineral tang that embodies Pouilly Fuissé. It has pear and white peach fruit flavors, soft and ready to drink.
title: Labouré-Roi 2016 Vallon d'Or  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Coming from the more northerly parts of Burgundy, this is cool Chardonnay, with steel and minerality. It is firmly textured, its apple and quince flavors coming with a more citrus element.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2016  Bourgogne

description: A wine that reveals a textured side of Meursault. It has weight, ripe apricot and pineapple fruit with a refreshing touch of acidity. But the chalky, mineral character equally defines the wine. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This soft wine has gentle ripe white fruits and lemon-juice flavors. It ends fresh and crisp, with a touch of creaminess to add richness. Drink now.
title: Verget 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Ripe and smooth, this rich wine has enough fruitiness and acidity to give a crisper edge, although it is more about a warm, spicy character. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2020  Saint-Véran

description: Smooth and generous, this wine is soft and missing any bite. It is round and unfocused, but ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2020 Le Clos Devouluet Durand-les-Verchès  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This open, fruity wine has a soft side. Apples and pears are prominent along with a touch of spice. Drink now.
designation: Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers
title: Pascal Rollet 2020 Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers  (Saint-Véran)

description: Made from grapes sourced from a single vineyard, this is an intensely minerally Champagne. It is dry and austere, with citrus fruits dominant. The wine needs to age to bring out all of the richness and toast flavor, but it will always be a structured Champagne. This is very much a food wine.
designation: Clos des Bouveries Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Duval-Leroy 2011 Clos des Bouveries Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Chardonnay grown at the mouth of the Loire is as crisp and green as you would expect. This unoaked wine has touches of pear and definite citrus, very fresh and light.
designation: Domaine du Coing de Saint-Fiacre Cuvée Aurore
region_1: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire
title: Château du Coing de Saint-Fiacre 2013 Domaine du Coing de Saint-Fiacre Cuvée Aurore Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)

description: A finely balanced wine, bringing together the new wood flavors with structured tropical fruits. Plangent acidity is the binding agent, giving an excitingly refreshing wine with a bright finish.
title: Pierre André 2014 Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Slow to show its quality, with a little aeration this becomes a superripe wine, its wood element dominated by the intense tropical fruits. There is some balancing restraint in the citrus character, along with the acidity. Enjoy now.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Meursault)

description: This is a floral, mineral wine, both tight and exuberant in its perfumed character. Green apple and spices combine with the textured character of this balanced wine—lively, fruity and with fine acidity. It comes in a bottle that was common in the Victorian era, slightly narrower at the base.
designation: Esprit de Victoria Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs
title: Joseph Perrier 2016 Esprit de Victoria Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Full bodied and ripe, this Chardonnay is packed with yellow fruit and pear flavors, and it shows the steely, minerally character typical of Chablis. It has a youthful brightness on the finish, and it will fill out over the next few months.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2017 Vieilles Vignes Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Better known for its red wines, Ladoix's whites are a rarity. This wine is made from fruit sourced from vines that are close to the Corton hill. It is steely, minerally and crisp, with a wood-influenced character. With its structure, this needs at least three years of aging.
title: Louis Jadot 2016 Le Clou d'Orge  (Ladoix)

description: Bright and fruity, this is a wine to be enjoyed now. It's crisp acidity, but concentrated with creamed-apple flavors and broadened by a touch of wood.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Prestige  (Bourgogne)

description: A soft, yet also mineral-textured wine. Its lemon and grapefruit flavors are crisp, reflecting the taut structure of the vintage. A fresh wine, with a crisp finish, ready to drink.
title: Louis Jadot 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: Butter and toast flavors give this wine extra richness and some weight. At the same time, the textured citrus and grapefruit flavors combine with the wine's minerality to give a more lively aftertaste.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2016  Chablis

description: Alive and dainty with soft orange blossom notes paired with fresh red apple slices and a touch of nuttiness. The mouth is more of the same, with a distinct peach pit flavor unfolding on the medium-length finish.
title: Domaines Astruc 2015 dA Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Richness, concentration, great weight and balance. Despite the ripeness, the crispness of the house style dominates. The apple flavors and the minerality need several years to really mature. From mainly grand cru vineyards.
designation: Special Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2010 Special Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Bringing out all the minerality of the chalk soils, this rounded wine is also packed with rich fruits. The wine is just approaching its peak, showing wonderful lemon and white stone fruits.
title: Pol Roger 2006 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Crisp with brisk acidity, yet bright with citrus and yellow fruit, this wine shows structure as well as warmth. It's a textured wine that can age over the medium term. Drink now–2022.
designation: Cuvée Signature Les Macherelles Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2017 Cuvée Signature Les Macherelles Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Soft and rich, a wine that shows the warmth of the vintage in this southern Burgundy appellation. It's full of yellow fruits with just a hint of pineapple along with a good line in acidity. A sense of minerality and texture appears at the end.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: A full-bodied, slightly oxidative wine that wears its character well. There is a toastiness here along with some apple and apricot fruits, giving a rich feel to the wine. It's ready to drink but can also continue to age until 2021–2022.
title: Andre et Mireille Tissot 2017 Les Graviers Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: Still young with attractive fresh fruits, this wine needs to age. With its bright acidity and white fruits, it's just beginning to hint at the mineral structure behind. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2019 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is rounded, rich, missing some acidity but with the compensation of ripe yellow fruits layered with pineapple and spice from wood. With all its sweetness, it is not for aging.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2015 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: Initially, this is a richly ripe wine with tropical fruit flavors. It also has an immense sense of structure that supports the fruit impressively. It's dense, concentrated, exuding power and solidity, while always keeping a sense of elegance. Drink from 2022.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2017  Chevalier-Montrachet

description: An interesting Chard that offers quite sweet notes of stewed peaches, orange marmalade and overripe honeydew. Big and a bit clumsy in the mouth, more vibrancy and freshness is needed to keep things in better balance. However, if you like 'em sweeter, this one's for you.
title: Domaine de Guiot 2014 Les Jumeaux Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Pleasant, soft wine, easy to drink, its fruits round and somewhat dilute. It doesn't resonate, but is certainly fresh and crisp.
title: Domaine Jayer-Gilles 2013  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

description: Lightweight wine that seems somewhat dilute with flavors of green plums, bright acidity and a very soft texture.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014  Petit Chablis

description: From one of the most familiar of the Meursault Premier Crus, this wine is crisp and mineral in character. It has tight acidity with apple and green-plum fruit that is laced by a light amount of wood aging. The wine is still young and will be better from 2022.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2020 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Crisp, tight and mineral, this classic wine has citrus and apple fruits filled out with creamed pear. The zingy texture is still young and vibrant. With intense acidity at the end, the wine could still develop, so drink from early 2021.
title: Château Vitallis 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: From vines aged between 40 and 80 years, this is a lightly wood-aged wine, with yellow fruits that go with the spicy toast. Full, ripe, and nicely cut with acidity, it has a creamy, smooth texture. Drink now.
title: Château Vitallis 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: There is a fine touch of spice in this wine. Bright and tangy, it is also full with white fruits, ripe acidity and a warm while zesty character. Still young and zesty, the wine will soften over the next few months into something more rounded. Drink from 2021.
title: Christophe Cordier 2020 En Faux  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is a smooth and rounded wine with ripe yellow fruits as well as a crisp, sliced apple character. It is fruity and warm with its ripe, full flavors. Drink this generous wine now.
title: Jacques Charlet 2019 La Crochette  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Tight and crisp initially, this wine opens up with spice, ripe flavors and a touch of minerality. Taut and textured, it needs to age; drink from 2021.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: A ripe, crisp, yellow- and white-fruit-flavored wine. It shows taut minerality, the flintiness you find in Chablis. The structure is dominant in what is still a young wine, but the fruit is all there. Worth aging for a year.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2011 Pur Chardonnay  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is a light wine—fruity and with a soft texture. It has citrus and creamed pear flavors that are balanced with acidity. It's a wine to be drunk now while its fruitiness is still at its peak.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2020  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This is a crisp and fruity wine that has fine acidity and a tangy orange-zest texture. The wine is full of green plums and with a salty, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2020 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: Named after the parcel from which this wine originally came, it is delicate and soft. The apple and citrus fruit is light, cut easily with some acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2020 Collection Tiserny  (Bourgogne)

description: Petit Chablis comes from the plateau above the main Chablis vineyards. As here, it offers a light fruity style with only the lightest minerality and much more in the way of apple and citrus flavors. Drink the wine from early 2021.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2021 Blancs Cailloux  (Petit Chablis)

description: Tasting light, almost dilute, this is a pleasant wine with white fruit flavors and a light textured acidity. The flavors come slowly and the final acidity is only fleeting.
title: Mommessin 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Its name a play on the Petit Chablis appellation (pas si petit means “not so little”), this wine has a ripe and fruity character. Crisp texture and lively, exuberant acidity carry its white fruit flavors into the finish. Drink now.
title: La Chablisienne 2021 Pas si Petit  (Petit Chablis)

description: For a Petit Chablis, this is serious and complex, with delicious ripe green and yellow fruits; there is a touch of caramel with toast just at the edge.
title: Domaine Vincent Dauvissat 2011  Petit Chablis

description: Without big oak or big fruit to make it ungainly, this is a real food-friendly Chardonnay. The delicate floral aromas and understated yet finely etched pear and almond flavors almost seem designed to show off that special weekend dish you just spent hours making.
title: Louis Latour 2006  Beaune

description: This is a rich, rounded and concentrated wine. Good structure comes both from the wood aging and from the acidity of the apple and apricot fruits. Developing slowly, it will become an impressive, ripe wine. Drink from 2022. The grapes come from the highest vineyard in Chassagne, just under the woods.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2018 En PImont  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: There is a touch of spice on this wine, along with flavors of crisp citrus and green apple. Fruity and bright, this is already drinkable, and it finishes with a tang of lemon zest.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2016  Bourgogne

description: This Chardonnay is minerally and dry, and it has taut acidity and structured quince fruit. The finish is crisp.
title: Jaffelin 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Open and inviting, this wine lays out traditional Chardonnay aromas and flavors of peach and citrus accented by toasty oak in a powerful and easily understood wine. There's a certain lack of finesse that's more than made up for by rich and expressive flavors.
title: Louis Latour 2006  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This wine sees only 10–15% new oak, which allows the gritty peach and tangerine fruit flavors to shine through, dressed up by hints of toasted hazelnuts. White peaches and a powdered talc texture give the impression of richness without excess weight. Finishes long, with notes of mineral and citrus.
title: Louis Latour 2006  Puligny-Montrachet

description: A soft and gently fruity wine that has simple apple flavors and an attractive level of acidity. The wine, with its warm fruit, is ready to drink.
title: Trenel Fils 2018  Mâcon-Villages

description: Lightly smoky, this is an attractive, simple and fruity Chablis. It has apple and pear flavors balanced with soft acidity. Smooth and round, it's a wine for medium-term aging, so drink now–2022.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2018  Chablis

description: This is an attractively crisp, citrus-flavored wine. With lime and ripe apple fruits, the tangy texture bursts with freshness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vins Auvigue 2020  Saint-Véran

description: Produced in the Languedoc, this wine tastes of the warmth and the sun. It has a touch of butter as well as ripe green-plum fruits. Acidity gives an attractive lift to this fruity, soft wine.
title: Pierre Moulin 2021 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Based in Burgundy, Tramier should know something about Chardonnay. This wine has some structure that tastes of cool vineyards. It is crisp, with refreshing white fruit and green-plum flavors, and is ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Romantic Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Soft and creamy, this has a smooth texture with vanilla and baked apple flavors cut through with full acidity. It feels rich, full in the mouth, fresh and ripe at the same time. Drink from 2019.
title: Romain Bouchard 2018 Le Grand Bois  (Chablis)

description: There is a bitter edge to this wine. Spice and tight acidity give a nervy, taut character. At the same time, fresh apple and citrus flavors come through. Give this wine until 2020 to soften.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Bright and light, this offers yellow fruits that are cut with citrus to give a clean character as well as richness. Drink now for its crisp aftertaste and warm texture.
title: Domaine de Biéville 2019  Chablis

description: From vines that are up to 70 years old, this is a single-parcel wine. It is rich, with some good concentration and a mineral edge. Ripe apricot and apple fruits are combined with a tight acidity that suggests the need to age. Drink from late 2019.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Rich and rounded, packed with yellow fruits and pineapple flavors, this is a warm, opulent wine, combining toast and fruit. True, there is some minerality, but this Meursault revels in its ripe fruit and generosity.
designation: Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru
title: Domaine Leflaive 2015 Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: rich, fruity wood-aged wine, this offers ripe white fruits and plenty of smoky toast flavors. Acidity and minerality give the wine its distinctive tangy texture. These elements result in a ripe wine that will age further. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Santenay 2021 Abbaye de Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: The name, Mineral, says everything you need to know about the texture of this wine. It is also rich, generous and ripe with apricot and melon flavors. This easygoing wine has a soft aftertaste that makes it drinkable now.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2022 Minéral  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: Mango aromas bring out the tropical character of this superripe wine. It is soft and creamy, maybe too much so, since it lacks a crisper edge. It is ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2021 Domaine de la Batie  (Saint-Véran)

description: This ripe wine has rich white stone fruit and only light acidity. The warmth of the wine comes from the ripeness and the smooth texture that will allow it to age quickly. Drink now.
title: Pierre-Yves et Olivier Fichet 2022 Les Trois Terroirs

description: This is a ripe and sunny wine full of tropical fruit and ripe apple flavors. Smooth and open, it has just enough crisp acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2022  Mâcon-Vinzelles

description: Bright, soft and attractively fruity, this is an easy, open wine. An edge of acidity and minerality give the wine a good, crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2021 Rives de Longsault  (Saint-Véran)

description: This ripe and creamy wine offers yellow fruits and a soft texture. The acidity is just right for all the rich fruit, giving a lift of citrus to the smooth texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2021 Bel-Air  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This soft wine offers ripe yellow fruits and a gentle texture. Bright with acidity, it also has peach and melon roundness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Michel 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a lush, rich and toasty Chardonnay, with upfront scents of grilled apple, brioche, orange custard and sweet spice. The medium-weight palate is balanced by ample acidity, lending a freshness to the finish that closes on notes of honeydew melon and toasted hazelnut. Drink now–2022.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2017 Aigle Royal Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: Montée de Tonnerre is considered one of the richest premier crus in Chablis, and this wine lives up to that reputation. It's ripe and full of yellow fruit, while maintaining its acidity and tight texture. Still young, its intense fruit and crispness will allow it to age for many years. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Billaud-Simon 2020 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Young vines give this wine a bright, fruity character, while wood aging brings out complexity and ripe yellow and citrus fruits. It's juicy and lively, with just the right minerality and tight texture to allow it to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2020 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This wine comes from less than an acre in Mâcon's smallest appellation. The result is a tight wine with a steely edge. Strong citrus and crisp apple flavors are lifted by the nervy acidity and finished with a shot of lemon juice. Let this wine calm down and drink from 2021.
title: Bret Brothers 2020 Climat La Colonge  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This tight wine has acidity with a crisp texture and hints of the fruit to come. A potential for richness comes from the ripe yellow fruits that are developing. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean Curial 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This wine offers an attractive mix of mango and kiwi fruit, with a light structure. A fresh, fruity tang makes it full while also refreshing. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marie Chaland 2020 En Thurissey  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Tight and structured, this wine has minerality as well as tangy lemon character. It has a crisp side, with citrus fruits and attractive acidity. The aftertaste is bright with freshness.
title: Louis Max 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: Named after the Lyre style of vine training, this wine comes from the far north of Burgundy, close to Chablis. It is soft, smooth and creamy, with a light minerality and perfumed acidity. It is just right to drink now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2020 Quintessence de Lyre

description: Fermented and aged in tank, the wine is nothing but simply attractive pure ripe fruit. It has density and concentration that come from the generous apple and yellow-fruit flavors. At the same time, the wine is cut by delicious acidity and minerality. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Domaine Bègue-Mathiot 2020 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This has a minerally, tense structure as well as green fruit and citrus flavors. As the texture is quite dominant, let this age for two years to allow  the opulent fruit to surface.
title: Domaine Luquet 2017 Bois Seguin  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A finely structured, delicate, elegant wine, this has a pure white fruit and mineral character that lies easily on the palate. The aftertaste is soft but there is still a steely edge to the wine, which promises long aging. Give it at least 5 years.
title: Louis Roederer 2006 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This wine is full of rich fruit. With apricots, mangos and a layer of caramel, this is a generous wine with enough acidity to sustain its richness. The aftertaste brings in spice, vanilla and a squeeze of lemon.
title: Domaine André Bonhomme 2019 Cuvée Spéciale  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This wine is fresh, crisply fruity and toasty without missing the apple and pear flavors that give juiciness behind the texture. It's ripe and is developing well. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Ferret 2019 Les Perrières Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine offers tropical fruit against a background of intense acidity. That makes it fruity, ripe with a tight structure that gives delicious lift and freshness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2019  Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Woody, toasty aromas are dominant here giving a full-bodied, spicy character to the wine. It is rich, but with plenty of acidity to give it good freshness. Bright while toasty, it will age. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2019 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: Soft and ripe with an attractive kick of juicy acidity, this is a perfumed wine with yellow and white fruit flavors. It has all the freshness a ripe wine needs, showing a tangy, bitter orange and lime aftertaste.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2019 Hors Classe  (Saint-Véran)

description: Round, smooth and rich, this full-bodied wine has ripe fruit and a balanced acidity. It is more about yellow fruits, less about citrus, conveying a generous character. It is likely to age quickly, so drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2019 Clos sur la Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has simple fruit with fresh acidity, touches of lemon and a crisp, tangy texture. Still young, it offers a flinty edge and a steely aftertaste, both of which will merge into the apple and grapefruit flavors over the next few months. Drink from 2020.
title: William Fèvre 2020  Chablis

description: There is enticing new wood here, a wine that shows richness to boost the ripe, creamy apple and pear fruits. It has a generous character, to contrast with its core of steely acidity. The finish is more earthy, suggesting the wine still needs time in the bottle.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2013 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With its upfront, ripe apple and pear flavors, this wine is immediately attractive. Behind the fruitiness, there is a firm, structured character of minerality and a steely edge, which makes this a Chardonnay to age for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2017 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The most taut and steely of the wines made by Guillaume Vrignaud from Fourchaume fruit, this offers a tight, minerally texture, lively acidity and an apple- and grapefruit-like crispness. With its structure, this has the potential to age for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2017 Les Champréaux Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Steely and tight, this is a mineral-driven wine. With its vibrant acidity and tense texture, it is a classic Chardonnay that will fill out slowly and evolve favorably with time. Beneath the tension and forward acidity is a rich wine, though it needs time to show it. Drink from 2024.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is Chardonnay from the same region as Muscadet giving it a crisp salty character that has been filled out with some oak aging. The wine is ripe, spicy with a mineral character that comes from the granite soil. Drink now.
title: Lieubeau 2021 La Fruitière Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: Still very closed up, this austere wine has distinct aging potential, with its taut character, apple skin texture and hints of wood. It will need 3–4 years to show its best.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2015 Les Chaumes  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This premier cru is on the cooler left bank of the Serein river, making this vintage a crisply mineral wine that's tight with zesty lemon and fine crisp acidity. The hints of yellow fruits are still to develop. The wine is structured and needs to age, so drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2021 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A silky ripe wine that has great yellow and white stone fruits. That is contrasted with a strongly mineral character, touches of honey and intense acidity. The wine is still young but it has a delicious future. Drink starting from 2023.
title: Château de Lavernette 2020 Vers Châne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is one of the coolest premier crus, meaning that the wine can often age well. In the warm 2019 vintage, the wine shows both beautifully ripe fruit and a tight mineral streak that will keep it on the straight and narrow. It does need to age and the wine will be best from 2022.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2021 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Crisp and fruity, this bright, textured wine has a tangy character that is juicy and refreshing. Lively and rich, it is ready to drink although it will be better from 2021.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2020 Hors Classe  (Saint-Véran)

description: From the coolest of the Premier Cru vineyards, this is a crisp wine, packed with minerality as well as tight green fruits. The aftertaste with its flinty edge is spicy as well as deliciously fruity. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Fourrey 2020 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This warm, rounded and ripe wine offers balanced fruit and acidity. A crisp edge to the rich pear and spicy flavor is lifted by an attractive touch of cinnamon. The final acidity is steely, bringing in a mineral element. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gilles Morat 2020 Domaine Chataigneraie-Laborier Terroirs de Vergisson  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine balances intense fruit with a steely core of minerality. It is packed with apple, crisp pear and kiwi fruits, contrasted with this tight texture and hints of wood aging. Well balanced, the wine will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2020  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This structured, tight wine has complex almond and spice flavors that partner with crisp acidity and tangy lemon zest and grapefruit accents. The texture with its minerality and tight aftertaste promises aging. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2020 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Different parcels of old vines in the south of the appellation produce a smooth and well-balanced wine. With touches of toast as well as crisp lemon and ripe melon fruits, it is rich and intense with lively, juicy acidity. A generous wine, it is ready to drink.
designation: Les Terres du Sud Viellies Vignes
title: Rijckaert 2020 Les Terres du Sud Viellies Vignes  (Saint-Véran)

description: Fifty-year-old vines on the two opposing slopes of this Grand Cru vineyard come together in this balanced wine. It has a cool mineral character that contrasts with its ripe yellow and pear fruit. Acidity and a tight texture hold the wine together beautifully. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2020 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This vineyard is at the southern end of Meursault next to Puligny-Montrachet, lending the wine Puligny-like structure and texture and beautiful Meursault-like fruit. Yellow fruit flavors, layers of wood spice and juicy acidity all contribute to this very fine wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Jadot 2020 Meursault Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This is a soft and creamy wine, ripe with baked apple and crisp pear flavors. Balanced and full in the mouth, it attractive and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2020  Chablis

description: This simple, fruity and rounded wine has light acidity, apricot and pear flavors and a tang of orange zest. It is full, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Laroche 2020 Saint-Martin  (Chablis)

description: A fine vintage of this always delicious Chablis. The wine has weight, a sense of warmth from its yellow fruits and depth of flavor. Full and ripe in the mouth, it will age for a year, although it is drinkable already.
title: La Chablisienne 2017 La Sereine  (Chablis)

description: Well structured wine with plenty of ripe fruit. The freshness of fruit is replaced by spice and peach flavors.
title: Château de Fuissé 2014 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This 16–acre estate is run biodynamically, producing intensely flavored, honeyed, ripe wines. This is succulent from ripe fruit, with the acidity bright and vivid, finishing with sweet pineapple and apricot flavors.
title: Domaine Guillemot-Michel 2014 Quintaine  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Well-balanced wine, ripe fruit, touches of wood, light spice, ginger and sweet apples. Structured, held well together by wood.
title: Jean Manciat 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon-Charnay)

description: While this wine is rich, its tight texture brings out the minerality. Yellow fruits and toast are balanced with zingy acidity for a wine that will need time to broaden out. Drink from 2021.
designation: Les Murgers des Denys de Chien Premier Cru
title: Roux Père et Fils 2021 Les Murgers des Denys de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Full of yellow fruits, this is a ripe and lightly wood-aged wine. Great acidity and plenty of rich but lively fruitiness play well together, leading into a crisp aftertaste. It needs to age a bit more, so drink from 2022.
title: Vins Auvigue 2020 Solutré  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is generous and smooth. Spice and toastiness are balanced by the apricot and citrus fruits. One gives richness, the other crispness. It is a wine with a future. Drink from 2024.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021 Les Reversées Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This crisp wine is packed with delicious fruit and balanced acidity. It shows some of the richness of the vintage, but goes more in a tangy, mineral direction. With lively acidity, it is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2021  Pouilly-Vinzelles

description: With its spice and wood flavors, this wine is rich and deliciously concentrated. It has a bold yellow fruit and spice character that is warm and rounded. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcel Couturier 2021 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: A simple, rounded wine, soft and fruity. Pear and apricot flavors dominate along with a crisper, grapefruit edge. The wine is aging quickly, and will be ready in a few months.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2017  Saint-Véran

description: A big, ripe wine that also keeps an edgy character, typical of the year. It has a fine contrast between full apple and pear fruits and a zesty tang of acidity and texture. It does need a few months' aging.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A rich, buttery wine, with classic mineral and citrus characters. Very taut and tight, while layering fresh fruit flavors. Crisp and rounded at the same time.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Finely textured, with great minerality as well as ripe fruit. Flavors range from peach to lime, a reflection of the warm vintage and the chalk soil. Acidity is important, giving a contrast to the richness.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2015 Montée de Tonnerre  (Chablis)

description: This is a major wine from a great white wine vintage that's naturally impressive and intense. Ripe white and yellow fruit dominates the palate, sustained by wood aging flavors and tight, nervy texture. Bâtard-Montrachet is largest of the five white Grand Crus in Puligny and Chassagne Montrachet. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Jadot 2020  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: This is a powerhouse of a wine—structured and dense yet still developing and closed at this young stage. There's already a sense of both fruit richness and mineral texture, underpinned by oak spice, yet it will grow more powerful with time. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2020  Corton-Charlemagne

description: From vines inside the Les Clos Grand Cru purchased in 1904 from the Hospices de Chablis, this is a richly structured wine. It's dense with layers of flavor and great aging potential. Wood and smoky flavors are still calming down to give a wine that will be impressive and long-lived. Drink from 2023.
designation: Les Clos Grand Cru Clos des Hospices
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2020 Les Clos Grand Cru Clos des Hospices  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Produced by two members of one of Burgundy's grand families, this wine is fruity and soft. With a lightly toasty flavors, it's smooth and creamy, lit by lime-like acidity. Although young, it's likely to develop quickly. Drink from mid 2021.
title: Domaine Guy & Yan Dufouleur 2021 La Vacherotte  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: This smooth and creamy wine has ripe fruit and only light acidity. It's full-bodied and on the heavy side, showing its weight. Drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021  Meursault

description: This is the top cuvée from Pouilly-Fuissé's most famous estate. It is a big, round wine, its curves opulent and generous. There are yellow fruits, particularly apricots, and the wine is given some sinew by its acidity and by the light spice aftertaste.
title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is dense, ripe and full of rich apricot and peach flavors, with a line of crisp lemon and a background of toast. Full in the mouth, this generous wine will be ready to drink from 2021. It comes Louis Max domaine vineyards in and around Mercurey.
title: Louis Max 2020 Les Rochelles  (Mercurey)

description: A simple, rounded wine, soft and fruity. Pear and apricot flavors dominate along with a crisper, grapefruit edge. The wine is aging quickly, and will be ready in a few months.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2017  Saint-Véran

description: A warm, generous wine, full of ripe fruits. There is weight, richness and generosity here, although not a great depth of flavor.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Meursault

description: A soft, open wine that tastes dilute but at least finishes cleanly. There are many better, more characterful, basic white Burgundies on the market.
title: Michel Picard 2013  Bourgogne

description: Full and ripe, certainly as befits Meursault from a great year, but this wine also has deliciously crisp acidity which adds an element of minerality, of poise, to the smooth toast and cream texture. An enticing, structured wine.
title: Pierre Morey 2011  Meursault

description: Deliciously fresh, this is almost delicate, certainly elegant. There is great balance here, the wood just lightly toasty over the smooth, creamy white fruit flavors. For a wine from a lesser Burgundy appellation, this is impressive.
title: Morey-Blanc 2011  Auxey-Duresses

description: While the texture is light, the fruit and the wood flavors give this wine richness and a ripe, toast and apricot character. It has balanced acidity that allows a fresher edge to develop. The aftertaste, hinting at a steely edge, suggests the wine will age. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Laroche 2019 Les Vaudevey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Structured and fruity, this has plenty of minerality to pair with the crisp citrus flavor. The wood influence gives it extra depth, while the crispness is preserved by a final steely thrust. This structured wine should age for four years or more
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016 Les Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Still very firm and closed, this is textured and rich, with intense mineral and wood flavors that balance the steeliness. It's full bodied, taut and nervy, with a concentrated core. Age for at least four years.
title: Château de Maligny 2016 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Opulent and very minerally, this is deeply flavored and concentrated, with a lively, crisp edge. It's fruity while also having a textured finish that shows a structured, age-worthy side.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Les Referts Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Very tangy in texture, it has spice from wood aging and a crisply fresh character. It is bright and light, and very lemony at the end.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2018 Grand Va  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: This wine is dull, soft with some redeeming acidity. It has weight and hints of a fresher character that might emerge by 2019.
title: Jacques Charlet 2018 La Crochette  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Soft and fruity, it is already fully developed. Crisp apple flavors accompany bright acidity and a touch of minerality. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2018  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Big and fruity, this wine is broad but without great definition. It offers weight, soft apple fruits and light acidity. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2018  Saint-Véran

description: This is a round style of wine, with its ripe apple fruits and soft texture set against a fresh, tangy backdrop. Although it is young, the wine is very drinkable now, but the fresh acidity will allow it to mature further. Best drink it from 2021.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2020 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Chalky, stony notes come to the forefront on this austere, restrained, non-dosed vintage crémant. The taut texture carries green apple and citrus tones, with a satisfying, savory soy sauce backdrop. This is poised and precise, fresh and refreshing, clean and structured—a testament to the nobility of Chardonnay.
title: Boeckel 2017 Extra Brut Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: In this ripe wine, yellow fruits, cinnamon and ripe herbs are melded into a harmonious whole. Great acidity offers a juicy core to this well-balanced wine. Drink now for its great refreshing character.
title: Christophe Cordier 2019 Clos du Four  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

description: Crisp, textured and with great acidity, this wine is still developing. It is packed with fresh citrus and apple fruits cut with strong minerality. Drink this structured wine from 2021.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This wine is full in the mouth, with swathes of ripe apricot and mango fruit flavors. It has weight, a touch of spice and great acidity that emphasizes the general richness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Michel 2019  Viré-Clessé

description: Fresh and fruity with creamy green and white fruits, this is a soft, ready to drink Chardonnay. Attractively fruity, the acidity finely cuts through the wine.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2017 Bourricot Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine comes from the vineyard that sits at the pinnacle of Chardonnay in Burgundy. It is majestic and opulent, a powerful wine full of deeply concentrated fruit as well as the ineffable acidity of the vintage. It is structured, tensely mineral and demands long aging. Drink this beautiful wine from 2023.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Montrachet

description: Named after the ruined abbey which the vineyard surrounds, this is a smooth, generous and beautifully opulent wine. The vines, owned by the Leflaive family, give a bold, spicy wine, rich in white stone fruits, intense acidity and a firm mineral texture. There is just enough toasty flavor to give the wine extra complexity. Drink this impressive wine from 2021.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Abbaye de Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes (as are all the Olivier Leflaive family grand and premier crus), this is a gorgeous, opulent wine. It has richness and great intensity as well as fine acidity and crisp apple fruits. Toast and vanilla come from the wood aging. The wine is so generous and packed with fruit as well as a strong mineral texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: Properly rich and majestic, this wine also has impressive amounts of crisp acidity to balance its concentration. The wine has layers of peach and apricot along with beautiful acidity and a taut texture that will allow it to age. It is generous and will become opulent and full bodied as it develops. Drink this powerful wine from 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Corton-Charlemagne

description: The wine comes from a small strip of a half acre in the center of this famed grand cru, part of the Olivier Leflaive family domaine. It is laden with toast flavors from the wood fermentation as well as intense fruit, green plums and crisp apples which are given extra richness by apricots. Concentrated and densely textured the wine will develop so well. Drink from 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Chevalier-Montrachet

description: Coming from arguably the grandest of the Chablis Grand Crus, this is an impressive, rich and structured wine. It is concentrated, intense with minerality, pure acidity and great fruitiness. The wine has depth and power, a ripe wine that captures the full strength of the fine vineyard. Drink from 2024.
designation: Les Vieilles Vignes Les Clos Grand Cru
title: Pascal Bouchard 2020 Les Vieilles Vignes Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A creamy wine, its apple fruit flavors smoothed by touches of butter and spice. There is a fine citrus aftertaste that gives the rich wine a delicious, refreshing lift.
title: Henri Perrusset 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: Soft and rounded wine, with rich peach and pineapple flavors. The wine is smooth, the wood aging adding a subtle touch of spice. The long, creamy aftertaste suggests a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2015  Montagny

description: This wine is ripe, textured with an attractive touch of oxidation giving richness and concentration. Good acidity at the same time is balanced with quince and a touch of spice.
title: Domaine Pinson 2019  Chablis

description: A simple, fruity Chardonnay, ripe with pear flavors and a lacing of lime. It is round, warm, soft, ready to drink in a few months.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2016 Les Murelles  (Bourgogne)

description: A ripe and full-bodied wine, this has good depth of flavor from its lees and wood aging. A creamy texture comes along with a tangy cool fruitiness that has lemon and bitter orange flavors. It could be drunk now, but with its still crisp acidity, it will be better from the end of 2019.
title: Manuel Olivier 2018  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: A ripe wine, this is full in the mouth and full of fruit. Apricots and lemons go well together for a rich while crisp mouthful. The wood aging over 18 months only shows fleetingly, leaving fruit as the main thrust. It finishes with plenty of fresh acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Manuel Olivier 2018  Meursault

description: With the right intensity for a premier cru, this is a rich, lightly toasty wine. It has layers of chalky, mineral texture along with dense fruits and a sense of structure and potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2018 Domaine Drouhin-Vaudon Sécher Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Fresh, simple, apple-flavored wine, with an edge of citrus and soft vanilla flavors. The wine is attractive and clean with elegance coupled to ripe fruit.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015 St Amand  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Named after the river that flows past Chablis, this is a ripe, fruity wine, with yellow fruit flavors and good ripeness. Unoaked, it has good concentration as well as richness.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 La Sereine  (Chablis)

description: This soft, ripe wine is still developing its rich white fruitiness. For now, it's poised between acidity and a mineral structure. The creamier aspect of this wine is still to come, so keep until 2020.
title: Domaine Carrette 2019 Les Mûres  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is a steely wine, crisp and very textured. Lemon zest and acidity are given structure by the mineral character and by the touches of wood. It's a wine with a future, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2018 Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This is a blend of grapes from a number of Premier Cru parcels. It gives a rich, ripe and fruity wine with a good depth of flavor and strong signs of the wood aging. At this stage, the wood is leaving some bitterness and toast, but this will round out. Drink from 2021.
title: Manuel Olivier 2018 Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: An attractively ripe and mature wine with a great balance between the orangy citrus fruits and a tight, taut, mineral texture. The wine is rich in its dosage and fruitiness while showing signs of maturer toast and almond flavors. However, it could still age.
title: Duval-Leroy 2011 Clos des Bouveries Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Big, ripe, generous, this wine is on the rich side of the 2010 vintage. At this stage, it offers peach and apricot, with honeyed yeast flavors. The minerality crispens the texture, while black pepper and firm tannins suggest aging ability.
designation: Le Fief de Grenouilles Grand Cru
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Le Fief de Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A beautiful wine that has plenty of weight and also a firm structure of minerality to go with the yellow fruits that are now evolving into more mature flavors. It is by no means at its peak yet. Give it 2–3 years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This small property with its own château lies within the lower portion of Vaudésir but is considered a Grand Cru in its own right. The wine—the flagship of the cooperative—is opulent, showing strong wood aging flavors that will soften with time. Ripe and generous with yellow fruit flavor, it also boasts a tight mineral acidity and crispness, making it a good candidate for cellaring. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 Château Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine comes from one of the few white-wine vineyards in Vougeot. It is opulent and rich with creamed apple and ripe green plums. The fruit lies over the subtle wood aging that has smoothed the crisp texture. The wine is still young and will be best from 2021.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2021 Les Cras Premier Cru  (Vougeot)

description: Big and ripe, this rich wine offers a good combination of spice and tropical fruits. It is bold, smooth and creamy. Deliciously ripe, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine Michel 2021  Viré-Clessé

description: This dense wine is still very young. The fruit still needs to express itself in a wine that is broad and ripe. Give this rich wine, with its creamy texture and touches of spice from wood aging, until 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021 Les Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Made with skin contact and whole berry maceration to give extra flavor, this is a structured wine with a strong texture along with orange zest and light honey flavors. It is dense and concentrated. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Pinson 2019 Cuvée Mademoiselle  (Chablis)

description: The wine is dull, without great character other than some light fruitiness and a hint of wood aging. Drink now.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2018  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: A concentrated wine, just beginning to open up, with a serious, maybe austere mineral element, as well as vibrant kiwi and citrus flavors. It is softened by aging in older wood, giving some roundness to finish.
designation: Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve du Domaine
title: Pascal Bouchard 2012 Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve du Domaine  (Chablis)

description: A blend from a number of premier cru vineyards, pulling together cooler and warmer sites in balance. It's fresh and light, showing elegance, green fruits and a floral character. Just a touch of minerality.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 La Singulière Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This rich and generous wine has weight, concentrated yellow fruit and citrus flavors. Full bodied, its rounded texture is cut by a mineral element that brings the crisp acidity of the vintage. Developing well, it will be best from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This attractive wine offers lemon and sliced-apple fruitiness. It has a lively character, crisp, tangy and ready to drink.
title: Château La Greffière 2022  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine

description: This lively, crisply acidic wine hints at toast, but goes much more for a delicious citrus character. There's a great freshness to the wine, showing some pear flavors and a fine edge of apple skins.
title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Les Morats  (Saint-Véran)

description: A blend of young vines fruit gives a very soft, gently rounded wine with only the lightest of depth. The fruit is full, the flavors show some spice, while yellow fruit tastes roll around underneath. Drink now.
title: Vincent 2012 Marie Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Here's an 100% unoaked Chard that offers ripe tropical notes of mango and pineapple alongside flavors of rich red apple and canteloupe in the round mouth. Softly prickling acidity leads nicely into the fruity finish.
title: Le Drunk Rooster 2014 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: An attractive, fresh Chablis, with flavors of juicy currants, spice and lime juice. It is crisp and shows full final fruit and acidity.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014  Chablis

description: Just getting to maturity, this is hinting at toastiness while also retaining all the bright apple and citrus fruit flavors. The taut and steely texture brings out great freshness and a concentrated final acidity. It is just ready to drink.
designation: Cuvée Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2012 Cuvée Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: At this stage, this is a wood-dominated wine. Its potential is considerable because beneath this wood and toast awaits a wonderful range of ripe apples, apricots and mango that promise to develop into a full, generous wine. Keep until 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2018 Poruzots Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: The wine is fresh, its baked apple and green plum fruit cut with intense citrus. The vineyard, with its pure chalk soil, shows strongly in the minerality and steely texture of the wine, promising aging. Drink this complex wine from 2020.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2018 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The power and structure of a Corton-Charlemagne are very evident in this firm and closed wine. At this young stage, it is all about the concentrated texture and weight. The acidity and the rich fruits will come later. Drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2018 Corton Charlemagne Grand Cru  (Corton-Charlemagne)

description: The wine is soft, fruity and opulent, with apples and a touch of melon. It also has the fine Chablis steeliness that gives a crisp edge to the warm, ripe and rounded fruit. It still needs time to bring out the full fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Vaulorent Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Concentrated white fruits, layering melon, pear and red apples with the balancing acidity. For a Chablis, it is ripe and opulent, a delicious already approachable product of the warm year. It does have texture to age well.
designation: Cuvée Guy Moreau Vaillon Premier Cru
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2015 Cuvée Guy Moreau Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Opulent and rich, this is a concentrated wine with toast and fruit both showing strongly. The new wood flavors offer spice, while the fruit suggests pineapple, kiwi and fresh plums. Worth aging 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2015 Fourchaume Premier Cru Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: While it is rich, the wine is more dominated by the minerality and structure of Chablis. White fruits, melon and pear come through, with a citric edge and firm toast. It is taut and tense, ready to age.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2015 Les Vaupulans Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A wine that is destined for good aging, with its mineral structure and toast flavors. It has weight and richness but equally it has intense pear and citrus fruits layered with acidity. Age for at least four years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2016 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Powerful, concentrated Chablis. It is rich, with ripe apricot and nectarine fruit, laced with Seville orange acidity. With a touch of toast, a well-integrated structure, this is a wine for medium-term aging.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2015 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Closed at this stage, the wine has acidity, minerality and the potential of ripe pear and apricot fruit flavors. The wood is showing strongly but will integrate, while the texture promises good aging.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Truffières  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Very mineral in character, the wine has grapefruit and orange peel characters. It's taut, linear in style, with a lively acidity that cuts through the citrus and green apple fruits.
title: Camille Giroud 2014 Les Vergers  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wine, while rich, has all the minerality and crisp texture associated with the appellation. Wood aging adds spice. It needs some aging, not much, and will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This wine has weight and richness. It is ripe with apricot and peach flavors that are happily balanced by a crisp edge of acidity. Its texture will give it a good future. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This warm wine brings out the roundness and open accessibility of warm-climate Chardonnay. With yellow fruits and clean acidity, it is attractively ready to drink.
title: Bougrier 2021 Alain de la Treille Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Rich and full, the wood and yellow fruit flavors are well integrated with the ripe acidity. Generous as well as elegant, it's a wine to drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Toast and caramel aromas set the scene for this ripe, smooth wine. It has weight and richness, with a vanilla flavor that meshes with the yellow fruit. With all of its opulence, the acidity is lost somewhere, meaning the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2016  Mercurey

description: Bright and fruity, this has refreshing acidity. It has a lively apple flavor that gives a delicate fragrance and juiciness. With its taut, mineral texture, this is classic, unoaked Chablis.
title: Fourrey et Fils 2016  Chablis

description: With a definite wood aging character, the wine is ripe and rounded. It also has an attractively steely minerality that gives texture to the ripe pear and peach flavors. The aftertaste is more citrus.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Meursault

description: This is a single vineyard wine, richly textured and ripe. It shows the lively acidity of the vintage along with a warm feel that brings out peaches and green plums. Age for a couple of years or drink now.
title: Cave de Lugny 2017 La Carte  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: Superripe fruit gives the wine weight and richness, toast and peach and pineapple fruits. Old vines give the concentration and opulent fruit. Worth aging 2–3 years.
title: Manuel Olivier 2014 Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: On the steely, taut side of Chablis, this is a wine for aging. It has fine complexity, lemon and green plum flavors vying with a buttery edge. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: An impressively full wine, its ripe apricot flavors melding seamlessly into rich wood and concentrated flavors. The lemon acidity enlivens the ripe yellow fruits, leaving a rich final impression.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2014  Mâcon-Verze

description: This wine is produced from a range of small parcels right through the appellation (including some Premier Crus) to give a full ripe wine that has great acidity as well as spice from the wood aging. It is a wine that shows elegance as well as concentration and a fine balance between fruit and acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Les Pierres  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Nervy and racy, this has crisp acidity and a lively orange-zest texture. It's fruity, with upfront apple and grapefruit flavors, showing just a touch of a minerally character in the background.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2016 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: The softest of the Pouilly Fuissés produced by Duboeuf, this is a smooth, creamy and toasty wine. A peach note and warm, ripe fruits dominate. Very ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Light and fragrant, this emphasizes crisp apple and grapefruit flavors. It has a light, breezy character. Very ready to drink.
title: Château de Maligny 2016  Petit Chablis

description: Fresh and fruity, this has a ripe apricot character that contrasts the mineral acidity and bright fruit character. The wine dances lightly and is now ready to drink.
title: Michel Picard 2015  Bourgogne

description: A fresh, fruity, unoaked effort, this has lively acidity, with flavors of quince and pear and a soft, open texture. Screwcap.
title: Cave de Chardonnay 2016 Chardonnay de Chardonnay  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: A beautiful wine that has plenty of weight and also a firm structure of minerality to go with the yellow fruits that are now evolving into more mature flavors. It is by no means at its peak yet. Give it 2–3 years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Balancing sweet wood and mineral-driven citrus character, this is elegant and stylish, showing peach and grapefruit flavors. The wood, so fine, acts as balance and support. Age for 5–6 years.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2014  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Produced from the young vines of Château de Fuissé, this wine is soft and rounded with just enough acidity to go with the sweet peach flavors. It's a gentle wine, ready to drink now.
title: Vincent 2015 Marie-Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Structured and tight, this is a powerful wine, dominated by wood aromas and white fruit, with spice, wood and green herb flavors. There's a smokiness that comes from the soil, and to finish, very pure green fruits.
designation: Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent Premier Cru
title: William Fèvre 2011 Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A very warm, generous, ripe wine, this comes from the most precocious of the grand cru vineyards. It is packed with yellow fruits, rich and open. This is opulence in a glass, boosted by toast and spice.
title: William Fèvre 2011 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Open, generous and relatively opulent, showing all the richness of 2009, along with peaches, apricots and tropical fruits. It's round from start to finish, a luscious Chardonnay. Just some crispness at the end.
title: William Fèvre 2011 Bougros Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a wine that speaks of its terroir, the chalk soil coming out in a very mineral, austere character. It has elegance, class, great style of poise, showing acidity, fresh green fruits and a need to age for at least 5 years.
title: William Fèvre 2011 Premier Cru Montée de Tonnerre  (Chablis)

description: Very firm, this is a structured, relatively austere wine, with lots of minerality and tightness. The green fruits are  pierced with acidity, but also very fresh. A wine that needs time, give this at least 5–6 years. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2011 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is so closed up at the moment, all mineral and steel, that it is hard to feel the ripeness of the tropical fruit. As this develops, it will flesh out the yellow fruits, balancing the acidity. The aftertaste is already thirst quenching.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2011 Bougros Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine shows that top Chablis should be aged. This is like tasting the barebones of the wine without the flesh that is still very hidden. There is suppressed power, as well as green acidity and potential richness. Wait 5 years.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2011 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: The 18 acres of Château de Grenouilles are a monopoly of the La Chablisienne cooperative. A huge, ripe wine, very fruity, with yellow peaches. The richness is balanced with a steely core of minerality. Lively acidity finishes this impressive wine.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 Château Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A concentrated, hugely rich wine with lively caramel and toast aromas, followed by ripe fruits. It is generous and open, with apricots and nectarines giving richness, while kiwi gives the green, crisp character. The aftertaste is all minerality. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2011 Les Blanchots Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is pure mineral, chalk and lean austerity initially, but opens up with apples,  lime and green plums. It is intense, concentrated and structured; needs time. Wait 4–5 years.
designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Clos Grand Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2011 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
