description: A rich, lush melange of fruit and nuts, with sinuous, almost unctuous flavors that twine around the palate like a snake. Long, fascinating finish, elegantly balanced and precise.
title: Louis Latour 2004 Les Referts Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This perfumed, soft wine only slowly shows a more structured character. From a well-situated vineyard just above the Serein valley, it offers yellow fruits that are cut with tight citrus and minerality. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Dampt Père et Fils 2019 Beauroy Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: There are both ripe yellow and pineapple fruit flavors and tight minerality in this wine. That gives it the potential to age with its structure, spice from wood and fragrant acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2019 Domaine des Préauds  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A severe wine, its structure deriving from an important wood element and fruit tannins. It brings out apple and green plum skins, with a tangy texture that demands a few months aging.
title: Pierre André 2014 Le Rognet Premier Cru  (Ladoix)

description: This is a wood-aged Chardonnay that's smooth, creamy and rich. The wine has weight, with lemon and peach flavors as well as vanilla accents from the oak. Its current fruitiness will mature and broaden well, so keep this wine for at least four years.
title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2017 Cuvée Madeleine Chardonnay (Côtes du Tarn)

description: Intense acidity and a mineral texture show the northern origins of this wine. It is all citrus and grapefruit, the green apple flavors adding a tense texture.
title: Garnier et Fils 2016  Chablis

description: This is a young fruit salad of a wine although one that is ready to drink for its crisp acidity and sliced apple flavor. The wine has citrus and a mineral texture as well as a bright line in zesty orange. Drink now.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2021  Chablis

description: Milly-Lamartine is a village in the hills just north-west of Pouilly-Fuissé. Its style is for juicy and fruity wine like this. With hints of minerality, citrus and pear, the wine has a rounded character that is cut with acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2021 Closerie des Alisiers Domaine Carrette  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

description: The wine is ripe and creamy with a toasty vanilla character. With spice and juicy fruitiness, it is smooth and ready to drink. The aftertaste, with its zesty texture, gives the wine final complexity.
title: Domaine Trouillet 2021  Mâcon Solutré

description: The Devillard family has created a line of negociant wines, made from purchased grapes. This wine is properly crisp and mineral. It also has ripe yellow fruits and a perfumed floral character. It is still bursting with young fruit and will be better as it broadens out, so drink from 2021.
title: Domaines Devillard 2020 Le Renard  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This producer, based in the western Loire, has been able to take advantage of the cool ocean climate to produce a crisp, fruity Chardonnay. It is all fruit, citrus and white-plum flavored, with a soft, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignoble Malidain 2021 Le Demi-Boeuf Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: The Côtes d'Auxerre, west of Chablis, is the last outpost of Chardonnay in Burgundy. That results in this cool style of wine, light and fruity with apple and green-plum fruitiness. There is a zest to the wine, a lightly mineral texture and attractive final acidity. Drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2021  Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre

description: This is a soft, gently fruity wine. It comes from a single vineyard creating a wine that has rounded yellow and pear fruits and balanced acidity. It is a smooth wine, made to be drink young.
title: Cave de Lugny 2021 La Côte Blanche  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This is a light, crisp and fruity wine. Full of ripe green plums and crisp acidity, it is a wine that is all fruit. A light touch of minerality gives texture and complements the refreshing, floral aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2021 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: Produced from 100-year-old vines, this wine has been aged for nearly three years and has lost its intense fruitiness. Wood and spice flavors are present along with a perfumed intensity and toastiness. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2020 Aux Bouthières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has the weight that is typical of this appellation. It is full bodied, ripe with melon and yellow fruits. Contrasting with that, a crisper edge brings out minerality and a nervy texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2021 Les Macherelles Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Produced from vines close to the chateau of Santenay, this is a tight, mineral wine. It has intense crisp acidity, tangy citrus and excellent potential. The fruit is asking for time to fill out, so drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2021 La Comme Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Broad and rich, it has already developed to give ripe yellow and green fruits that have fully integrated into the fresher, mineral structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Jacques Charlet 2017 Les Vieux Murs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A strong wood element dominates this wine. It's all toasty and juicy from wood aging rather than fruit. It does have the weight to suggest some fruit for the future, but the wood, with its bite and tang, will always be a strong presence.
title: Vincent 2018 Marie Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Fresh and fruity, it shows crispness as well as white fruits, orange zest and a lively lemon aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine André Bonhomme 2018 Les Pierres Blanches  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This is a thouroughbred, elegant sparkler. With its delicate acidity, apple and grapefruit flavors, and tense, steely texture, it is an extremely well-blanced wine. Although it is ready to drink now, it could certainly age in bottle for many years.
designation: Extra Cuvée de Réserve Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pol Roger 2008 Extra Cuvée de Réserve Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The latest release of the legendary Comtes de Champagne comes from a great vintage. It has full, toasty bottle-age notes that give the wine depth of flavor, with a ripe, rounded mouthfeel and taut acidity. An almond note combines with the citrus-driven acidity on the finish.
designation: Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Taittinger 2008 Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Based in the Côte des Blancs, Nicolas Feuillatte has access to some fine Chardonnay for this mineral-textured wine. Lightly perfumed with white flowers, it is crisp and fresh, with sliced apple and lemon right up front. The wine is fruity now and will age well. Either drink now or wait for more maturity from 2021.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2012 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a rounded, ripe and full-bodied wine, with spice and light toastiness that give richness. Apple and green-plum flavors are enhanced by the creamy texture and touches of apricots. It is young and drinkable now, although will likely be much better from the end of 2020.
title: Chartron et Trébuchet 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is ripe with a texture that remains tangy while also showing rich yellow and white fruits. A rustic edge adds interest rather than detracting from the quality. With its acidity and zesty citrus character, the aftertaste leaves a fresh, crisp feeling. Drink now.
title: Château de Santenay 2018  Mercurey

description: An attractively fruity wine, it has apple flavors cut with lime juice. Bright, crisp and laced with acidity, it could age but is already delicious to drink.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2018 Clos Philippe-le-Hardi  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: In 2016, Pizay made two whites: one labeled Burgundy and this one labeled Beaujolais. This is more in the apéritif style, fresh and fruity, full of apple flavors and with a touch of citrus at the end. It's ready to drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2018  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Still very young, this wine is potentially crisp while also ripe. Citrus and yellow fruits present a fruit salad of flavors that are balanced by a more steely character. Drink from the end of 2018.
title: Cave de Lugny 2019 La Côte Blanche  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This ripe, spicy wine offers apple, pear and apricot flavors, giving ripeness and warm juicy acidity. The wine is smooth and rounded, with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2021  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Produced at Château Ravatys for négociant Florent Descombe, this wine is rich and creamy. Wood aging has given it light toastiness and fine, ripe white fruit flavor. Already sophisticated wine, it will age further and be better from 2022.
title: Florent Descombe 2020  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Unusually, this premier cru vineyard produces both red and white wines, both of which are made by this domaine. The wine is soft, rounded and with a ripe creamy character. It has plenty of crisp apple and rich pear flavors along with enough acidity to keep it bright and tangy. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2020 Les Bousselots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Old vines from the vineyard next to the winery produce a luscious full wine. With its pear, peach and ripe apple flavors, these 70-year-old vines show their richness and concentration. It is opulent, structured and packed with juicy acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2021 Vieilles Vignes de Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)

description: Ten months of wood aging has given this wine richness and fine spiciness. It is rich while still textured with minerality and tight citrus flavors. With its juicy acidity, the wine will age. Drink from 2022.
title: Philippe Jeannot 2021 Clos des Hâtes  (Santenay)

description: Toasty and ripe, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine full of yellow fruits lifted by crisp apple and lime juice. Rich while also fresh, it's a warm wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2020 Paquet Mathieu  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This open, soft wine brings out some of the ripe fruit flavors of the vintage. It has attractive melon and apricot fruit along with a tight streak of mineral acidity. It's ready to drink now, although it will be better from 2021.
title: Domaine Perraud 2021 L'Oeuvre de Perraud  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Delicately sparkling, this creamy Champagne is crisp, fruity and on the dry side of Brut. It has citrus as well as pear flavors giving a fruity edge to the lively texture. This delicious wine should age a little longer, so drink from 2023.
designation: Nuit Blanche Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: Petit & Bajan 2017 Nuit Blanche Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This crisp, tangy wine is packed with citrus flavors. Brightly textured with a mineral edge, it is fruity, hinting at spice along with a floral, fresh character.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2020 Domaine des Chenevières  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Ripe and fruity, this wine offers crisp apples and pear-juice flavors. It has a strongly tangy element that is refreshing and delicious now.
title: Louis Max 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ferret 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is rich and ripe, with just a touch of wood influence. It has a tropical fruit and lime flavor, with lemon zest acidity. It is full, very structured and mineral, adding the complexity of ripe fruit. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Big and rounded, this will eventually develop into a ripe, complex wine. Spice and toast notes merge with the yellow fruits and structured nervosity.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 La Romanée Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a floral wine that combines structure, firm acidity and intensely ripe fruit. Flavors of green fruit, citrus, toast and some smoke give complexity to this concentrated, full-bodied effort.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Les Combettes Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is a taut wine, touched by yeast and warmed by ripe yellow fruit. Flavors of melon and spice from the new wood give it an open feel. It's ripe, already rounded and full bodied.
title: Louis Latour 2016 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is a structured wine with rich, concentrated fruits. It has a strong mineral content along with a tense texture. Tropical fruit flavors come through on the rich, opulent finish.
title: Louis Latour 2016 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Steely, minerally and very textured, this has concentratio and taut layer of acidity to go with the lime fruit. Powered by its structure, it will age for 3–4 years.
title: Romain Bouchard 2016 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The premier cru is right in the heart of the appellation, close to the village. This wine, with its intense fruits and strongly textured character, is still trying out its structure and density. The potential is there with apricot and apple fruits waiting to come thorough the tight structure. Drink this fine wine from 2022.
title: Alex Gambal 2019 Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Produced from old vines, this is a beautiful wine. It has great structure, minerality and concentration along with a full-bodied richness that is developing well. Combined with the ripe yellow fruits, they give an opulent wine that will age for several years. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Fuissé 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a full-bodied, dense wine. A hint of austerity in the mineral texture gives the wine a steely core. Around this center, ripe fruit fills out the wine and gives apricots and generous fruitiness as well as a crisp, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2019 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: An intense, mineral-driven wine, tasting of the limestone soil as well as very ripe fruit. Great acidity keeps the richness in line, toast offering sweetness. The wine is full-bodied, the flavors going right through to the apple-skin-textured core.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2015 Clos Saint Marc Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: A taut, steely, very mineral wine, showing a tense, textured character. Fruit flavors run from grapefruit to peach, with a delicious tang of zest along the way. With its acidity and structure, this is a wine for long-term aging.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2015 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: A toasty, smoky wine, with freshening acidity, crisp green and white fruits and an attractive edge of toasty oak. The wine is lively, fresh, delicious, very poised and vibrant.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2013 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a ripe, wood-aged wine that shows the richer side of Meursault. It's generous with ripe yellow fruits, but balanced and complemented by crisp acidity and hints of toastiness. A fine wine with impeccable structure, it will age well, so drink from 2019.
designation: Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2017 Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Ripe, creamy wine with a good toast element. It is smooth, elegant, the flavors showing almonds, vanilla, baked apple and pear enlivened by fresh acidity. Attractive, ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Buissonnier Montagny  (Montagny)

description: A fresh, lightweight Chardonnay, hinting at citrus and almonds. There is a taut, tannic edge to the yellow fruits, the acidity turning to a firm texture. Final acidity is fresh and crisp.
title: Cave de Lugny 2014 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This ripe, yellow-fruit-flavored wine has a smooth, rich texture. Full and flavorsome, it conveys a ripe, nutty character. The wine with its warm fruitiness is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2021  Mâcon Solutré

description: Made from 65- to 80-year-old vines, this wine offers wood spice as well as apple and citrus fruit flavors. An underlying richness balances the acidity and crisp texture. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2021.
title: Bret Brothers 2020 Climat Sous les Plantes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Vines in deep red-iron soil on this tiny biodynamic family parcel (1.3 acres) are just coming into their own. This ripe wine balances rich yellow fruit with a tight shot of acidity and citrus. Fresh and crisp with touches of spice and butter., it is ready to drink.
designation: Domaine La Soufrandière Climat les Longeays
title: Bret Brothers 2020 Domaine La Soufrandière Climat les Longeays  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: The magnificently named vineyard, the seat of God, is set in the hills next to Saint-Aubin. This wine is crisp while also having a warm, rich backdrop of yellow fruit. The chalk soil gives the wine its tight minerality and texture. It will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Château de Santenay 2020 Clos de la Chaise Dieu  (Hautes Cotes de Beaune)

description: Crisp apple flavors show strongly in this wine that offers good acidity and a tight, lively aftertaste. The brightness pushes the citrus character forward, leaving a lively, refreshing aftertaste.
title: Albert Bichot 2020 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is ripe and full, with a soft, creamy character that is warm and smooth. A light brushing of toast brings out spice. This attractive, rounded wine is ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2020 Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Spicy, fruity and attractive, this balanced wine has acidity, tight minerality, yellow fruits and a richer texture. Full bodied and generous, it will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Christophe Cordier 2020 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Rich and creamy, rounded by toast and honey with some spiced fruits. The texture is more wood than fruit, needing time to evolve.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2014 Les Chailloux  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Really toasty, honey and lemon style of Chardonnay, tight and crisp. There are plenty of green plum and grapefruit flavors. Deliciously crisp, while also ripe.
title: Bret Brothers 2014 Domaine la Soufrandière  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: While there is a somewhat meaty edge to this wine, it also has good rich texture. It probably needs time to bring out the full potential of its ripe yellow fruits.
title: Bret Brothers 2014 En Carementrant  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A wine that is full in the mouth, offering some wood flavors, also some tight acidity and a final, crisp edge.
title: Château de Fuissé 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Ripe tropical-fruit flavors give this wine a rich, rounded character. The attractive apricot and peach fruits are cut by citrus acidity to keep the freshness right up front. An opulent, full-bodied wine, it's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine le Virolys 2020  Viré-Clessé

description: The wine is from a tiny parcel (around an acre) of vines that are over 30-years-old. It is concentrated both with fine fruit and sweet acidity. Yellow fruits are cut with lime and green plums. A touch of vanilla gives the wine a full final aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2021 La Grande Bruyère  (Mâcon-Fuissé)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ferret 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: With Chardonnay from Provence the dominant partner in this blend with Burgundian Chardonnay, this wine is soft and unoaked, with melon and yellow fruit flavors. It has light acidity, enough to give the wine freshness. It is ready to drink.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2020 100 Series Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: A simple, straightforward wine, this has an attractive mineral, tangy texture to go with the bright citrus fruit. Crisp and refreshing, it is ready to drink.
title: Château de Santenay 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine is light and fruity with citrus and red apples. It misses out on crispness, giving a more rounded character. It should be kept for a few months and drunk from 2021.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2021  Mâcon-Charnay

description: Light and fruity, this is an easy, immediately accessible wine. Soft apple and creamed-pear flavors are balanced with acidity and a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2021  Mâcon-Villages

description: Ripe and full, this is an apricot-and melon-flavored wine. With this ripeness comes a soft texture that offers some warm acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. From 50+-year-old vines, the wine is attractive now and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2020 Domaine des Granges  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The fruit here is attractive, pears and white currants on top of pink grapefruit and orange zest. It shows its structure and its tense minerality only slowly, allowing the acidity to give it a lift and vibrancy. This is a wine that is still young, still smoothing out its hard edges.
designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2012 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Very concentrated and closed up, like a coil. The intense green fruit is followed by plum skins. Crispness, dry but fresh, comes alongside a powerful explosion of flavors.
title: Albert Bichot 2011 Domaine Long-Depaquit Vaudésirs Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Steeliness exemplified in wine. This is crisp and structured, complex with its green fruits, structured acidity and touch of caramel and kiwi. It's the acidity that shows at the moment; needs 4–5 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Generous in style, with great freshness. The flavors are rich, touched by caramel, ripe white currants and some spice. A fine, red apple skin structure comes through to finish.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2011 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is the second wine from the Château Grenouilles vineyard, very fresh, but at the same time weighty and concentrated, with wood, caramel and generous fruits. Age for 5 years.
designation: Les Fiefs de Grenouilles Grand Cru
title: La Chablisienne 2011 Les Fiefs de Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A fruity wine, it has fresh citrus and pear flavors. It is very light with just hints of texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2018  Petit Chablis

description: Juicy and fruity, this has apple and lemon flavors that combine with a steely edge. It's refreshing and crisp, with a bright, lively character, and a tang on the finish.
title: La Chablisienne 2016 La Sereine  (Chablis)

description: Ripe and full bodied, this is a wine that reflects the softness of the vintage. Aged in wood, it has a rounded texture, with spice, apricot and pineapple flavors, finishing with a touch of acidity.
title: Michel Picard 2015 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Opulent and ripe, full bodied and rich, this has notes of toast and spice as well as apricot and pear flavors. With its balanced character, it can be consumed now, but it will also age for another year.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine Beranger  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A delicious, mineral structured wine, very pure. The acidity is a great layer going through the textured white fruits, the wood just there as a subtle support.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Soft in character and rounded, this is a full-bodied wine, feeling fat and gently textured. The yellow fruits are sweet, ripe, buoyed by wood and finishing with attractive acidity.
designation: Domaine des Deux Roches Les Cras
title: Collovray et Terrier 2014 Domaine des Deux Roches Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: Swathes of ripe fruit over a broad layer of wood, a generous, opulent character, ripe, the spice from wood giving a good, rich final character.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2014 Cray vers Vaux  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This wine is rich, concentrated and ripe. With its opulent mix of yellow fruits, citrus and sliced apple—a real fruit salad—it is also balanced with spice and wood flavors. The fruit is rich and will develop well. Drink this from 2024.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2020  Bienvenues Bâtard-Montrachet

description: Initially showing considerable wood flavors, this wine hints at its rich fruit through its weight and concentration. Spice, toast and beautifully ripe yellow fruits are slowly coming together and will harmonize with time to showcase a rich, opulent and impressive selection. Drink from 2022.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019  Corton Vergennes

description: The Barrel Selection certainly has no qualms about hiding its true colors. The nose offers ripe stone fruit supported by hints of butter and cream, while the mouth presents a prickly acidity and clean citrus flavors that prevent the wine from landing with a thud. A solid selection that will pair well with most poultry dishes.
title: La Forge Estate 2013 Barrel Selection Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: White wines are rare in the Côte de Nuits and this wine is as structured as many reds. It does have strong toast flavors, a juicy citrus character and pear flavors. They go with an apple skin and spice aftertaste, laced with acidity. Drink until 2022.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2017 Les Monts de Boncourt  (Côtes de Nuits Villages)

description: L'Homme Mort is a northern extension of the Fourchaume Premier Cru vineyard, so called because this was where a local lord dispensed justice by death. It often produces cooler wines such as this. It is tight, with toasted bread hints and with a strongly tangy character. It does need to develop and shouldn't be drunk before 2022.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2020 L'Homme Mort Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From old vines, this rich and concentrated wine is dominated by ripe apple and pear flavors. They combine with the well-judged toastiness from wood aging to give a full, dense wine will age well. Drink from 2022.
designation: Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru
title: Domaine Laroche 2019 Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Fruity and attractively wood aged, this is soft and round, with a bright edge of acidity that brings out the taut, refreshing finish.
title: Albert Bichot 2016  Bourgogne

description: Smoky and with strong wood flavors, this wine also has an attractive crisper edge that gives it a bright character. A lively wine, it's both rich and crisp. Drink now.
title: Meurgey-Croses 2021 Vieilles  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This soft, ripe wine has good apricot and peach flavors alongside the crisper citrus acidity. It is spicy, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château de Beauregard 2021 Vignes Blances  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Beaujolais Blanc is effectively Burgundy-type Chardonnay but from the southern neighbor Beaujolais region. This wine, with its ripe and creamy texture, has the same rich character as a Mâcon wine. It is smooth and soft from a warm vintage for white wines. Drink this wine now.
title: Château de Lavernette 2021 Les Vignes de la Roche  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This fruity wine is full of bright acidity. Crisp and clean, it shows yellow fruits and a shot of citrus. The aftertaste is lively and bright. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2022 Clos de la Bressande  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Bright and fruity, this delicious wine is crisp, clean and refreshing. With yellow fruits followed by zesty acidity, it's both open and textured. Drink now.
title: Domaine Touzot 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: From vines in the vineyards behind the Côtes de Nuits, this wine is warm, smooth and ripe. It offers yellow fruits as well as rich apple and enough acidity to give a crisp edge. It's attractive and will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: Strongly mineral in character, this is a crisp, tight wine that is still young, bright with acidity and citrus flavors. The touches of wood are just right and give an extra dimension to this fruity wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Philippe Colin 2020  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: The chalk soil of the appellation is reflected well in this tangy, mineral wine that shows hints of the wood aging in large barrels, which rounds out the crisp fruits and gives a pinch of spice. The wine is still young and will be better from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020  Meursault

description: Named after the current generation's grandmother, this wine comes from family vines. It is crisp with the strong mineral character typical of the vintage. The acidity and citrus fruits are up front and ready to drink now.
title: Vincent 2020 Marie-Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Valmur is considered to produce a generous style of Grand Cru, and this wine lives up to that. It's warm and rounded while never losing touch with the crisper side of a great Chablis. The ripe white and yellow fruits are on the rich side, cut with citrus acidity and underlined by wood aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2018 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Wood and fruit balance in this rich and full wine. The yellow and citrus fruits give a good mix of ripeness and a fresher, more mineral character. The toast, just the right amount, gives the warmth and polish the wine needs. The result is a serious wine, still young, to be drunk from 2022.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2018 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Crisp and edgy, this is a ripe while crisp and cool wine. With bright acidity and tangy lemon zest, it's a still young and full of citrus fruits. The mineral, taut texture promises some good aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2018 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A warm, rich wine, with cream and butter flavors lying over the more textured acidity. The wood is just noticeable, adding its smoky character to the yellow fruits and citrus.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Les Folatières  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This wonderful, mineral wine boasts the ripe apricot and peach fruits of the year combined with a taut texture, well-integrated wood and a great waft of citrus to close.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Folatières  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Fruity and structured, this strongly wood-aged wine is packed with toast. That dominates the fresh apple and pear fruits that are underneath all this spice and toastiness. Rich and full bodied, the wine is still developing, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Ferret 2018 Cuvée Hors Classe Les Ménétrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: An attractive, rich and creamy Chardonnay, this balances acidity with  tropical fruit and wood flavors. Made using fruit from a parcel in the Haute-Serre Vineyard, this is a wine that has an edge of minerality as well as ripe, textured fruit.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Haute-Serre Albesco Chardonnay (Lot)

description: Just below the main street of Chassagne-Montrachet village, this vineyard has produced a beautiful wine. Apples and crisp citrus are allied with the lightest touch of wood to give a dancing, juicy wine with serious depths of flavor. Bright and young to drink now, it will age gently into a riper future. Drink now, but the wine will be much better from 2022.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2019 La Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Ripe, tropical-fruited wine, with apricot and peach and layers of toasty wood. The wine is fresh, finely balanced, finishing with a citrus hint.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2014 Les Cras  (Vougeot)

description: Rich in character, with big citrus, pineapple and pink grapefruit flavors. Even if it is rich, the wine also gives freshness as well as acidity to balance the full-bodied texture
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2015 Clos de Mazeray  (Meursault)

description: A light, floating style, pierced with minerality and crisp green apple skin flavors. There is wood, but it is only just noticeable. With its structure and tense fruit, this is likely to age well: give it 5–8 years.
title: Labouré-Roi 2011 Château Labouré-Roi Premier Cru Poruzot  (Meursault)

description: Gentle and open, this is a ripe, apricot flavored wine. It has light acidity, its pleasure coming from the generous, full texture. It's ready to drink now.
title: Cave de Lugny 2017 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is a warm, honey- and apple-flavored wine. It's fresh and full in the mouth with tight mineral acidity. It could well age a year or two, but is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Talmard 2017  Mâcon-Chardonnay

description: Ripe and fruity, this has a rich texture that comes both from the generous white fruits and from the cut of lemon acidity. A mineral-textured wine, it's crisp now and will likely round out to bring out the ripeness. Drink from 2023.
title: Château de Santenay 2021  Puligny-Montrachet

description: With its crisp texture, this wine is bright and fruity, with good acidity and a complex background of spice, vanilla and yellow fruits. The wine is deliciously balanced and ready to drink.
title: Collin-Bourisset 2021 Château la Vernalle  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: From the highest point in the Meursault vineyards, this wine is crisp and cool. It has a tight, bright character that is driven by the steely, mineral texture. The grapefruit flavors go with the riper apple and pear roundness to give a wine that will take a little time to develop. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2020 Château de Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This wine has spice, juicy wood and good acidity that are well integrated. The rich, smooth fruit character contrasts with the more tangy wood acidity. Together, they bring a wine that has bite, with a mineral as well as toasty aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Verget 2020 La Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Produced from a small vineyard in Pouilly Fuissé, this rich wine is full of ripe, generous fruit. Spice and yellow-fruit flavors blend seamlessly with the soft texture and perfumed acidity. It is developing into a very fine wine, ready to drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2021 Aux Chailloux  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine offers pure fruit flavors of crisp lemon, ripe apricots and apples, all nourished by carefully judged wood that gives a touch of toast. A strong mineral element gives the wine tight texture. As it develops, this will become a well-balanced wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2019 Les Tillets  (Meursault)

description: This is a fruity wine with lively acidity and a brisk, zingy character. Freshness shoots through the wine, making it lively with hints of yellow fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and ripe.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2020 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Aged in wood for 15 months, this wine shows ripe flavors more from fruit than toast. Apricot and Williams pear flavors are richly integrated with the light spice and the lemon crispness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Rijckaert 2020 L'Epinet  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Planted in a parcel in the Château Montus vineyard, this gold colored, rich Chardonnay is balanced now and perfectly ready to drink. It shows wood aging flavors along with hints of juicy yellow fruits that are moving towards maturity.
title: Vignobles Brumont 2015 Le Chardonnay d'Alain Brumont Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Full and ripe, this wine also has good acidity that gives a lively edge to the yellow-fruit flavors. Along with the peach and apricot fruits, it presents refreshing crispness. The aftertaste delivers a great lift of acidity.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2020  Mâcon-Davayé

description: This wine is bone-dry, although with some age the shock of the acidity has been rounded out by a hint of toast. It's linear, fresh and intensely crisp, with citrus and almond tones. Drink this wine from a good vintage now.
title: Aubry 2015 Le Nombre d'Or Brut Nature Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This delicious, refreshing wine is textured, tight and mineral, with fruity acidity. Tangy and crisp, it has a tight structure, touches of toast along with apple and citrus flavors. The wine is still young and very tight, so should not be drunk before 2021.
title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2019 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Produced from a 2.5-acre parcel of vines planted in 1949, this is a sophisticated wine. It has a fine balance of fruit, maturity and concentration. Its fruit richness lends weight and a fast-maturing quality. Drink from 2022.
designation: Mes Vieilles Vignes Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: José Dhondt 2015 Mes Vieilles Vignes Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Rich, deliciously fruity and ripe, this combines warmth with a more mineral undertow that cuts through the palate, creating a wine that is refreshing and mouth-filling. It would be worth aging for two years or more.
title: Albert Bichot 2016 Domaine Long-Depaquit  (Chablis)

description: In perfect balance now, this is a great expression of mineral-driven Chardonnay. Its acidity is a vehicle for the crisp flavors of pear and lime, with a hint of ginger. It's still young, so drink it now for its great fruit, or age for four more years.
designation: Spécial Club Chouilly Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Roland Champion 2013 Spécial Club Chouilly Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A heavily wood-aged wine, this wine has smoky, burnt-toast aromas. At the moment, ripe yellow-fruit flavors are submerged beneath this onslaught of wood, but it should integrate better, so give it until 2020.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2017 Mersault-Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Freshness is the hallmark of this attractively crisp, apple-flavored wine. The lightness of texture manages to retain some good green plum skin, apricot and lively acidity. The finish is pure, clean, slightly honeyed.
title: Domaine Pommier 2013  Petit Chablis

description: Rich and rounded with a creamy texture, this wine is ripe with apricots and has a strongly mineral character. Full of fruit, the wine also has a texture that means it needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2021 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wine is fresh, bright and light, with citrus and ripe yellow fruits. Crisp, light and aromatic, it's ready to drink.
title: Château des Jacques 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

description: The wine is all about fresh apples and pears, with just a hint of smokiness and mineral texture. Crisp, with great acidity, it's ready to drink now, bright, full in the mouth and very fruity.
title: Château de Chatelard 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

description: From parcels of old vines, a smooth, wood- influenced wine. Flavors of ripe yellow fruits emerge from the vanilla toast character. It is rich, velvet textured, feeling opulent.
title: Roger Lassarat 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Saint-Véran)

description: On the fresh side, with crisp bright, lively acidity. Green fruits run well alongside apricot juice and lively vivacity. Good and attractive.
title: Thibert Père et Fils 2014 Vignes Blanches  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Ripe, full-bodied wine, the fresh white currant and pear fruits layered with wood. The wine is bright with good concentration. Screwcap.
title: Verget 2014 Clos Saint-Pierre  (Mâcon-Charnay)

description: Now at its peak, this impressive wine has moved from fruit to maturity, adding toastiness to its acidity and giving the wine richness. It's full and ripe while keeping the taut, steely edge proper to a Chardonnay Champagne. There's no need to age further. Drink now.
designation: Belle Epoque Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Perrier Jouët 2010 Belle Epoque Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Les Fourneaux is one of the smallest premier crus. Rich and balanced, this wine is full of pear and apricot flavors. It combines a minerally edge with a generous structure and fruitiness. Delicious now, but keep it for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2017 Les Fourneaux Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Fruity and rounded, this has attractive, citrus-like acidity that cuts through the caramel and apricot flavors. There is a delicious, forward orange-juice flavor that adds to the fresh feel of the wine. It's ready to drink, although it will also age.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016 Sentier du Clou Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This wine is concentrated and full in the mouth, and it bears a minerally texture and intense acidity. It's packed with flavors of sweet peach, lime, ripe Rocha pear and spice from the wood maturation. This promises to age for several years.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2016  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Only a small portion of this vineyard is planted with Chardonnay, and it has produced a minerally wine that's both crisp and ripe. The acidity is dominant at this stage, which lends the palate a juicy, peach- and citrus-like character. This wood-aged selection needs time.
designation: Clos de la Croix de Pierre
title: Louis Jadot 2016 Clos de la Croix de Pierre  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This wine is toasty and rich upfront, with decadent aromas of cedar-grilled apple and peach pit that are graced with hints of garribue and gardenia. The floral character gains intensity on the palate, before giving way to fresh fruit flavors of apple slices and lemon pith. It's well balanced and clean on the close; drink now.
title: Les Collines du Bourdic 2022 Le Prestige Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: A round and generous wine, the pair of an equally rich red wine, this is full and ripely fruity. A soft, creamy texture underlines the broad fruitiness. The apple and melon fruit is softening and filling to give a delicious, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2021  Bourgogne

description: Crisp and bright, this wine has retained plenty of acidity even in this ripe vintage. Attractive and spicy, it offers citrus fruits as well as apricots. Drink now.
title: Rijckaert 2021 Verchères  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This unoaked Chardonnay offers bright aromas of red apple and white peach, laced with the faintest hint of hay and yellow flower. It's light and zippy on the palate, with a lemon-lime freshness and a green plum flavor that results in a tart and refreshing finish.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne
title: Laroque 2021 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)

description: This is a soft wine, light and fresh. It has a citrus character, lemon squeezed over apples that give crispness. Some minerality to the texture adds interest and puts the wine in the food-friendly category. Drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2020  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This Chardonnay from Marcel Grillet's horse-plowed biodynamic vineyard called Pizay is still very young, showing a candy, confected flavor that needs to calm down. It has the potential for attractive fruit from 2020.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2020  Beaujolais Blanc

description: No doubt this is meant to be a slightly more serious attempt at sparkling wine, but it merely succeeds in being pleasant. Obvious citrus and earth aromas add hints of ginger on the palate. It's slightly creamy in texture, finishing clean and fresh.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2010 Brut Chardonnay (Vin Mousseux)

description: Just an edge of butter gives this wine roundness and extra richness. Along with this character comes ripe peach fruit, lifted with acidity. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2016 Kimmeridgien  (Bourgogne)

description: Caramel and vanilla aromas, the palate rounded, poised, with pear and green plum flavors, along with lively acidity, filled out with toast.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2013 Perrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: From what is always the Grand Cru that develops most quickly, this is a gorgeous, already very drinkable, ripe wine, certainly fresh. Maybe there is a more mineral character than usual, allied to higher acidity.
title: William Fèvre 2014 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: There is an explosion of ripe yellow fruit here, giving a ripe, tropical feel. Spice, mango, it's quite a powerhouse of flavors. This is a gorgeous, opulent wine.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: This soft, smooth and creamy wine has attractive spice and vanilla from the wood aging, along with light citrus and peach flavors. Ripe and full in the mouth, it has a touch of minerality at the end to give a fine texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Louis Jadot 2018  Bourgogne

description: This wine is fruity, with crisp, fresh lemon flavors. It is lightly textured and smooth, with green fruit acidity and a creamy aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Jadot 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: Brilliantly fresh, this wine is tight with acidity and textured with zingy citrus. Layers of apple and toast are already integrated in this bright wine. It's tangy, lively and likely to be ready to drink from 2021. The wine comes from the highest vineyard in Chassagne.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2019 En Pimont  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a lightly wood-aged wine, with crisp acidity and just a hint of toast. The fruit is upfront, showing a crisp, tight lemon character that's tangy and refreshing. Drink now.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 La Pierrelée  (Chablis)

description: A simple but easy-to-drink Chardonnay with soft aromas and flavors of ripe red apple and pear. Medium weight with a solid, clean finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 Bistro Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Soft and broad, a little unfocused, the fruit showing pear juice and green apple skins. It feels light, juicy, missing concentration, and there's a caramel toast aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Buissonnier Côte Chalonnaise Chardonnay  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: Open, soft, creamy, along with a candied fruit character. There is freshness here, with the acidity dominant on the finish.
title: Signé Vigneron 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: Tropical fruit and new wood flavors thread this opulent, seductive Chardonnay. It has surface glamor, with its flavors of ripe mango, peach and toast. Under the surface, the flavors are simple, softly textured.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2016  Bourgogne

description: Complex and rich, this is full of tangy fruits, with a dense structure that brings out weight, minerality and a chewy core of zesty citrus. It very crisp and fruity at this stage and needs to develop its many other flavors. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Dense and rich, this shows structure as well as powerful fruits. It comes from a parcel of chalk soil at the southern end of Pouilly Fuissé. The wine is firm, concentrated, packed with yellow fruits as well as layers of acidity and toast structure. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Fuissé 2018 Les Combettes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Spécial Club is a grouping of growers who taste each other's wines and approve them for Club status. This is certainly an impressive wine, seamlessly moving from freshness to richness via a steely texture. It is still impressively young and fruity, a bright, crisp wine that will age for several more years. Drink from 2020.
designation: Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2012 Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Produced in the west of Gascony, with a strong oceanic influence, this Chardonnay is cool, fruity and with bright acidity. It does have a creamy texture that fills out the fruitiness. It is an attractive, ripe wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Herré 2021 La Galope Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Open, soft, creamy, along with a candied fruit character. There is freshness here, with the acidity dominant on the finish.
title: Signé Vigneron 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a fruity wine, with upfront peach and apricot flavors. It has bright acidity and just a hint of wood. Produced for the first time by Ferret, this selection is rich, open and generous, although the acidity is never left behind.
title: Domaine Ferret 2016 Sous Vergisson  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A soft wine without real definition, it has an attractive fruity character, but it's missing the firm structure of the appellation. With its vanilla and apricot flavors, this ripe Chardonnay is ready to drink.
title: Jaffelin 2016  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: There is warmth to this fruity, ripe wine. It shows great balance between its intense acids and fruitiness, making it delicious and ready to drink.
title: Antonin Rodet 2016 A. Rodet  (Bourgogne)

description: The grandest of the Chablis Grand Crus has produced a structured, still very young, wine. With its ripe apple and Bartlett pear fruit and tight, chalky mineral texture, it will be impressive once it unwinds. Drink from 2024.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2020 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: From the most southerly of the Grand Cru vineyards, this wine is firm and tightly structured. Its wood aging shows in its toasty, spicy character that will integrate as the wine ages. Its rich yellow fruit and taut acidity suggest it will taste best from from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 Blanchot Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: From the grandest of the Grand Cru vineyards, this wine is powerful and structured. Its intense white and yellow fruit gains extra richness from subtle wood aging. It's juicy, ripe and full in the mouth. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Beautifully rich for such a lowly appellation in the Burgundy hierarchy. It is soft, open, dense, with ripeness and balancing acidity as well as flavors of pineapple and citrus pointing up the richness, just touched by wood.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2012  Bourgogne

description: The wood is too much for the fruit with this wine. At this stage in its development, there is a bitter, high toast character that dominates the white fruits. Underneath all this toast, there are hints of fresh apples and cream flavors. Give it at least a year.
title: Michel Picard 2012 Clos Saint Jean Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Unusually, this premier cru vineyard produces both red and white wines, both of which are made by this domaine. The wine is soft, rounded and with a ripe creamy character. It has plenty of crisp apple and rich pear flavors along with enough acidity to keep it bright and tangy. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2020 Les Bousselots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a crisp style of Chablis, bringing out a steely side while keeping fruitiness to the fore. Apple and freshly sliced melon are given texture by the citrus zest and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2018  Chablis

description: From one of the small wine areas close to Chablis, this delicious, steely, crisp wine has fine acidity and a tight texture. It's cool, fresh and refreshing with a light, dancing aftertaste.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2018 Vézelay  (Chablis)

description: This is a ripe wine, full of rich tropical fruits as well as the more typical Chablis acidity and steel. It feels broad, layering the crispness and citrus with a tangy texture. Keep this wine for at least a year.
title: Domaine Corine Perchaud 2016 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The wine is fresh and crisp with a tangy texture that suggests a strongly mineral character. Slowly, a more creamy feel comes through, bringing out melon and pear flavors. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2017 Colette  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: Soft and round, it offers an attractive white flower aromatic character, yellow fruits and a touch of citrus. It's smooth and already very drinkable.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2019 Solaire  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: This is rich and surprisingly warm for the normally cool appellation of Pernand Vergelesses. It makes for an attractive, ripe and creamy wine that's been given a wood aging. But it doesn't have a sense of place.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2018  Pernand-Vergelesses

description: Crisp and young, this wine, from 50-year-old vines, is tangy and strongly mineral in texture. It is full of fresh fruit that reflects the of organic and biodynamic farming. The green fruits will fill out as it ages. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Lavernette 2020 Maison du Villard  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This ripe, creamy wine has apricot flavors laced with citrus acidity. Lightly textured, it is still developing and needs to age for the next few months. Drink from the end of 2020.
title: Vignerons de Mancey 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: This attractive, lightly honeyed wine has apple and fresh pear flavors. Fresh, fruity and crisp, it finishes with a youthful lift that suggests it will be better from mid-2020.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2019 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: In this generous and opulent wine, weight and richness accompany acidity and power. Ripe yellow and white fruits are given a touch of spice and new wood. It's gorgeous, but will be better after aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2017 Les Demoiselles  (Chevalier-Montrachet)

description: While showing some smoky wood, this wine is more about pure fruitiness with yellow fruit flavors given a crisper shot with acidity. Full-bodied and rich, the wine keeps a refreshing brightness. The aftertaste is crisp and fruity.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2017 Genevrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Ripe and full-bodied, this immense wine has rich layers of tropical fruits. The wine, like so often in Corton-Charlemagne, is a powerful, huge expression of Chardonnay. It does have balance from acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2017  Corton-Charlemagne

description: This Burgundian producer has made a lightly wood-aged, ripe wine. It shows sophisticated balance between ripe fruit and spicy acidity and is smooth, generous and ready to drink.
title: Doudet Naudin 2022 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: With its potent mixture of intense fruit and equally concentrated structure, this wine is an obvious candidate for long-term aging. Showing ripe yellow fruit, almond hints and a strong mineral texture, it will develop slowly and be best from 2022. This vineyard, one of the most familiar of Puligny-Montrachet's premier crus, is also one of the highest on the slope.
title: Louis Jadot 2020 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Beautifully rich, this wine is ripe and full of concentrated fruit. It's generous and full bodied, while retaining tight acidity and minerality. Juicy white fruit flavor shows strongly, allied to the still-very-young acidity and texture, suggesting long life ahead. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Billaud-Simon 2020 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Widely regarded as the most majestic of the Chablis Grand Crus, Les Clos has produced a properly impressive and richly dense wine. It has the crispness of the vintage, tight minerality and ripe fruit flavors that contrast apricot and citrus. This is a serious, structured wine ready for aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2020 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Wood aromas along with ripe tropical fruits are the hallmarks of this fully ripe, marvelous wine. It is structured, rich, its fruit given a light cinnamon pinch from the wood. It is so delicious, it could be drunk now, but that would be a shame. Wait until 2021.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2017  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Very intense, very nervy wine, living on a thin wire of grapefruit and other citrus flavors but much more about pure structure. The aftertaste shows great concentration.
title: Pierre Moncuit 2002 Non-Dosé Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: While the name means “burnt,” it really refers to the southern exposure of this warm vineyard. Wood aged in new barrels, this wine has a toasty character that is well balanced by the rich fruits. Acidity and a mineral texture give this wine aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Fuissé 2020 Les Brûlés  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: There's a subtle flinty character to the nose of this Chardonnay, supported by more assertive notes of toasted apple, tangerine, pear and lime rind. It's a well-balanced selection, with a bright finish that offers a soft toasted spice accent on the close.
title: Domaine de Baronarques 2019 le Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: Starting with green acidity, this wine opens up well to give cool lemon and mineral flavors. These are followed by a creamy texture that softens the acidity, giving a ripe, full finish.
title: Maison Champy 2012  St.-Romain

description: Behind the main slope of the Côte de Beaune, Saint-Romain produces some delicious white wines that have extra freshness. This wine, all fruit and light mineral texture, offers apricot and peach flavors that are cut with acidity. The aftertaste adds a more mineral element. Drink from 2020.
title: Alex Gambal 2019  Saint-Romain

description: With its straw color and wood aging aromas, this is rich, bearing yellow peach and pear fruits, along with a toast note and juicy acidity. It's already impressive but should drink well for another three years at least.
title: Domaines Devillard 2016 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: Concentrated and rich, with some wood influence, this has ripe yellow fruits that are balanced with an intense streak of acidity, lending a sense of tension. It's very full, round and already a delight to drink.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 En Remilly Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: There is a touch of wood here, partnering with the wine's weight, minerality and crisp character. White fruit flavors of apple and pear lend further brightness.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Meursault

description: Round and rich, this has streaks of lemon and orange zest that cut through the vanilla and creamed apple texture. A note of spice makes the wine complex and rich. This is worth aging for several years.
title: Château de Maligny 2016 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a very mineral driven wine—the ripe fruit is cut with acidity, green fruits and herbs. Textured and ripe, its freshness is a counterpoint to the full fruit flavors.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Les Chaumes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wine is soft, creamy and light. Attractive acidity along with a fresh apple character gives a fresh aftertaste. Drink now. This is one of the first vintages since Labouré-Roi, which was hit by scandal in 2016, passed into new ownership.
title: Labouré-Roi 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: There is an attractive orange-zest tang to this rounded wine. It brings out ripe yellow fruits that have acidity to add to the mineral texture of this balanced wine. It is ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Collection  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is a soft wine, ripe with apricot and melon flavors. It shows the warmth of the vintage, round and gently fruity. Almonds and a tangy aftertaste give a crisp finish.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Laurent Dufouleur Cuvée Eléonore  (Bourgogne)

description: There are pretty white-flower aromas that grace the bouquet of this wine, with a supporting core of pink apple, peach and ripe honeydew. Despite its light weight, there's a pleasant roundness to the midpalate, with lasting fruit impressions on the close.
title: Calmel & Joseph 2022 Villa Blanche Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: Apple aromas give this wine a lift even before it has begun. The crispness and the delicious acidity are refreshing, bringing out minerality and brightness. Drink from 2022.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2022 Floréal  (Mâcon Chaintré)

description: This crisp, citrus-flavored wine has bright acidity and a touch of vanilla. It has great fruitiness, dominated by lemon with the tang of orange zest. It is ready to drink.
title: Château de Pizay 2022  Bourgogne

description: Crisp and lively, this is a tight and mineral wine. Baked-apple fruitiness is balanced by bright acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2021 Tradition  (Saint-Véran)

description: This open, fruity wine is ready to drink. It offers some spice as well as a light smattering of apple and toast flavors. The aftertaste is all about fruit and acidity.
title: Château de Beauregard 2020  Saint-Véran

description: At the moment, this is a tight, young wine with fruit that is masked. There is some potential that will give a wine with apple flavors. Wait to drink this until 2021.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2020  Saint-Véran

description: There's a subtle hint of toasted brioche to the ripe peach and baked apple core of this medium-bodied wine. Ample acidity keeps the palate fresh, while accents of citrus rind, peach pit and baking spice carry through to the close.
title: Arrogant Frog 2021 Lily Pad White Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: With just a touch of bottle age giving a toasty character, this impressive wine is already showing some maturity. That said, the apple and citrus character, the mineral tight texture and crisp acidity promise some aging. The wine conveys a sense of elegance, intensity and richness. Drink now, but the wine will also age.
designation: Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Taittinger 2011 Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: There's a fine balance here between minerality and rich toast. The result is a very pure but ripe wine, dominated by a good mix of ripe white fruits and honey.
title: William Fèvre 2011 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A big, toasty wine, full of ripe, delicious fruit, veering toward opulence. There are open yellow fruits along with toast and butter tastes. This is almost ready to drink now; only the acidity promises some aging.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2012 Fourchaume Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A rounded, fruity wine, packed with yellow peaches and apricots, but held in check by freshness, green herbs and a firm, steely character. It's not a wine to age for long, but it is delicious, and very seductive now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2011 Mont-de-Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Made from young vines from the Vaulorent portion of the Fourchaume vineyard, this is an open, rounded and lively wine with white fruits and weight, just lifted by acidity.
title: William Fèvre 2011 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Fresh fruit with apple acidity gives this wine a ready-to-drink character. It has an attractive lift of citrus and a light, crisp and fresh aftertaste.
title: Christophe Cordier 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon)

description: Ripe yellow fruits give this wine a soft and rich character. With a tangy, citrus edge it is also crisp and fresh. The combination makes for a lively, light wine that is ready to drink.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine has wood acidity more than fruit freshness, but its citrus and apple flavors show potential. Although spice and toast dominate for the moment, a crisper character comes through at the end.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2019 Les Vergers Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a crisp wine, tight with minerality. It has apple fruits as well as citrus, although the wine tends to a tight texture. There is potential and the wine will soften from 2020, but it will always have this tension.
title: Manciat-Poncet 2020 Le Clos  (Saint-Véran)

description: Still young, this crisp wine is at the beginning of its development. Time will bring out the ripe apple fruit and the touches of spice that are just hints now. Drink from 2021.
title: Tramier et Fils 2020  Saint-Véran

description: At 1,100 feet, this high-altitude vineyard yields a crisp and tangy wine. The brothers, whom Becky Wasserman lists among the Fuissé “revolutionaries,” employ biodynamic practices. The wine has great swathes of bright acidity and a tight, mineral texture. With lively acidity, it is a bright, fruity wine to drink now.
title: Bret Brothers 2020 Climat En Carementrant  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Crisp and tight, this is a steely, mineral-driven wine. The texture is taut and nervy, lively with acidity and just hinting at a more creamy future. The toasty edge is attractive and fills the wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This has a mineral character that shines through the crisp, fresh citrus and green plums. It is immediately attractive and is delicious to drink now.
title: Albert Bichot 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: At this stage, the wine seems to have too much wood. Hopefully this will dissipate because round yellow fruits are all there, along with fresh, crisp acidity. It is a wine with potential and will be better from 2021.
title: Domaine Ferret 2020 Tête de Cru Les Perrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A flagship wine for this producer, this is rich and seductive, opulent even. Bold yellow fruits, ripe apples and pears are surrounded by a youthful texture that will allow it to age. The fruit and the touches of wood are still present, but will integrate beautfully. Drink this wine from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Ripe and rounded, this softly textured wine has swathes of yellow fruits that are deliciously cut with lime and lemon acidity. The wine, with its touches of toast is balanced, promising a fine future. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Buisson Battault 2021 Les Gouttes d'Or Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This open, soft wine brings out some of the ripe fruit flavors of the vintage. It has attractive melon and apricot fruit along with a tight streak of mineral acidity. It's ready to drink now, although it will be better from 2021.
title: Domaine Perraud 2021 L'Oeuvre de Perraud  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Citrus fruits shine in this wine that offers attractive acidity along with lemon and crisp apple flavors. Bright, fruity and ready to drink soon, the wine has a nervy texture that will be delicious. Drink from 2021.
title: Henri de Villamont 2020  Rully

description: From vines grown below the Roche de Solutré cliff, this is a tight wine with a mineral texture and steely acidity. The structure will soften to give a wine that is full and concentrated, with plenty of acidity as well as citrus flavors. Wait until 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020  Saint-Véran

description: Tight and mineral, this crisp wine also is ripe with apple flavors and lime-juice acidity. It has a zesty quality and is lively and bright at the end.
title: Loron et Fils 2020 Les Vieux Murs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This fresh and fruity wine is made with without wood. Citrus crisp and with lively acidity, it refreshing, and perfumed. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2020 En Paradis  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: This taut and structured wine has weight as well as ripe fruits, with a strong mineral character that gives it tight texture. The acidity and the fruit are developing. Drink from 2021.
title: Maison Champy 2020  Viré-Clessé

description: An excellent selection for the price, but this is not a wine for those who do not enjoy the flavors of malolactic fermentation and oak aging. While the nose offers aromas of pear, peach and citrus zest accented by notes of brioche, the palate offers up more pronounced oak contributions like a tub of buttered popcorn.
title: Domaines Astruc 2013 dA Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: The wine has toast, vanilla and pear flavors, still young and tightly closed. It needs several months to begin to open up and to show its intrinsic fruitiness and potential richness. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Berthet-Bondet 2018 Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)

description: With subtle wood aging, this is a smooth wine that has hints of toast over its delicious white and apricot fruits. Orange zest tang gives a delicious bite and texture, suggesting how well the wine will age. Drink this fruity wine from 2021.
title: Roche de Bellene 2018 La Chatenière Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Open and flattering, as are many of the 2004s, showing a dose of smoky, toasty oak layered over buttered nuts, honey and peach. Turns more citrusy on the finish, with tangerine and mineral notes lingering gently. Quite oaky, but has the depth of fruit to support it.
title: Louis Latour 2006 Le Referts  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: For simple Chablis, this is impressive, rich, fruity, with wood as well as lively, fresh acidity. Nosings find toast and butter, with a hint of light honey.
title: William Fèvre 2011 Domaine  (Chablis)

description: This still tastes impressively young for a simple Chablis. In fact it isn't simple at all, showing all the intensity of a premier cru with its minerality, fresh lime and other citrus flavors, hints of honey and white fruits.
title: Domaine Vincent Dauvissat 2011  Chablis

description: A soft, ripe, open wine with yellow fruit flavors. There is opulent concentration, velvet in texture. Only on the finish is there freshness and real acidity. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2011 Les Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Strong minerality with crisp, clean almost mouth-puckering green fruits that show structure. It is full-bodied and rich, but also with an edge of austerity.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2011 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This tangy wine has attractive acidity and a tightly coiled mineral texture. Apple and lemon flavors shoot right through the bright, crisp texture. Drink from 2021.
title: Cave des Vignerons de Buxy 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: From vines in the northern part of the appellation, this ripe wine conveys peaches and apricots laced with lime. A vibrant, mineral wine with swathes of fresh acidity, it can be drunk now.
title: Château de Fuissé 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This rich wine is full and has a good balance of acidity and fruit. The lightly mineral texture gives bite and crispness. It is still a young, tight wine needing another few months. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Santenay 2020  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: The appellation in the Côte Chalonnaise only produces white wine. This wine has a smooth and creamy character with attractive acidity and bright acidity. It is a perfumed wine just hinting at a more mineral texture. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2020 La Grande Roche Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: This is a refreshing, lemon-flavored wine. Attractive crispness comes out of the mineral texture and perfumed acidity. Light and still young, this will age to be ready to drink from late 2020.
title: Louis Max 2020 Beaucharme  (Bourgogne)

description: Ripe yellow fruits dominate this full wine. Balanced by apple freshness, it offers rich apricots and creamed pear, backed by acidity. It's simple, fruity and delicious now.
title: Louis Max 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a bright-fruited wine with lively acidity and apple flavors. It has a creamy texture, a touch of spice and a lemon zest aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Trenel Fils 2018  Viré-Clessé

description: In this generous, fruity wine, rich flavors are cut by grapefruit acidity and aromatic herbs. The texture is full in the mouth with good refreshing flavors as well a juicy, aftertaste.
title: Albert Bichot 2019  Mâcon-Villages

description: Only lightly wood aged, this is a fruity wine with a touch of spice, some peaches and fragrant acidity. It is delicious wine and ready to drink.
title: Roche de Bellene 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine is smooth, softly balanced with attractive, tangy lemon-zest flavors. White fruit dominates giving freshness, while minerality adds texture. A full wine, it is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Cave de Viré 2021 Grande Réserve  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This is a tight wine, packed with acidity and strong citrus flavors. A touch of toastiness gives the wine its core of spice. The wine is refreshing, crisp with a good depth of fruit. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2020 Les Terres Noires  (Saint-Véran)

description: With grapes coming from southern Burgundy, this is a ripe, full wine. Its fruits are right up front along with almond and light toast flavors. Pineapple and peach fruits show the warmth of this rich wine. Drink now.
title: Vincent 2021  Bourgogne

description: This wine is closed, tight and steely, but the hints of apricots and balancing acidity are there. It needs time, so wait until 2021.
title: Yves Giroux 2020 Au Bucher  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This warm, ripe Chablis has a hint of tangy texture along with intense white-fruit acidity. It is a delicious wine, still young, and will be better from 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2022 Domaine Long-Depaquit  (Chablis)

description: Smooth textured, this wine is packed with ripe fruits that are touched with spice. Rounded and laden with apricot and mango flavors, it's ready to drink.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2021  Viré-Clessé

description: This ripe, warm wine is balanced between rich fruits and acidity. A lightly toasty edge accompanies ripe apricot and pear flavors. The acidity is just in balance, giving an attractive edge. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Beauregard 2021  Saint-Véran

description: Perfumed spice aromas give this wine its toasty character. The wood aging dominates the fruit. The fruit, though, is ripe and will develop. Give this wine until 2024.
title: Domaine Ferret 2021 Hors Classe Les Ménétrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine from a village that also has vines in the Pouilly Fuissé appellation. Soft and rounded, it conveys apricot and melon flavors that are shot through with acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2022  Mâcon

description: The cool, crisp nature of Pernand is well expressed in this tight, mineral and tangy wine. It has fine acidity along with fresh apple and citrus fruits. The good texture will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
designation: Creux de la Net Premier Cru
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019 Creux de la Net Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Close to the slope of Grand Crus, Fourchaume is one of the best known of the premiers in Chablis. This ripe wine with its touches of vanilla as well as yellow fruits and acidity has a lightly honeyed character typical of the vintage. It is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2021.
title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2019 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a ripe, wood-aged wine that shows the richer side of Meursault. It's generous with ripe yellow fruits, but balanced and complemented by crisp acidity and hints of toastiness. A fine wine with impeccable structure, it will age well, so drink from 2019.
designation: Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2017 Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A beautiful wine, this has fresh acidity, crisp fruits and zesty mineral texture. Apples, citrus and hints of apricots are all there along with an intense tangy character that bursts in the mouth. It's still so young and needs to age; drink from 2022 at the earliest. The Special Club is a group of growers who rate and taste each other's wines before release.
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2014 Special Club de Collection Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a warm and rich wine from the southern Mâcon region. It is ripe with yellow fruits, crisp apples and a touch of minerality that gives the tangy texture. Packed with fruit as well as structured, this wine can be drunk now, although better from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019  Pouilly-Vinzelles

description: Petit Chablis is planted on the plateau above the Serein river valley, the heart of Chablis. This attractively fruity wine offers white fruits and crisp acidity. Light and refreshing, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2020  Petit Chablis

description: With a hint of minerality, this wine has structure to go with its soft, generous fruit. There are almonds, toast, peaches and an attractive rounded texture.
title: Barton & Guestier 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: A cool wine, full of citrus as well as green apple flavors. The wine is bright, crisp and refreshing in its acidity. Almonds and white fruits add to the attractive mix.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2017  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

description: This 16–acre estate is run biodynamically, producing intensely flavored, honeyed, ripe wines. This is succulent from ripe fruit, with the acidity bright and vivid, finishing with sweet pineapple and apricot flavors.
title: Domaine Guillemot-Michel 2014 Quintaine  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Fine fresh fruits, bright with good acidity and a lively fresh character. There is a strong apple skin and grapefruit texture, finishing fresh and full.
title: Gilles Morat 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Some fine wood and fruit aromas are followed by fresh grapefruit, pear and bright lemon flavors. The whole is held together by a fine touch of honeyed wood.
title: Domaine de la Garenne 2014  Mâcon-Azé

description: A piercingly citrus wine, the fruit as fresh as can be, rounded by the wood aging. There is a really bright character here that is appetizing and fresh.
title: Jean Manciat 2014  Saint-Véran

description: While the wine is toasty, burnt almost, the freshness of the fruit is very present, giving a light, lively touch to the weight. Give it six months to finally integrate.
title: Pierre Vessigaud 2014 Vers Agnières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Smooth and ripe, this offers good acidity as well as apple and citrus flavors. With a crisp texture and touches of minerality, it is ready to drink,
title: Louis Latour 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This has a strong steely, mineral character. It offers plenty of citrus and green plum but, at this young stage, the wine is more about crisp texture. The aftertaste hints at the future, ripe and warm. Drink from 2021.
