description: Crisp with an edge of honey, this is a ripe and fruity wine. Along with apple and cantaloupe melon flavors it has a nutty character and some light acidity, both of which add to its simple attraction. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019  Bourgogne

description: Notes of grass, lime leaf and garrigue herbs lead the bouquet of this attractive wine, supported by fruity tones of white melon, green plum and citrus peel. The medium-weight mouthfeel is countered by ample acidity and pithy flavors that finish slightly astringent. Drink now.
title: Mas Belles Eaux 2021 Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: This opulent wine is full of ripe fruit and has a generous texture. Apricot and pear flavors give richness that is cut by acidity that gives the wine tremendous lift. The toast adds the lightest touch at the end. Drink from 2023.
title: Philippe Colin 2020 Les Vergers Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: One of the two main cuvées from La Chablisienne, the wine is fresh, fruity while having a tight, mineral character and a cool, fragrant feel. It could age for a few months, but is a wine to drink soon.
title: La Chablisienne 2017 La Pierrelée  (Chablis)

description: Very tropical fruits aromas overlay a crisp, tight wine with orange zest acidity. It is softly textured, rich and packed with peach and apricot flavors. The wine is full in the mouth and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Marie Challand 2018 En Thurissey  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Pure fruit with some concentration, this wine also has a steely texture and a touch of saltiness. It's fresh and crisp with delicious green fruits, citrus and white peach. Ready to drink now, the wine will be better from 2020.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2020 Domaine Drouhin-Vaudon  (Chablis)

description: This attractive, fruity wine has refreshing acidity and clean lemon and orange zest flavors. It has a creamy side as well, giving a smooth, soft aftertaste that balances with the fresh acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Vincent 2020 JJ Bourgogne Blanc  (Bourgogne)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a ripe, rich wine. With acidity, spice and warm yellow fruits, it is generous and has a spicy undertone. Acidity and peaches blend together well at the end.
title: Jean Curial 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: Ripe with yellow fruits and soft acidity, this is a smooth and creamy wine. It also has a more textured character giving a crisper edge that leaves a tangy aftertaste. Drink this rich wine now.
designation: Terroir de Bissy Les Crays vers Vaux
title: Rijckaert 2019 Terroir de Bissy Les Crays vers Vaux  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: The odd name of this wine—meeting in September—is because grapes from different parcels are blended directly in the press at harvest time in September. It is an easy, ripe and open, with attractive white-peach flavors and just a touch of tighter minerality. Drink now.
title: Rijckaert 2020 Rendez-Vous de Septembre  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Vines around 25 years old on this family domaine yield this soft and creamy wine. It has attractive, crisp acidity and a bright texture that brings in apples and lemon flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Fourrey 2020  Chablis

description: Ripe, smooth and creamy, this has just a touch of wood to give extra roundness to the ripe yellow and citrus fruits. Ready to drink wine.
title: J. Moreau & Fils 2016  Chablis

description: With its white fruit, lively acidity and delicious ripeness, this is very ready to drink. It's an opulent, rounded wine, with hints of spice to go with its fruit character.
designation: Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2015 Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This winery's investment in organic viticulture seems to have paid off. Fresh apple mixes with cotton candy on the nose while more serious notes of apricot and pear take over in the mouth. Vanilla and caramel linger on the zingy finish.
title: Douce Nature 2012 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: In the Middle Ages, this vineyard was on the boundary between Burgundy and Champagne. This is a plush , rich wine with a broad, full character. It offers ripeness, yellow fruits and crisp, fresh acidity at the end. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From a 2.4-acre vineyard with vines that are 60 years old, this is a tight, mineral wine, very pure and with a line of acidity and crisp apple flavors. Very perfumed, it is fresh but also densely textured, finishing with tannins and concentration as well as liveliness. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Sébastien Dampt 2019 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a balanced wine with touches of honey and toast, along with ripe yellow and white fruits that are cut by a salty structure. Great acidity runs through the wine, giving a tight, steely, very pure aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2019 Drouhin-Vaudon Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a balanced, fruity wine with a beautiful line of fragrant acidity. Apples, pears and a touch of chewy tannin all work together well to give a wine that is both firmly textured and fresh with fruit. It could be drunk now, although it will be best from 2020.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Fresh apples, grapefruit and sweeter apricots all hang together well in this elegant Chardonnay. It's an apéritif style, its crispness giving a light character, the fruit floating over the acidity. There are lively green fruit flavors to finish.
title: Ayala 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a wine with great fruit. Apples, pears and a touch of apricot blend easily with the zesty lemon and the mineral texture that cuts through the fruit. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2021.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2020 Domaine de Fussiacus  (Saint-Véran)

description: This unoaked wine made from low-yield vines has great minerality and a tight texture. It is packed with acidity as well as citrus fruits. The mineral edge gives the wine tightness and also brings out apples and tangy acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2020  Saint-Véran

description: Yes, this wine comes from a village of Chardonnay in the Mâcon region of Burgundy. It's a typical, crisp, freshly green Chardonnay that zings on to the palate. No wood here, just light grapefruit and citrus flavors, rounded with a touch of apple. Screwcap.
title: Cave de Lugny 2013 Chardonnay de Chardonnay  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: This wine offers ripe yellow fruits and soft acidity. A honeyed character adds to the richness and generous character of this warm wine that is lightly cut by acidity at the end.
title: Domaine Guillemot-Michel 2019 Quintaine  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This wine has ripe fruitiness that is rounded and soft. Some toast gives a warmer character that is emphasized by the rich apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink soon, in 2019 or early 2020.
title: Louis Max 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Not overdone or overripe, here's a rich Chard that boasts fresh peach and red apple notes with notes of tropical fruit acidity. Clean and solid with a medium mouthfeel; an easy-drinking choice that's perfect for company.
title: The Frenchhouse 2014 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Packed with both wood and ripe fruit, this rich wine is full of juicy citrus and spice flavors that are lifted by the steely acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Alex Gambal 2020 Les Enseignères  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: At this stage, this wine still shows considerable wood flavors. As it develops, its rich pear and peach fruit will come more to the fore along with the crisp edge of acidity and citrus. The texture, with its mineral edge, will allow this single-parcel wine to develop well. Drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020 Les Clous  (Meursault)

description: Made from Grand Cru vineyards in Mesnil-sur-Oger on the Côte des Blancs, this beautiful wine is maturing well. The ripe, creamy pineapple and spice character has softened the natural minerality of the texture. Full in the mouth, ripe and rounded, the wine will age more, so drink now, or better, keep until 2021.
designation: Fins Lieux No 5 Grand Cru Brut
title: Pehu-Simonet 2016 Fins Lieux No 5 Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Big and bold, this lives up to the reputation of richer Meursault. Yet crispness, a core of tight structure, toast and fresh fruits are always present. The play between the characters is delicious and likely to allow the wine to age over several years.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2013 Genevrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Spicy, toasty aromas are the theme of the wood-laden palate of this wine. Apricot and mango fruit lies behind this vanilla character. The wine is rich, needing further time for the wood to integrate. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2021 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Although this wine does not come from a premier-cru vineyard, it hails from a single vineyard that regularly produces delicious white wines. This bottling, rich as befits the year, also has an attractive bright, crisp edge that contrasts with the warm yellow fruits. Drink the wine from 2023.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Château de Chamirey En Pierrelet  (Mercurey)

description: This wine has a mineral texture, cool and crisp. It is packed with citrus and green-apple flavors that give a bright, tight character. At the end, the vanilla flavor from wood aging comes through. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Max 2021 Grechons Premier Cru  (Ladoix)

description: The Marquis de Laguiche vineyards, with a great stock of premier and grand crus, have long been managed by Drouhin. This wood-aged, generous and opulent wine is already smooth and rich. Yellow fruits have a tight, tense texture to go with their open character. The wine is just beginning to develop its intense complexity. Drink from 2023.
designation: Marquis de Laguiche Premier Cru Morgeot
title: Joseph Drouhin 2018 Marquis de Laguiche Premier Cru Morgeot  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: The wine is still young, with a dense and full-bodied series of flavors that are still developing. As it matures the ripe yellow fruits will come through strongly, assisted by the citrus zest and contrasting with the tight, nervy texture. Expect the wine to be ready in 2020.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2018 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The wine from this clos or walled vineyard in the city of Reims has spent eight years aging before disgorgement. It's a rare wine, with a wonderful balance between its toasty character and the crisp, dry apple and green-fruit flavors. It will certainly age further, so wait—if you can—until 2023.
title: Lanson 2012 Clos Lanson Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Soft and round, this ripe wine offers both fruit and acidity. It is young and full of green plum and pear flavors, still textured with a young, crisp character. It needs to fill out for a few years, and will be best from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019  Pernand-Vergelesses

description: This intense wine comes from a vineyard just below the main street of Chassagne-Montrachet village. While the aromas are still toasty, the palate is full of fresh fruit, with a tensely mineral structure. Hints of yellow fruits as well as crisper citrus are there, along with shots of toast from the wood aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2018 La Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Dense and concentrated, this is a wine with a long-term future. Ripe apricot and apple flavors are cut with acidity. Equally, the tight, tense structure shapes a rich wine, taut and with a steely texture. It is serious while also likely to be delicious. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2020 Bougros Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A warm, earthy, rustic style, richly fruity with peaches and sweet juiced fruits. There is good balance of wood, toast, nutmeg and sweet spice. The finale draws a fine line in elegance.
title: Henri de Villamont 2013  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: This ripe, still very young wine has a tangy, mineral texture that cuts into the white fruit flavors. Acidity, creamy texture and flavors of melon and apricots all give this wine the potential to be deliciously fruity. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: This soft simple Chardonnay is all fruit. Ripe pear and melon flavors are the order of the day here, giving a rounded wine with just the right amount of acidity. Drink now.
title: Lieubeau 2022 La Fruitière Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: Touches of matchstick, garrigue herbs and lime leaf complement the green apple- and pear-fruit core of this well-balanced, attractive Chardonnay. There's a slight creaminess to the palate, lifted by medium acidity to keep the mouthfeel fresh and the finish clean. Accents of toast and sweet spice dance on the close.
title: S. Delafont 2018 Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: With a wine from every cru in Chablis, La Chablisienne is able to bring out the character of each. This cool Côte de Léchet is typical in its tight, mineral character, revealing its edgy nature. It's a wine with some aging potential, so give it 2–3 years and more.
title: La Chablisienne 2014 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Towards the southern end of Chassagne, Morgeot is a large premier cru that once belonged to an abbey. This wine is full of fruit, spiced with the wood aging and with a strongly mineral texture. It has the potential to be rich, round and smooth. Wait until 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020 Les Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a warm, creamy wine with layers of toast and yellow fruits. It has a ripe feel and a generous texture, with a mineral backbone keeps the wine in shape. Drink now.
title: Pascal Rollet 2020 Aux Bouthières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Very pure lemon and toast flavors dominate this wine. It has crispness, intense freshness and lively acidity. There is also a sense of richness that is slowly developing and that will broaden the wine over the next several months.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2013 Gouttes d'Or Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A wine that starts with ripe citrus flavors, then moves easily into soft richness as the spicy wood and sweet peach flavors come through strongly. The wood is dominant, but not excessive. Full, ripe and still young.
title: Pierre Morey 2013  Meursault

description: An enticing mix of toast and white fruit aromas follows through to rich apricot and ripe pear flavors, spiced with the creamy toast. The wood does need to calm down for the wine to be at its best.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014 Les Chenevottes  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Taut and edgy, very steely in character, with almost an austere character in its youth. Its fruits are definitely on the citrus side of the spectrum, crisp yet rich as well. The acidity shoots right through the wine.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Blanchots  (Chablis)

description: A beautifully proportioned wine, from its rich yet mineral texture to its full grapefruit and gooseberry flavors. It gradually shows toast as well as wonderful acidity. For aging over 4–6 years.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Ripe and creamy in apple and pear fruitiness, this is cut by just the right amount of acidity. It's balanced, with fruit and and bright steeliness working well together. Drink from 2020.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2018 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The wine is tight and closed, hiding its natural fruitiness. For the moment, what is showing is acidity and a strongly mineral texture. This complex wine needs aging to fill out the structure. Drink from 2021.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2018 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Totally fresh, this is crisp and packed with citrus. A complex, tight texture brings out nervy acidity, a strongly mineral character and a firm structure. Age this youthful wine and drink from 2022.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2019 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With fruit drawn from all over Burgundy, this is a light, bright and refreshing wine. It has light acidity, spice and apple flavors and a bright, tight aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019 Colette  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This is a light, fruity wine with lemon and apricot flavors and a citrus tang that gives a lift. It's attractive, fresh and with a ripe, warm aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Mancey 2020  Mâcon

description: This ripe, pineapple- and peach-flavored wine has a soft texture, hints of vanilla and light acidity. It is rounded, full in the mouth and with a light textured aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Trenel Fils 2020 Homage to Heritage  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: There is a strong steeliness to this wine although it doesn't lose out on fruitiness either. Crisp apples are tempered with pineapple to give a ripe feel, while the end is fresh and mineral.
title: Henry Fessy 2018  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This wine is fresh, bright and light, with citrus and ripe yellow fruits. Crisp, light and aromatic, it's ready to drink.
title: Château des Jacques 2019  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This wine is ripe, with good balance between acidity and the rich yellow fruits. It has a lightly tangy character, although it is more about delicious juiciness and a warm, generous character that is lightly sustained by toast. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: The mineral texture that marks out a fine Meursault is very present here. Yellow fruits balance with this perfumed and intense wine. Still young and crisp, the acidity gives a tight, nervy edge. The wine obviously needs to age, so drink from 2021.
title: Alex Gambal 2019  Meursault

description: A toasty, oaky wine, with smoky aromas and flavors that mask the white fruit flavors and acidity. Hopefully all this high toast will burn off. Hold for 2–3 years.
title: Faiveley 2011 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: Crisp, green and steely, this is classic Chablis, all about pure green fruits and minerality, only lightly layered with wood. It is vibrant and fresh, with the acidity adding a mouthwatering lightness.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2012 Mont-de-Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Light, fresh, soft and already very drinkable. The initial taste is dominated by citrus, and then it rounds out, adding toast, green fruits and a definite sophistication for a simple white Burgundy.
title: Pierre Morey 2011  Bourgogne

description: Soft with a yeasty character, this wine has not gotten its act together. It has some bitterness, walnut and spice flavors although nothing hangs together.
title: Domaine Ferret 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is perfumed, soft and with a light character. An oddly floral character doesn't jell with the fruitiness that is behind it.
title: Domaine Carrette 2019 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a wine with harshness, sharp walnut and bitter orange flavors. It gives off a hard feeling that probably won't soften much.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2019 Plants Carré  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This open and generous wine is attractive and ready to drink. White peach and pear flavors give it great fruitiness without losing sight of acidity. It's fruity, softly textured and just right now.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2018  Mâcon-Lugny

description: A forward, fruity wine, full of apple and creamed pear flavors. The acidity is light, bright and attractive giving a wine that is fresh and ready to drink.
title: Domaines Devillard 2017 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: Rounded wine, softly fruity. Its attractiveness comes from ripe white fruits, soft structure and a generous feel. It's not for aging and can be drunk now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2017 Buissonnier  (Montagny)

description: While certainly ripe and fruity, this wine is also structured—its generosity tempered by intense acidity, crisp apple-skin notes and a mineral texture. The result is a full wine that needs a little time to soften. Drink from 2018.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Sweet, light and floral, but not fruity. Lemon and orange flavors yield to a zesty finish. Simple and very high in acidity.
title: Mommessin 2008 Nid D'Abeille Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Melon and peach aromas start out fine but lose clarity. Citrus flavors that aren't quite full precede mild lemon and banana on the tail end. Nondescript and turns hot at the end. Kosher.
title: Abarbanel 2007 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Vin de Pays de L'Aude)

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine has a crisp, mineral character that gives an intense texture. It is balanced, ripe while still taut and crisp. The background to this is riper yellow fruits and a full, generous aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2019 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Caramel aromas lead to a wine that is rich and full bodied. It has weight and concentration, along with fresh acidity that cuts through at the end. A good sense of minerality gives this wine extra texture. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2019 Domaine de Fussiacus  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is an impressively powerful, concentrated wine. It shows its wood aging now, but those notes should integrate soon into all the ripe apricot and greengage flavors. Richly textured, this is a wine that needs aging, so don't drink before 2020.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: One of the most familiar of Puligny's Premier Crus has produced a ripe, yet very structured wine. It has intense minerality and a nervy, tight texture balanced with acidity, crisp apple and attractive wood spice. Everything is in harmony on this complex wine, promising a smooth aging . Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2017 Les Perrières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: The wine is rich and full in the mouth with ripe fruit from the deep clay soil of this premier cru. It is beautifully concentrated and ripe. The fruit is so crisp and juicy that this yellow and white-fruit flavored wine could be drunk now. That would be a shame, because it will be even better from 2022.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2021 Butteaux Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A tight, crisp wine from vineyards that face across the river to the town of Chablis. The wine has delicious yellow fruits, intense acidity and an opulent character. The vines of the vineyard face east giving warmth while keeping a strong mineral texture. Drink this wine from 2023.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2021 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The parcel called La Mission in the heart of the Mercurey vineyards is wholly owned by the Devillard family, so they call it a monopoly. It is a wine that effortlessly balances tangerine and lemon flavors with ripe spiced peaches and a tight mineral texture. The wine is still young, still developing, so wait until 2022.
designation: Château de Chamirey La Mission Monopole
title: Domaines Devillard 2020 Château de Chamirey La Mission Monopole  (Mercurey)

description: Spice, especially nutmeg, is a distinctive character in this soft, ripe wine. It lacks some definition, but is attractively round. Fruit flavors tend toward white pears, edged with toast, while the texture is fat, full.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Mouches Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2012 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Santenay, which is located toward the south of the Côte de Beaune, is known for its wines that are accessible and early maturing. This ripe selection bursts with flavors of yellow fruit and citrus, touched by wood influence. Drink it over the next year, or age it for 3–4.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2016 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Soft and ripe, this wine has juicy pineapple and pear flavors. And with its tension between richness and steeliness, this could certainly age.
designation: Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2016 Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: With its upfront, ripe apple and pear flavors, this wine is immediately attractive. Behind the fruitiness, there is a firm, structured character of minerality and a steely edge, which makes this a Chardonnay to age for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2017 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The most taut and steely of the wines made by Guillaume Vrignaud from Fourchaume fruit, this offers a tight, minerally texture, lively acidity and an apple- and grapefruit-like crispness. With its structure, this has the potential to age for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2017 Les Champréaux Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A selection of wines from 30 different parcels, this rich, smooth, open wine wears its toast well, the caramel and vanilla flavors melding easily with apricots, melon and finishing with acidity. The aftertaste continues this marriage of flavors.
title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Warm, rich, with a southern Chardonnay ripeness, this shows high toast, but also ripe tropical fruit. The acidity is light, with a creamy texture, and added spice and richness. It's a harmonious style that needs 3–4 years.
title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Reflecting the warm 2019 vintage, this is smooth and creamy. It has great fruitiness, recalling yellow fruit cut with a strong citrus streak. It's a wine to drink young, from late 2021.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2021 Croix-Jarrier  (Mâcon-Verze)

description: Named after the district of Paris where the food and wine markets were located, this is an attractive, fruity wine. It has apricot, banana and spice flavors, lifted by some perfumed acidity. It is a warm style of Chardonnay that is ready to drink.
title: Maison de la Villette 2021 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: A fragrant apple-skin aroma sets the scene for this wine that is warm and ripe. A touch of nutmeg adds an extra dimension to its yellow fruits. It's rich while still remaining true to its minerally, terroir-based origins. Age for two years.
title: Bernard Defaix 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: This is a tightly textured wine that has plenty of green stone fruit as well as a bitter almond edge. It is taut, and the fruit has not completely surfaced yet. Age for three years.
title: Château de Maligny 2016 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is rich, full-bodied Chardonnay, rounded out with peaches and spiced apricots. The wood is evident here, giving an extra softness as well as bringing out rich honey. A wine that opens beautifully in the mouth, ready to drink but also ageworthy.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: An initially wood-laden wine that only slowly reveals the rich fruit character. There is wood certainly, but the spice integrates well with the green fruits and the intense minerality. The great steely backbone on this wine indicates it will age.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2012 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This is one of the most popular Chablis premier crus, and this soft wine shows why. It hints at minerality, but the main flavors are a great burst of apple and citrus. It has just the right vivid green character, the vanilla from the wood a very subtle afterthought.
title: William Fèvre 2012 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Soft and ripe, this is Chardonnay at its simplest. It has melon and pear flavors, light acidity and a rounded texture. Drink this easy wine now.
title: Le Petit Panier 2018 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: There is just pure fruitiness here, a Chardonnay that is light and fresh although with some creamy richness behind it. It's softly textured, a warm wine with a vanilla hint at the end.
title: Domaine des Tilleuls 2018 Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: Round and soft, this warm wine from the southern end of the Côte de Beaune feels rich and generous. It has caramel and yellow fruit flavors, and its crisp acidity will ensure that it will remain fresh and fruity.
title: Jaffelin 2016 Passetemps Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This is a fruity wine, with upfront peach and apricot flavors. It has bright acidity and just a hint of wood. Produced for the first time by Ferret, this selection is rich, open and generous, although the acidity is never left behind.
title: Domaine Ferret 2016 Sous Vergisson  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A blend from Puligny-Montrachet and Meursault, this is a soft rounded wine with white fruit acidity, almond flavors and a gentle lemon zest texture. Drink in the next two years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2015 Les Sétilles  (Bourgogne)

description: From one of the few Chardonnay vineyards in Dizy, this is a tight wine, with a steely character, very crisp and citric. Even at nine years age, it tastes young, structured, demanding aging.
title: Jacquesson et Fils 2008 Dizy Corne Bautray Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Very pure Chardonnay from the heart of the Côte de Blancs. It has all the minerality of the vintage while also boasting tropical fruit flavors. It's already a delicious wine, with its tight edge of acidity, but could certainly age.
title: Jacquesson et Fils 2008 Avize Champ Gain Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A beautifully crisp wine, very mineral, with its citrus and green apple flavors given a fine texture of bright acidity. It is still so young, with just a hint of toast to show some maturity. The finish is shockingly fresh.
title: Billecart-Salmon 2005 Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A soft, firm wine with a nice touch of citrus. The character is fresh, light, with a fine burst of final acidity to mark an easy, bright wine.
title: Pierre Morey 2013 Bourgogne Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

description: This is an attractive fruity wine with citrus fruits and a tangy, zesty texture. The lightest hint of wood gives the wine extra richness. It is already drinkable.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2020  Montagny

description: Fine and fresh, brightened by grapefruit, lemon zest and bright acidity, this is a delicious wine, ready for seafood, finishing so clean and crisp.
title: Gilles Morat 2014 La Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Rich, smooth, ripe flavors of wood with some pear and peach juice. Soft, but with good depth of flavor.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2014 Epinet  (Viré-Clessé)

description: A smoothly textured wine, full and ripe, with great pear flavors, giving rich acidity as well as a texture that shows apricot skins and green plums.
title: Manuel Seguin 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Rich wine, full in the mouth, bringing wood and ripe apple flavors well together. Delicious.
title: Manuel Seguin 2014  Viré-Clessé

description: A broad, spicy wine, ripe with plenty of sweet mango and peach fruits to go with the green fruit acidity. It is already delicious but will develop further over the next 2–3 years.
title: Château de Chamirey 2014 La Mission Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: On the mineral side of Meursault, the has a very textured feel, with acidity to go with the honey note. Finely balanced, warm and ripe, this has a crisp, tight finish.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Les Clous  (Meursault)

description: Powerful and concentrated, this has an intense expression of ripe tropical fruits. The wood shows strongly at this stage, although with this amount of richness, it has the weight and the power to develop well over many years.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016  Corton-Charlemagne

description: This is taut and mineral, with hidden power. It's very closed at this stage. It's a wine with acidity and notes of green fruits and crisp apples, with just a touch of wood. This will age for many years.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2016 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a deeply rich, very impressive wine from a great white-wine vintage. It's concentrated with the essence of pure Chardonnay. It has tension along with a full texture. Age it for at least 10 years.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016  Chevalier-Montrachet

description: Structured and minerally, this has citrus fruits that sit prominently over the tight acidity. A vanilla note is there to round the wine out. The crisp fruits and steely acids are intense and impressively balanced. Age for at least 5 years. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2016 Les Blanchots Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Big, rich and powerful, this uses grapes sourced from a small section of the Corton hill that's close to Charlemagne. It has the ripe pineapple and apricot flavors to go with the acidity. With its enormous concentration, this is ready to age over at least 10 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016  Corton Vergennes

description: Richly structured, this wine is all texture at this stage—although the rich fruit lingers underneath. Apple, pear and citrus fruits give this opulent, powerful wine its freshness. This has a great future ahead.
title: Louis Latour 2016  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Using grapes sourced from the greatest white-wine vineyard in Burgundy, this is huge, dense, very rich and complex. The balance already shows in the wine's acidity, ripe yellow fruit and round texture. Wood aging brings notes of spice and toast. This will age for many years.
title: Louis Latour 2016  Montrachet

description: The epitome of Grand Cru Chablis, this is mineral and fruit driven—impressive both from its richness and its tense structure. The power comes from the depth of flavor that brings the texture right through the wine. Age for 5–7 years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2016 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Simple, attractive, light Chardonnay. Green fruits and pear juice layer with acidity and a soft texture. With its lively, crisp finish, the wine is ready to drink.
designation: Château de la Tour de l'Ange
title: Maison Jean-Baptiste Béjot 2014 Château de la Tour de l'Ange  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Chitry lies just outside the Chablis appellation area, giving a wine that has some of the classic steely character but is more rounded and less focused. Pleasing Chardonnay, finishes with an attractive vanilla touch.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Bourgogne Chitry  (Bourgogne)

description: Crisp acidity and citrus fruitiness combine with a riper, textured character. The wine shows the strong minerality inherent in whites from Pernand-Vergelesses, as well as a richer streak. Because of its structure, it should age. Drink from 2020.
designation: Creux de la Net Premier Cru
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2018 Creux de la Net Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This was the first vineyard bought by the Bouchard family, purchased in 1791. More than 220 years later, this 2015 has a delicate touch of wood nestled in the heart of creamy fruit flavors. Crisp lemon and tight acidity give a bright, fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2017 Clos Saint-Landry Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From granite soil, this rounded wine has a firm core of structure. Pineapple and peach fruit flavors surround this center, making it full in the mouth, rich and charming. Acidity at the end and the firm texture promise some aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Château des Rontets 2017 Pierrefolle  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The chalky soil conveys a cool feeling to this wine. Tight and mineral, it has yellow fruits that show good acidity. Toasty wood gives a juicy aftertaste. It's already delicious, but the wine's cool character will develop further, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Chanson 2017 Les Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This well-proportioned wine has ripe fruits along with generous texture and acidity. A touch of wood gives extra weight. It's ready to drink, but will be even better by the end of 2018.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2018 Au Brûlé  (Saint-Véran)

description: While this wine does not age in wood, it does age on its lees, giving it a rich, creamy texture. It's smooth, full and soft, its apricot and peach flavors showing ripeness and openness. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2021 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: While ripe, this also has a firm structure, with a mix of rich yellow-fruit flavors and austere minerality. With the acidity just beginning to soften, it will turn into a full and more rounded wine.
title: Domaine de la Garenne 2015  Mâcon-Azé

description: With a touch of spice from the wood, this wine is full of yellow and apple fruits yet with a cool thread of acidity. It is a lively, bright wine, filled out with fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2020 En Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Although the domaine is mainly centered on Chassagne-Montrachet, neighboring Saint-Aubin is hardly far. This ripe, yellow and citrus-fruit-flavored wine is already delicious. Touches of toast from wood aging along with balanced acidity give it both crispness and richness. Drink now.
title: Philippe Colin 2020 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This fresh wine also offers plenty of ripe fruit and exotic flavors. Crisp, juicy and rich, it's just lightly touched by honey and is a refreshing wine to drink now.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2019  Chablis
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Full of the fresh acidity of the 2018 vintage, this light, bright wine has refreshing lemon and crisp apple flavors that are given richness by the lively acidity. Bursting with fruit, it is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine des Gandines 2020 Terroir de Clessé  (Viré-Clessé)

description: The fruit in this soft wine is ripe and creamy. Green and white fruits give a balanced blend of fresh acidity and smooth texture. It is rich, generous and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Alex Gambal 2019  Bourgogne

description: This mature wine shows its toasty side. A mineral texture is now integrated with the almond, yeast and bread flavors to give a wine that's crisp while no longer bringing out its fruit. This wine is elegant with poise and great style. Drink now.
title: Bruno Paillard 2010 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Taittinger's prestige cuvée epitomizes the Chardonnay predilection of this producer. This now-mature bottling is elegant and very stylish. Toast and a soft texture combine with great complexity to reveal a wine that is poised and ready to drink. But with the acidity in the background, it could still age, so drink now and until 2022.
designation: Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Taittinger 2012 Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This soft, light wine has hints of citrus and acidity. It is fruity, crisp and bright with orange zest at the end. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2022 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This soft wine is open, rounded with a balance between fruit and crisp acidity. Simple and gentle, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2022 Tradition  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This soft, gentle wine has some attractive citrus and apple fruits. Easy to drink, it offers a crisp tangy aftertaste. It is not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2022 Collection  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Delicate aromas of red apple and dried grass tease on the nose of this soft wine, while slightly more assertive flavors of lime and white melon rind unfold on the medium-weight mouth. Ample acidity keeps the finish fresh, but short.
title: Barton & Guestier 2022 B&G Réserve Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: This wine is soft and very rich. That takes away from the fruit and leaves a broad wine, smooth and with a touch of pepper from alcohol. It is too big.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Domaine de la Garenne  (Macon-Bussières)

description: Bright citrus-fruit flavors are rounded with warm apple and pear notes on this densely textured, fruity wine. It shows no sign of aging, with a palate that's still fresh and bright, and revealing its minerality and tight acidity slowly. Drink through 2024.
designation: Tsarine Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: Chanoine 2012 Tsarine Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a youthful, fruity wine with crisp yellow-fruit and citrus flavors, with a toastiness from wood aging. Sourced from Saint-Aubin, it has a cool, fresh feel that complements its pristine fruitiness. It's for drinking soon, but will also improve with age through 2021.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2017 En Remilly Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: With its tight acidity and crisp texture, this young wine needs a little time to develop. Citrus and spice are coming together with the richer pear and apricot fruits. A refreshing wine, it will be good to drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2020 Domaine des Granges  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: This is a spicy wine, with balanced wood, yellow-fruit flavors and acidity that cuts through the spice and ripeness. A zing of citrus finishes this attractive wine in style.
title: Marcel Couturier 2020 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Ripe with tropical-fruit flavors, this wine has good acidity layered with spice and toastiness. A crisper structure behind this generous fruit will allow the wine to age, although it is drinkable now.
title: Loron et Fils 2020 Château de Mirande  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: An intensely perfumed wine that smells of a candy shop. It has tight acidity, but that is lost in the welter of white fruit flavors, allied with sweet wood. It seems at first too sweet, but then toast and acidity come in to give the wine an edgy finale.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011 Hauts Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a ripe and soft wine with pure apple and citrus fruit. It is crisp, juicy and bright with acidity and tangy orange zest flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Les Sétilles  (Bourgogne)

description: The aroma says wood, and that's what the taste confirms. To go with the wood, there is rounded apricot and peach-flavored fruit, open and rich. The wine has a youthful taut edge, finishing with the greatest acidity.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Weight and richness here, with attractive acidity, but also a ripe, creamy texture. The wine has some tight tannins, but is much more to do with opulent peaches and cream.
title: Henri de Villamont 2013 Les Caillerets Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A soft, rounded wine, with spice and toast and a cushion of plump yellow fruit. Almonds and mandarin oranges fit well together with the fine acidity.
title: Labouré-Roi 2012 Les Chevaliers  (Meursault)

description: This is deliciously crisp and steely, with an apple flavor and the weight of citrus and grapefruit. It has a minerally, chalky feel, and then the wine rounds out, with crisp fruit on the finish.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016 Drouhin-Vaudun Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The small Côte de Léchet Premier Cru offers a steely vision of Chablis—crisp and driven by apple and grapefruit flavors. It is bright and taut; like any wine from this vineyard, it needs to age for at least three years.
title: La Chablisienne 2016 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Finely structured and aromatic, this is initially dense before opening up with ripe yellow fruit, becoming balanced by orange- and tangerine-like acidity. It has a young, zesty texture that pairs with the rich concentration, promising to age over 3–4 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2016 Monte de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Light and fruity, this has flavors of creamed apple and ripe Williams pear. The wine is crisp and tangy, and it's shot through with lemon zest and acidity. Ready to drink in one year.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2017 Cuvée Ancestrum  (Chablis)

description: Light, creamed apple fruits with a bright line of fresh acidity. The wine is exuberant in its citrus character, just broadened by an underlay of green apples.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne)

description: Simple Chablis, but one that is full of ripe and creamy fruit. In the background, a more tangy, zesty and mineral texture brings out the northern cool vineyards. Otherwise it is about yellow fruits and sliced red apple. Drink now.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 La Pierrelée  (Chablis)

description: This broad wine has apple and pear flavors and a smooth texture. It's all ripe and creamy fruit, with well-balanced acidity.
title: Bougrier 2022 Alain de la Treille Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This east-facing vineyard is in the village of Fuissé. With the wood-aging giving spice and toast flavors, it is a ripe wine. The wood marches well with the apple and green-plum fruits. Still young, this rich wine has a mineral texture that comes from chalky soil. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2021 Aux Insarts  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This rich wine is dense and concentrated, with beautiful apple and spice flavors lifted by acidity. The fruit and the minerality typical of the appellation give this wine both its fine texture and its tangy fruitiness. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2022 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Round and full-bodied, the wine is dominated by wood-aging flavors. That masks the fruit at this stage, leaving the impression of a wine that is still to focus and bring out the impressive ripe fruits and mineral structure. Give it until 2021 to pull itself together.
title: Château de Fuissé 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This single-vineyard wine is rich and crisply fruity. It has the bright, tight texture of the vintage, giving a tense character while retaining the lush, poised fruit of the vintage. It's delicious now and ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2020 Les Plantés  (Saint-Véran)

description: Produced from old, low-yielding vines, this delicious wine balances crisp acidity with intense white fruit. It's poised and stylish, with a cool character expressed in its acidity and lemon zest-like aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2020 Les Sentinelles  (Saint-Véran)

description: A blend from different Premier Cru vineyards across Chablis, this wine is the product of the wide choice of grapes available to this cooperative. It's soft and ripe yet shows the crisper edge typical of the vintage. Drink from 2022.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 Grande Cuvée Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From organically grown fruit, this is a soft, lemon- and pear-flavored wine. It has plenty of fresh acidity as well as a warm, full-in-the-mouth character. The aftertaste brings out touches of vanilla as well as the acidity.
title: Domaine Philippe Goulley 2018  Petit Chablis

description: All tangy fruit, this wine was fermented in stainless steel to keep the freshness of the fruit. It is crisp and lively, full of apple and pink-grapefruit flavors with a clean, bright aftertaste. Drink from mid-2020.
title: Henry Fessy 2020 Sous la Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is soft, rounded and light. Baked apples and a creamy texture come with a refreshing burst of acidity tempered by a lightly toasty character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Louis Chevallier 2019  Bourgogne

description: From the Cognac region, this ripe, totally fruity wine has no suggestion of wood aging. Attractive apple and light citrus flavors are ripe and right up front. Acidity adds freshness to the end. Drink now.
title: Maison des 3 Ponts 2020 Maison des 3 Ponts Chardonnay (Charentais)

description: This soft wine features attractive citrus and creamed-apple flavors. It is round, full, lightly spicy and presents an easy, immediately drinkable character.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2021 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This tangy wine with spice and acidity has kiwi and lime flavors that give a fresh character. The aftertaste is lightly perfumed. Drink now.
title: Jean-Christophe Perraud 2020  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: Fresh, fruity and with a tight texture, this attractive wine has crisp acidity, lemon and lime flavors, and a juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Nadine et Maurice Guerrin 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Produced from organic grapes from the plateau above the prestigious slopes of Chablis, this is a cool and fresh wine with plenty of citrus as well as acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Philippe Goulley 2020  Petit Chablis

description: A pure, clean mineral-driven Champagne. It's very crisp, with a chalky texture, flavors of green apples and tight acidity. It's one of those Champagnes that needs time in the glass, because as it opens the flavors become more complex, bringing out yellow fruits as well as the underlying citrus.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2011 Extra Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Attractive and fruity, this warm wine is crisp and fresh at the same time. Yellow fruits and tangy orange zest are complemented by minerality and a refreshing aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Louis Chevallier 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This is a rounded and rich wine, packed with citrus fruits and delicious acidity. Lemon and orange-zest flavors balance well with the mineral texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Cave de Lugny 2022 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is a crisp, lightly wooded wine. Tangy texture and mineral acidity are part of the lively character of this still young, zesty bottling. Drink from 2022.
title: Clos des Rocs 2022 En Près Forêt  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: Crisp apple aromas lead to a spicy, yellow and melon-flavored wine. With its touches of vanilla and warm, ripe character, the wine is full and generous. Drink now.
title: Domaine Bernard Moreau 2022  Bourgogne

description: A crisp, tangy and mineral-driven wine, this is also ripe with generous citrus and apple flavors. The texture is still tight. which will allow it to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine de l'Echelette 2022 La Belouse  (Mâcon-Cruzille)

description: This tangy, ripe and fruity wine is crisp with acidity. It's attractively brimming with fruit and ready to drink.
title: Louis Max 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a tight, textured wine, with plenty of acidity to balance the ripe fruit. It has the generous texture typical of the vintage and ripe yellow fruits, with an attractive crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Marcel Couturier 2021 Le Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is smooth, mature and rich with yellow fruits and a rounded texture. A hint of wood and spice has plenty of crisp acidity to balance. Drink now.
title: Marcel Couturier 2021 Les Longues Terres  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: The fruit here is pure, fresh with the merest hints of its future richness. The green fruits, citrus and acidity are prominent, with a hint of toast and a finishing line of minerality. It needs to age, so drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2019 Les Vaupulans Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a rich, rounded wine, yet it also expresses a tight texture and nervy acidity. The toast influence is still dominating, although the fruitiness of this ripe selection is also showing. With its weight and structure, this is a prime candidate to age for several years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This tangy, perfumed single-vineyard wine also has some ripe fruit. A zesty character dominates at this early stage, leaving room for richer yellow fruits to come through in time. The wine has good potential, so wait until 2021 to drink.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2020 Les Bouthières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This ripe and full wine has hints of toast and baked bread along with rich apricot and peach flavors. The texture is warm while the aromatic aftertaste is immediately attractive.
title: Marcel Couturier 2020 Le Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has spice, concentrated yellow fruits and a delicious backbone of acidity. With its acidity firmly in place, the wine is beginning to reveal the richer yellow fruit and tangy lemon. Already delicious, it will be better from 2021.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2020  Saint-Véran

description: With superripe fruit, fat and glossy, with rich white fruits, round, dense and concentrated, this is a wine to ooze into the glass. It is perhaps not very Chablis, but delicious as a fine Chardonnay.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2011 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A deliciously creamy wine, shining with apple and grapefruit flavors. The wine is light, bright, softly textured and hinting at wood aging, while displaying a more steely line of tight acidity at the end.
title: Manuel Olivier 2016  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This is an attractively ripe wine that shows the richness of the vintage well. It has yellow fruits along with touches of sultana and sliced apple. The wine is fruity, soft and ready to drink.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2021 Closerie des Alisiers  (Bourgogne)

description: Produced from old vines in the Grand Cru vineyards of Chouilly in the Côte des Blancs, this is a beautifully crisp, ripe wine, showing taut fruit and fine, stylish acidity. As a Special Club bottling, it adheres to stringent qualitative guidelines set out by an elite group of growers. Still young, it will be best from 2023.
designation: Special Club Blanc de Blancs Chouilly Grand Cru Brut
title: Roland Champion 2017 Special Club Blanc de Blancs Chouilly Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Produced from vines high up the Grand Cru slope, this wine is finely textured and stylish while also full-bodied. It has weight, spice from wood aging, precise acidity and a strongly mineral, salty edge. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Soft Chardonnay, nicely balanced between ripe white fruits and some toast. It is an open, generous wine, enjoyable and ready to drink.
title: Antonin Rodet 2013 Bourgogne A. Rodet  (Bourgogne)

description: This value-priced Chard offers a medium-intense bouquet of orange rind, Granny Smith apple and white peach pit followed by a round mouth with accents of apple skins and buttercup. Balanced with a solid finish and low alcohol.
title: Barton & Guestier 2014 B&G; Reserve Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A soft wine that hints at the richness of Meursault, with caramel flavors giving weight, and a distinct citrus and apple character giving freshness. For early drinking.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2013  Meursault

description: One of the rare white wine produced in Beaujolais from Chardonnay. This is fresh with an attractive mineral content, touches of lemon and a ripe final aftertaste.
title: Paul Beaudet 2016 Domaine Romy  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: With light wood-aging flavors, this wine is both ripe and fresh. The touch of toast points up yellow fruits that are generous and rounded. Pineapple and peach are given an edge by the citrus acidity in the aftertaste. Drink from 2021. The family estate has been established since the 14th century.
title: Domaine Ninot 2020 La Barre  (Rully)

description: Firmly touched by wood, this is a rich and also structured wine. It has spice as much as fruit at this stage, the juicy acidity lurking behind the toasty exterior. The wine should balance out but will need time. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2020 Domaine du Pavillon  (Meursault)

description: This is a fresh and full-bodied wine, with ripe yellow fruit and citrus tones—at once warm and with crisply edged. Still young, it shows a strong mineral side that will soften with time. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2021 Authentique  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A deliciously fruity wine, its bright apricot, pineapple and peach flavors open and generous. Of course, there is a more serious core of structure, lemon zest and dryness to promise aging. At the end, though, fruit and a light toastiness give immediate pleasure.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2015 Clavoillon Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: From vineyards on the cooler south bank of the Serein, this wine is crisp and tightly coiled despite the warmth of the 2019 vintage. It's built on a backbone of sturdy minerality, fleshed out with crisp, citrus fruit, and will be ready to drink from late 2021.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2021  Chablis
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: In this great year for white Burgundy, Bâtard-Montrachet shines out as the epitome of balance between superb fruit and intense mineral and terroir characters. Its subtle touch of wood highlights the unctuous surface texture while just hinting at the steel sharpness of the structure beneath. Age this superb wine for at least 10 years.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2016  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: This wine's fresh, fragrant fruit comes with a steely blade of acidity and minerality. It is just beginning to show its concentration, and the citrus and white peach flavors are starting to develop.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2017 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Ripe and fruity, this wine has a full, rich texture, with apple and peach flavors and a toast note. On the finish, there is a citrus-like character from the refreshing acidity. Ready to drink, but it can be cellared for a year.
title: Jaffelin 2016  Meursault

description: Vanilla and ripe fruit aromas and a creamy texture give this wine its rounded fruity character. White fruits, caramel and light spice all come into play. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Tilleuls 2022 Sélection Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: The little touch of wood aging (three months) is just enough to round out the Chardonnay. At the same time, it does show freshness and apple flavors, with an attractive floral character. It is soft and finally ripe.
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2014 Chardonnay (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Fruity and crisp, this bright wine offers flavors of lemon and fresh apple juice. A tangy lemon-zest texture gives great acidity and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Cave des Vignerons de Mancey 2019 Domaie Touzot  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Made in honor of Christian Moreau's father, Guy, this is produced from 70-year-old vines that bestow serious concentration and density. It has as much yellow fruit ripeness as citrus and minerality. Put together, these elements give an ageworthy wine. Drink from 2022.
designation: Cuvée Guy Moreau Vaillon Premier Cru
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2018 Cuvée Guy Moreau Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This textured, ripe wine shows the potential of Chardonnay in the Beaujolais region. The 2.5 acres of vines average seven years in age, so still have a lot of time to mature. Still, the wine has a tight, mineral character balanced by yellow and white fruits as well as refreshing final acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Lathuilière-Gravallon 2020 Roche Noire  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This is a smooth, soft, gently fruity wine, immediately drinkable. An attractive buttery, honeyed character comes from this warm-climate Chardonnay. Yellow fruits are cut with lime acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Tussock Jumper 2021 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: A toasty and buttery wine that is initially smooth and silky. It's only on the mid-palate that the tauter, more steely character of Chablis comes through. With fresh acidity, this easily combines both ripeness and mouthwatering crispness.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine Drouhin-Vaudon Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A finely rounded wine, with lovely ripe peach and pineapple fruits, lifted by a dash of lemon juice. Finely balanced, ripe in character, although always textured and tangy. There is a mouthwatering finish.
title: La Chablisienne 2014 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a yeasty wine that shows a bitter almond character. It has an unattractive hard edge.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2016  Chablis

description: Ripe and full bodied, this is packed with tasty fruits. Notes of pear, apricot and white peach mingle easily together, creating a forward, wine with the right depth of flavor.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2016 Réserve  (Bourgogne)

description: Soft and rounded, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine. It has pear and peach fruits, laced with lime-like acidity and notes of almond and yeast. With its bright, crisp finish, it's a wine to age over the next two years.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2016 Buissonnier  (Montagny)

description: From the Vincent family of Château de Fuissé, this is a ripe wine, with its green plum and nectarine fruits giving it roundness. At the same time, there is a bright, attractive edge of crispness, with a citrusy finish.
title: Vincent 2016 Marie-Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is fragrant and lighthearted, with citrusy acidity that laces through the easy, bright green-apple texture. It's crisp, with a floral finish.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017  Saint-Véran

description: Ripe, smooth and deliciously rounded, this is a generous wine. Spice and yellow fruits are right up front, supported by just enough acidity. The wine is rich and ready to drink.
title: Rijckaert 2021 Vers Chanes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Tight and mineral wine, with a great citrus character, fresh green fruits broadened by wood toast, while the acidity is as crisp as possible. It has a youthful apple skin texture, and would repay a couple of years' aging.
title: William Fèvre 2014 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A wine that delivers great freshness, a bright lemon and grapefruit character, tautly mineral in character, almost steely, with a pure line of green fruits. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine Drouhin-Vaudon Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Balanced, a wine that shows the right richness, spice, great wafts of fresh plums, peaches, lifted by acidity and rounded by a fine wood element.
designation: Domaine des Deux Roches Plénitude e Bonté
title: Collovray et Terrier 2014 Domaine des Deux Roches Plénitude e Bonté  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Spicy, toasty wine, the fruit tropically rich. The texture is dense, the acidity important but not dominant. Delicious wine, now maturing well.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Rounded with a good texture, this is a wine that has a good future. It has weight, fruit that is fresh and well wooded showing plenty of spice and bright acidity.
title: Pierre Vessigaud 2014 Vers Pouilly  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Somewhat earthy and rustic, this is a fresh wine, with citrus notes and some yeastiness. The wine's fruit has finishing liveliness and crispness.
title: Domaine Grossot 2011  Chablis

description: Concentrated and structured, this layers wood and vanilla flavors with a taut, mineral character. With its richness and well-balanced citrus, tropical fruit flaavors, it will certainly age for at least four years. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2016 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a very taut wine from the poorest soil in the Clos des Mouches Vineyard. This tastes of citrus fruit, with a powerful, spicy, complex finish that promises good aging.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016 Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Rich and ultraripe, this is full of yellow fruit, melon and pineapple flavors. Contrasting with this fruitiness are notes of dense wood and spice. It has an elegant structure, with a crisp, citrusy finish.
title: Château de Fuissé 2016 Les Combettes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Still showing its youthful fruity character, this concentrated wine is going to develop richness while always retaining its elegance. The acidity and structured fruit lend a strong sense of minerality, although it keeps its ripeness. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 Champ Gain Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is rich and opulent while still preserving its acidity and concentrated structure. It's floral and minerally, fragrant, round and crisp. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Still tight and closed, this has the potential to be a very fine Grand Cru. It has a tight, steely character, a texture that brings out nervy minerality and the beginnings of rich citrus and white fruits. With the light touch of wood aging, this will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2017 Blanchot Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Part of the domaine of the Gagey family that runs Louis Jadot, this dense, wood-dominated wine has an austere character at this stage. Ripe, potentially full of yellow and creamy white fruits, it will always have a serious side. Drink from 2022.
designation: Le Clos Blanc Beaune Grèves Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2018 Le Clos Blanc Beaune Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is full of steely acidity as well as complex fruit. It is rich, full of toast and spice that show up the generous swathes of yellow fruits that are just beginning to show their glory. It will develop over many years. Drink from 2021.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2018 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Smooth and wonderfully ripe, this honeyed wine has weight and a velvet texture that rolls around the mouth. The tight acidity and crisp texture are enveloped by the embrace of the ripe fruits and generous feel. It's deceptively ready to drink but needs to age, so wait until 2022.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2018 Blanchot Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Dominated at this young stage by wood, this is a potentially rich and creamy wine. Its structure shines through, full and generous. The fruits and the acidity still have to develop, but already the wine is showing the rounded character of a great Pouilly Fuissé. It's a wine to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Château de Fuissé 2018 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Plenty of toastiness in this ripe wine gives an extra element of acidity that needs to be tamed. At the same time, it has good white- and citrus-fruit flavors. Drink this attractive wine from 2021.
title: Christophe Cordier 2020 Vielles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Ripe with tropical-fruit flavors, this wine has good acidity layered with spice and toastiness. A crisper structure behind this generous fruit will allow the wine to age, although it is drinkable now.
title: Loron et Fils 2020 Château de Mirande  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This is a spicy wine, with balanced wood, yellow-fruit flavors and acidity that cuts through the spice and ripeness. A zing of citrus finishes this attractive wine in style.
title: Marcel Couturier 2020 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This wine has a great future, offering good acidity, crisp fruitiness and a tangy aftertaste. But in six months it will reveal a richer yellow fruits that will give it a rounded, ripe character. Wait until 2021.
title: Maurice Martin 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This wine is soft, simple, fruity and ready to drink. It has apple and apricot tones and light acidity to keep it fresh, with a bright and refreshing aftertaste.
title: Louis Chevallier 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: Impressively ripe and dense, with maple syrup and citrus characters giving a delicious, full wine. Kiwi and green plum dominate the fruit, while the concentrated underlying structure gives a soft cushion of richness.
title: Domaine Pommier 2012 Croix aux Moines  (Chablis)

description: This tense, crisp wine is all green fruit, very straight, very fresh. Apple, pink grapefruit and almonds come together in a wine that has no complexity, but offers plenty of pleasure.
title: Domaine Pommier 2013  Chablis

description: Made from hand-harvested Chardonnay from certified biodynamic vineyards, this is a pure, crisply fruited wine. Delicious red apples dominate along with tangy, mineral acidity. As it ages, it will produce a ripe and creamy character. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Lavernette 2019 Vignes de la roche  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Round and softly fruity, this white Burgundy comes with a hint of vanilla. With its ripe apple, lime and yellow fruit flavors, it's instantly drinkable. The finish is touched by acidity.
title: Jaffelin 2016 Les Chapitres de Jaffelin  (Bourgogne)

description: Initially closed, this wine soon reveals a crisp, zesty texture and flavors of citrus and green apple. With its minerally character, Mâcon-Fuissé is a sort of poor man's Pouilly-Fuissé, although it often shows more softness.
title: Domaine Luquet 2017  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Soft and ripe, this Chablis has white fruit and citrus flavors. The palate reveals a yeasty character that intrudes on the fresh fruit.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2017  Chablis

description: Soft and simple, this has a pear flavor, a touch of vanilla and a creamy texture, plus crisp, lemon-zest-like acidity on the finish. Drink this now.
title: Domaine Luquet 2017 Les Mulots  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This ripe, smooth and lightly toasty wine is a rich product of this warm vintage for whites. Yellow and ripe melon fruits are balanced by sufficient crisp acidity to give the wine a bright edge. Drink from 2022.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Collection  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Wood and spice aromas lead to wood and rich yellow-fruit flavors, creating a warm character that's immediately attractive. With final acidity, this tangy wine is well balanced. Drink now.
title: Louis Max 2022  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine

description: Wood and spice flavors add extra richness to an already-ripe wine. Opulent and full, it's laced with toast and warm mango and peach fruits. A wine to drink young, it's ready now.
title: Pierre Chardigny 2021 Les Cornillaux  (Saint-Véran)

description: Ripe fruit aromas show alongside an equally rich, creamy palate. This wine has attractive lemon and crisp apple flavors, touched by wood to give a smooth, rich aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2022  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: Based in the Côte des Blancs, this producer has made a soft, ripe style of Blanc de Blancs. It's smooth and creamy in texture, drinkable now with its hint of toastiness balanced by crisper apple flavors.
designation: Grand Bouquet Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Vazart Coquart & Fils 2016 Grand Bouquet Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is anything but a simple Chablis. Made from organically grown grapes, it's smooth, ripe and generous. Old vines in the blend lend concentration—loaded with apple and pear flavors and just the right amount of acidity. It's s ready to drink.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 Dame Nature  (Chablis)

description: This textured and toasty wine shows a gentle acidity through its spice and warm apple and apricot flavors. Its mineral edge is tangy, zesty and attractive. Built to age for the medium term, it will be ready drink from 2023.
title: Labouré-Roi 2021 Les Baudines Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: There is a great balance here between the creamy fruit and the wood flavors. Apricots, ripe apples and melon are spiced with the right amount of toastiness. The wine has a rich, warm feel. It is still young, so wait until 2019 to drink.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2017 Les Charmes Dessus  (Santenay)

description: Because strong toast aromas show through this wine, its attractive full fruit will need time to come through. The wine, with its firm, almost red-wine structure, needs to age until 2020 before drinking.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2017  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: A very soft, fruity wine, with a gentle, creamy texture and light acidity. It's fresh with vanilla and pear flavors, and ready to drink.
title: Cave de Lugny 2018 Florières  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Very firm and tight, with streaks of mineral and textures of earth. Unyielding and a bit over-sulfered, but it hints and depth and concentration.
title: Louis Latour 2004 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Scents of pineapple and hazelnuts open into a lush, spicy, forward, slightly toasty wine with immediate drinkablility and appeal.
title: Louis Latour 2004  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Richly scented with citrus blossoms, mineral and spice. Nicely balanced and light, the flavors are layered and intermingled through an elegant, firm, satisfying finish.
title: Louis Latour 2004 Château de Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Aromas of this wine show considerable wood. On the palate, the wood is very present, giving acidity as well as layers of toast and spice. Hints of yellow fruit show through, suggesting the possibility of a ripe, rich wine in the future. Drink from 2023.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Bastion Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This ripe, fruity, rounded wine has a soft texture, rich apricot fruit and just enough acidity. The texture is immediately attractive—fruity with a touch of crispness at the end. Drink now.
title: Lafage 2021 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a simple, fruity wine. It has a pear flavor, light minerality and a zingy aftertaste. Smooth and rounded, it looks as though it will be ready to drink from early 2021.
title: Domaine Trouillet 2021 Coeur de Pouilly  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a densely textured wine, full of flavors of lemon zest and green apples. The intense fruitiness lights the palate with a crisp feel as well as final, tight acidity.
title: Rijckaert 2017 En Paradis Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: Crisp and steely, this is a bright and fruity wine. It has a tight texture cut with acidity and citrus flavors. The wine is lively, packed with fruitiness that has a delicious refreshing aftertaste. Drink from late 2021.
title: Etienne Boileau 2020 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Sourced from the same three parcels each vintage, this is shot through with minerality and tight acidity. There is fruit behind this tension and that gives the wine both balance and also aging potential. Drink this complex wine from 2022.
designation: Closerie des Alisiers Trilogie de Terroirs
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2020 Closerie des Alisiers Trilogie de Terroirs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Although this is not a premier cru, this 33-acre vineyard sits right next to some of Meursault's finest vines. The wine is mineral, tight and textured— a wine that should age. With touches of oak, spice and intense yellow fruits, it is ripe while still closed at this stage. It certainly needs aging and will be ready from 2023.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Narvaux  (Meursault)

description: It's obvious that Pernand-Vergelesses can produce great Chardonnay since part of the Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru is in the village. This is a cool wine, crisp with textured acidity and age-worthy acidity and toast. The wine is taut, spicy and moves strongly in the citrus direction. Lime and tangerine flavors are strong along with a complex mineral structure. Drink from 2023.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Pernand-Vergelesses

description: The wine comes from the Leflaive home village and the blend (from more than 20 parcels) demonstrates the intimate knowledge the family has with its terroir. It has a fine balance between the ripe yellow and white stone fruits and acidity. These are given structure by the wood aging and strong mineral texture. This is still developing and still filling out, so drink from 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Situated at the entrance to the Saint-Aubin valley, this chalky vineyard gives a wine with tight tense minerality. Its lemon and grapefruit flavors are bright with acidity. The wood aging shows through in vanilla flavors that give a smooth edge to the wine. Drink from 2023.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2020 Combes au Sud Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: A structured, cool wine that is poised and elegant, it has a lightly creamy texture cut by apple and pear flavors. Definitely mineral, it is textured with fruit skins and flavored with the oak aging. It needs to be aged, so don't drink before 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2018 Réserve Personelle  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This attractive village wine has ripe fruits as well as a more steely texture. Wood flavors give smoothness that rounds out the wine and enhances the yellow fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2017  Puligny-Montrachet

description: La Garenne is one of the highest in elevation of the Puligny Premier Crus. This wine, with its young wood and ample fruit flavors shows great minerality, texture and intensity. Packed with apple, citrus and ripe yellow fruits, it is still fresh and needing many years to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2019 La Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This full-bodied, ripe and generous wine is already open for drinking. It has rich green and white fruits, sliced pear and quince with a topping of lime juice. Toast gives a broader character. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Fuissé 2018  Saint-Véran

description: This is a warm, rich wine. Its fruit is muted at this stage although there's potential in the good acidity and smooth, juicy texture. Let it open out more and drink from 2022.
title: Pierre-Yves et Olivier Fichet 2022 Château London  (Mâcon)

description: A ripe, full wine, immediately accessible, speaking both of minerality and fresh acidity. The fruit goes right to the green apples, kiwi and juicy lemon flavors, but the structure is bold and rounds out these crisp fruits. A wine for aging, perhaps 2–3 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A wine that brings out soft richness, with a creamy apple texture layered with green plum skin tannins. The wine has some tautness as well, giving a tight structure that opens up. There's a great mineral, steely streak, with freshness showing through on the finish.
title: Faiveley 2013 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Peach and apricot flavors dominate this ripe, full-bodied wine that has plenty of acidity to back up the richness. Still developing, it will emerge as a ripe, concentrated wine that will be generous and full. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Christophe Perraud 2020  Saint-Véran
