description: This wine is pure and fruity, with a strong, tight line of minerality. It is perfumed with apple and grapefruit flavors and a light touch of wood, with good acidity at the end. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2020  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This crisp wine is currently tightly closed. It is textured and mineral, with apple and citrus flavors coming through slowly. This perfumed wine needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Alex Gambal 2020  Puligny-Montrachet

description: A toasty, smoky element to this concentrated wine balances with the rich apricot fruit and the mineral texture. Acidity and a citrus line cut through the generous, full flavors. The aftertaste shows the wine is still young. Wait to drink until 2021.
title: Rijckaert 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This feels fittingly warm for a southern Burgundy wine. It's ripe with yellow fruit, a soft texture, attractive acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Pierre Gruber 2021  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a light wine with tropical fruit flavors. The acidity and notes of almond and white fruit add to its rounded, ready-to-drink feel.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2016  Hautes Cotes de Beaune

description: Soft and rounded, this is touched by a note of vanilla that adds extra openness. With its apple and pear flavors, this is an attractive, fruity wine; it's very forward, but it shows a note of Chablis steel in the background.
title: Château de Maligny 2016  Chablis

description: This has herb and wood aromas, leading to a palate that's structured, with a yeasty, toasty flavor and a green, herbal character. It is quite tight, and does need to age for at least two years.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2016 Clos du Cromin  (Meursault)

description: A beautifully shaped wine that exudes richness balanced with lively fresh fruits. There is a tautness and minerality that adds complexity to the pineapple and spice flavors. The wine opens well in the mouth, ripeness and full fruit flavors melding easily. Delicious.
title: Xavier Monnot 2012 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Ripe and soft, here is a Chanson white that hasn't been overwhelmed by wood. Instead, the delicious yellow and white stone fruits come through, with a creamy edge reminiscent of buttered English muffins, finishing on a high note of juicy, thirst-quenching acidity.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011 Clos Saint-Jean Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: A premier cru that could almost be grand cru in quality terms, this is a big, ripe wine, the powerful yellow and green plum flavors spiced with some wood aging. There's a great, full-bodied explosion of fruit in the mouth, but the mineral edge of the wine suggests aging potential, perhaps even more  ageable than the 2009 vintage.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Vaulorent Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: New wood and yellow fruit aromas give an exotic spice- and caramel-flavored wine. The acidity is rounded, sweet, delicious, lifted by intense new wood flavors. This is a rich Chardonnay, well tempered by final crispness.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Made from 70-year-old vines planted by Christian Moreau's father, Guy, this wine shows extra concentration, certainly, but also the pure pleasure of ripe, delicious Chardonnay. It's initially tight, but the rich green fruits and toast soon come forward to give an impressively big wine, and one worth aging.
designation: Cuvée Guy Moreau Vaillon Premier Cru
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2012 Cuvée Guy Moreau Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: A tight, vivid wine that expresses pure Chardonnay with a steely eye. The wine is flinty, the green fruits and apple skin texture dominant. There is some wood, but the lightest touch. The finish shows some crisp, lemony acidity.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A touch of sweet spice jazzes up the nose, giving lift to the lightly baked apple and yellow peach characteristics. The round, medium-bodied palate has lively acidity and a sweet orange-oil flavored finish.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2016 Réserve Spéciale Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: A powerful wine, still closed. It has great potential with delicious acidity at the same time as depth of flavor complexity. This is a wine for the long-term, so give it at least seven years.
title: Domaine Luc et Lise Pavelot 2017  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Flavors of apples, pears and lemons compose this ripe, friendly wine. It has nutmeg and wood flavors along with a warm and rounded character. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: The fruitiness in this tight wine is still developing, hiding for now behind a bitter, toasty character. That should soften as the wine fills out—from 2022.
title: Nicolas Potel 2019 La Pucelle Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: This domaine is now sold through the Jean-Marc Brocard family. This is a rich wine with yellow fruit as well as crisper citrus. There is a touch of pepper that lifts the fine acidity and the ripe apple and peach. At the end, the wine is crisp and clean.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2021 Les Grandes Vignes  (Chablis)

description: This wine from the Côte Chalonnaise is a lighter style of Chardonnay than Leflaive's rich Côte de Beaune wines. It's a delicious lightly toasty wine that has crisp acidity and a strong and refreshing dose of lemon juice. The wine is creamy at the end. It will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Les Cloux Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich, spicy and with a stylish combination of acidity and rich yellow and white fruits. The acidity cuts through the ripe texture and gives the wine its full-bodied character. The aftertaste shows a wine that is still young and will be best from 2022.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2020 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: This recently released 2006 is still showing its youth, with a firm, mineral edge to it. But it does have the right refreshingly crisp character, along with intense fruits, and acidity that just powers right through. Wait 3–4 years.
designation: Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2008 Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Very light mango, pineapple and banana aromas are joined by flowers and minerals. Nutty notes are brought to the fore on the dry and stony palate. Finishes broad and long, with echos of the floral and mineral notes on the nose. Now it's pretty tight; best in 2006 and beyond.
title: Domaine Laroche 2003 Les Blanchots  (Chablis)

description: A super-rich wine, packed with peach and green plum fruits, layers of wood and an intense concentration. An impressive wine that shows weight and richness as well as style.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2013 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: An appropriately rich wine, full, toasty and dense. The fruit is beautifully balanced with ripe acidity, just a touch of spice, citrus and an opulent, full-bodied character. It will certainly age, but is already very drinkable.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2014  Corton-Charlemagne

description: On the south bank of the River Serein, Sécher is one of the lesser known Premier Crus. This is a cool, crisp wine, emphasizing both green fruits and an underlying buttery touch. Beautifully integrated acidity frames the wine.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine Drouhin-Vaudon Sécher Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This comes from an underrated appellation, in the shadow of the Corton-Charlemagne vineyard. It's touched lightly by wood aging, showing ripe yellow fruit and a cool streak of minerality. Still young, it's developing well and will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021  Pernand-Vergelesses

description: A rich, yet finely structured wine, this is full of acidity and bright green and yellow fruits. It's delicious, mouth-filling and refreshing, touched by notes of wood and citrus, with a smooth, toasty finish.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2016 Les Champréaux  (Chablis)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a rounded, simple wine. It has apple and light spice and a gentle texture that is already approachable. Juicy and fresh, not a wine for aging, it is ready to drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020 Les Enfants Terribles Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)

description: A young wine, with crisp apple and grapefruit salad freshness. It is bright, glowing with vibrant fruit and a light touch of toast.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2014  Saint-Véran

description: A lightly smoky aroma shows the wood aging of this wine. It is toasty, with a mineral touch, and the ripe yellow fruits are developing well. Smooth and potentially rich, this needs a few more months to show at its best. Drink from 2019.
title: La Soufrandière 2018 Clos de Grand Père  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: Elegant and full of fruit, it has just the right steely edge. It offers richness as well, with lemon and pear fruits showing strongly. Acidity gives a bright aftertaste to this wine that will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2017 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Full of warm fruit and light spice, this generous wine is rich with yellow fruits balanced by bright acidity and vanilla. The rounded texture and ripe fruit mean the wine is very ready to drink.
title: Clos des Rocs 2021 En Chantone  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This ripe, full-bodied wine is made from biodynamically grown grapes. Although rich, it has enough acidity to keeps it crisp and fruity. The wine is balanced and delicious, ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Guillemot-Michel 2021 Quintaine  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This wine is tight and flinty. Crisp lemon and apple flavors are textured with a steely character that needs time to broaden out. Drink this mineral wine from 2023.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2022 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A mineral-driven wine, this is tangy-zesty, with a tight texture. Great fruit shines through the crispness. Balanced, ripe and with some potential, the wine will be ready from late 2022.
title: Domaine Perraud 2021  Saint-Véran

description: This blend from several vineyards is a soft, rounded wine. It has a good balance between acidity and ripe white and yellow fruits, shot through with acidity. A touch of toast adds spice to the mix. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: On the right bank of the Serein river, Vaucoupin gives rich wines, showing its sunny exposition. This bottling is ripe, full in the mouth and intense with fragrant white fruits, vanilla and youthful acidity. With freshness still to the fore, it will age and will be better from 2021.
title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2019 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Very soft and dull, it offers white fruits and some acidity. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2018 En Paradis  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: The wine is candied and sherbet-flavored. Acidity gives some freshness, but it feels artificial and light.
title: Manuel Seguin 2018  Viré-Clessé

description: This is a rich textured wine from the center of this Premier Cru. It has structure and concentration as well as generous white stone fruits. Densely packed with acidity, toast and a fine, creamy texture, the wine is likely to age well. It is produced from biodynamically grown grapes (as are all the Olivier Leflaive family Grand and Premier Crus). Drink from 2024.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Clos Saint-Marc Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a domaine wine, coming from one of the vineyards owned by Olivier Leflaive and worked biodynamically. It is a very fine wine from probably the most well-known premier cru in the village. With its rich acidity and white fruits, it is generous as well as crisply textured. The toast from the wood aging adds its juicy character to this impressive wine. Drink from 2023.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: From old vines, as are most of the wines from this producer, this is a dense and powerful wine. New wood aging has given the wine a strongly toasty character balanced with creamy apple and yellow fruits. The wine is concentrated and obviously needs to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Roche de Bellene 2020  Corton-Charlemagne

description: This wine is tangy and zesty, with a strong mineral texture that partners with the perfumed acidity, lively fruitiness and citrus flavors. It is likely to age well because of its tight texture. Drink from 2024.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2021  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Wood aromas provide a toasty character that dominates the fruit. It will take time for the apple and pear fruit flavors to show. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Françoise André 2021 Sous Frétille Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: A light, fragrant Chardonnay, this wine feels cool and soft. There are attractive plum and greengage flavors, as well as a gentle touch of acidity. This is pure fruitiness, with no wood aging.
title: Domaine de l'Herré 2018 Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A soft style of Blanc de Blancs, rounded as much as crisp, this is an attractively ripe and fruity wine. Apple and grapefruit flavors are filled out with perfumed acidity and a lively, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Chassenay d'Arce 2011 Blanc de Blancs Millésimé Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Grown in the far north of Beaujolais, almost in Burgundy's Mâcon region, this full and ripe Chardonnay is full of spice and toast as well as rich yellow fruits. It is still young, with intense citrus flavors, so wait to drink until 2020.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2020 Fleur de  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Crisp and young, this wine, from 50-year-old vines, is tangy and strongly mineral in texture. It is full of fresh fruit that reflects the of organic and biodynamic farming. The green fruits will fill out as it ages. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Lavernette 2020 Maison du Villard  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: With attractive wood aromas, this is rich and bright, with touches of butteriness. It has weight and plenty of ripe fruit. The acidity at the end is fresh and crisp.
title: Domaine Ferret 2018 Les Perrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A soft wine with attractive fruitiness and lemon and lime flavors. Fresh and rounded, it shows its northern French origins with the tight acidity at the end.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2017 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Wood flavors initially dominate this wine. Then the more fruity character shows through to give a toast and citrus character, rounded while tightly textured. The wine has some aging potential, although it could be drunk now.
title: Bret Brothers 2018 Climat La Martine  (Mâcon-Uchizy)

description: The chalky soil yields a crisp, textured wine with yellow fruits to round it out. There is a steely edge and just a touch of wood, while the aftertaste is packed with acidity.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2017 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: This is fruity, with an apple flavor that's lifted by a lemon zest edge. It's warm with a rich, minerally tautness; a caramel note comes through on the finish.
title: Vincent 2016 JJ Bourgogne Blanc  (Bourgogne)

description: Soft, smooth and buttery, this is full of ripe tropical fruits and bright, citrusy acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine de la Batie  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is a blend of several parcels throughout the appellation including some Premier Crus. It has the power of the appellation along with the elegant Leflaive house style. That makes for a fine structured wine with great acidity, apple and pineapple fruit and a strongly mineral aftertaste. Drink starting from 2023.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Quintessence is a good name for this wine that has the minerality and the structure that are the soul of the appellation. In addition it offers apricot and pear fruitiness and intense acidity. This wine is so drinkable now, although it will be much better from 2022.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2020 Quintessence  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft Chardonnay, with pear and walnut flavors, light acidity and rounded buttery flavors. There is an attractive final richness.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2015 Laforet  (Bourgogne)

description: The wine with a Polynesian family history is full of tropical fruit flavors, includig mango and pineapple, and only light acidity. It's a curious wine, slightly oxidized, grassy and super-ripe at the same time. Drink now.
title: Château Saint-Sernin 2020 Varua Maohi Domaine de Saint-Sernin Chardonnay (Côtes du Lot)

description: This single-parcel wine gives fresh youthful acidity and bright white and citrus fruitiness. It's chalky textured, steely in its character and crisp and nervy at the end. Drink from late 2019
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2019 Les Champréaux  (Chablis)

description: Ripe yellow fruits shine through this attractive wine. It has a fresh, crisp side with lemon acidity that nicely balances the warm, rounded texture. It delivers a crisp, more mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Tramier et Fils 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine has a creamy, smooth character. Lightly buttery and with some ripe pear flavors, it is soft, refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Echelette 2021  Mâcon-Cruzille

description: This wine is tight with the lightest hints of riper fruit in the future. It has spice, toast flavors and suggestions of yellow fruit. Wait to drink this wine until 2021.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Ripe and smooth, this rich wine has enough fruitiness and acidity to give a crisper edge, although it is more about a warm, spicy character. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2020  Saint-Véran

description: Wood and ripe fruitiness are the hallmarks of this open, rounded wine.Attractive apple and citrus flavors give a lemon zest character. At the end, the acidity comes in strongly.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2018 Mersault-Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: It's plump and juicy, yet not devoid of structure, blending Asian pear and citrus aromas and flavors with nectarine skin and bitter almond. There's a softness to the finish that causes it to lose a little definition but helps it go down easy.
title: Louis Latour 2006  Meursault

description: One of a range of single-vineyard wines from Château de Fuissé, this is powerful and complex. It's intense, with white fruit flavors that are laced with concentrated, wood-influenced notes. It has an opulent, generous feel, while remaining structured.
title: Château de Fuissé 2016 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: From this rich vintage comes this delicious, open wine. Flavors of tropical fruit and peach create an opulent and generous feel, with notes from having aged in wood offering complexity. It's concentrated and ageworthy, worth keeping for 4–5 years and more.
title: La Chablisienne 2015 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Wood and ripe fruit flavors drive this explosively fruity wine. Its richness is balanced by the acidity from green apple and lime fruits. Spice from the wood aging adds piquancy, leads to a final burst of textured minerality.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This shows a hint of mineral along with tropical fruit. This is a seductive combination that shows richness and a taut, nervy character. Age for at least six years.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2016 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is grandiose, with ripe apricot and peach flavors—even a note of mango—that are allied to the wood notes. As a contrast, there is fine acidity and elegance, with a lemon zest edge that gives structure to this full, superripe, powerful effort.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Using grapes sourced from 50-year-old vines, this is a powerful expression of rich Chardonnay. It has great depth of flavor, with concentrated, intense and ripe yellow and white fruits, spiced from having aged in the wood. Allow to age for over five years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2015 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is crisp, with citrus and red apple fruits that are heightened by the taut structure. Nervy acidity adds to the tense feel while judicious layers of wood warm the finish. For long-term aging.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: A wine with just the right Meursault opulence already the dominant character. The wine is fat, ripe, not losing sight of acidity or freshness, combining yellow fruits with a crisp, citrus final streak.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Meursault

description: This is soft, full of ripe white fruit flavors. The wine is broad, showing some freshness along with the forward richness. It is likely to age relatively quickly.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A heavily wood-aged wine, this wine has smoky, burnt-toast aromas. At the moment, ripe yellow-fruit flavors are submerged beneath this onslaught of wood, but it should integrate better, so give it until 2020.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2017 Mersault-Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Showing its wood strongly, this toasty wine seems to have lost the fruit. Some attractive acidity at the end helps compensate. Drink now.
title: Bret Brothers 2018 Les Mûres  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Fresh and fruity, this crisp wine comes from a region near Chablis. Good acidity, lively citrus and a cool feel all work well together.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2017  Bourgogne Vézelay

description: The wine is soft, fruity and ready to drink, with attractive fruitiness, soft acidity and a touch of wood. With a crisp aftertaste, it offers freshness as well.
title: Clos des Rocs 2018 Clos des Rocs Monopole  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: A tight, mineral-driven wine, it has both great fruit and acidity. It is tangy, pushing forward crisp lemon and apple skin flavors and a touch of peach. Drink now.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2018 Les Vignes de Joanny  (Mâcon-Davayé)

description: This wine brings out the structure inherent in this vineyard. Tensely textured with young fruits that have a touch of bitterness, the wine offers kiwi and green plum flavors given a more exotic character with some mango. It's a deeply structured wine that needs to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Pinson 2019 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Perfumed and floral, this is a wine with weight and richness. There is a lot of structure here, concentrated rich yellow and white fruits giving a textured and mineral wine. It comes from a property vinified by Drouhin for 70 years. The wine is for aging; drink from 2023.
designation: Marquis de Laguiche Morgeot Premier Cru
title: Joseph Drouhin 2019 Marquis de Laguiche Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: From vines on the sunny side of the vineyard, this wine is richly textured and structured, full of generous yellow and white fruits, spice and layers of wood aging. It has a honeyed character, typical of 2017, with a tight, taut, crisp acidity at the end. Drink this strongly structured wine from 2023.
title: William Fèvre 2019 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine has a rich, fat, almost buttery character. Certainly the acidity is there, although it has a warm, summer feel. The structure typical of Les Clos is all there as well, giving concentration and density. At the end spice goes with the extreme freshness of the citrus aftertaste. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2019 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This rich, generous and soft wine has a ripe feel along with plenty of acidity. The freshness is cushioned by ripe yellow and pear fruit flavors. It has power as well as minerality, and a touch of toast comes through at the end. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2019 Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: From ripe fruits, in the Pinson style, this is a rich, generous and concentrated wine. There is great fruitiness from the ripe apricot and pear flavors, cut with acidity to give an edge of freshness. Spice and fragrant acidity mark the finish.
title: Domaine Pinson 2019 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This offers toast and spice aromas, with opulent apricots and white peaches along with intense freshness from the acidity and linear structure. The wood aging just shows through in the roundness of the wine, while leaving room for a fresh, crisp, mineral aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
designation: Clos de la Garenne Premier Cru
title: Joseph Drouhin 2019 Clos de la Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: A very mineral, flinty character comes through the powerful texture of this rich, dense wine. The ripest, almost honeyed fruit is cut by lime, lemon and orange peel. It is a complex wine for aging; drink from 2023.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2019 Drouhin-Vaudon Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is the coolest and freshest of the Grand Cru vineyards. The wine is tight, steely with a nervy core of acidity that gives it a textured, structured character. It is full of energy, crisp, packed with apples and citrus and needing several years aging. Drink from 2024.
title: William Fèvre 2019 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This apple-crisp wine has tight acidity and touches of wood rounded out by yellow fruits. It is ripe and very full, the nervy, mineral character contrasting with the richness that is now developing. It will age slowly, so don't drink before 2024.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2019 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This is a steely wine, tight with acidity and lemon fruits. It has a mineral, tangy texture that is still calming down, which suggests a young wine that needs time. Certainly the fruit is all there, if with a nervy character. Drink the wine from 2022.
title: Louis Max 2019 Les Plantenays  (Rully)

description: This is the freshest apple and citrus-driven wine. It has great fruitiness allied to acidity and a soft, creamy structure. Drink in 2018.
title: Cave de Lugny 2018 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: Very dry and steely, this offers crisp acidity plus butter and wood flavors that bring out citrus as well as white peach fruits. With five years aging, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Rolet Père et Fils 2015 Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)

description: A nice richness and light honey note permeate the bouquet, accenting the solid core of red apple skin, peach pit and dried vanilla bean. Medium weight, with a very attractive sweet spice and charred egg-bread accented finish.
title: Sieur d'Arques 2015 Toques et Clochers Océanique Chardonnay (Limoux)

description: Rich, creamy wood-aged wine that shows pear, apple and toast flavors ane even a hint of honey. Smooth and textured, it has fine final spice and acidity to add further interest.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2015 Eléve en Fûts de Chêne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A beautifully ripe and rounded wood-aged wine. It brings out all the opulence of Meursault while keeping a tight, textured element as counterpoint. The wood flavors are beginning to blend into the lychee and peach flavors, promising an even richer experience in a few months.
title: Vincent Sauvestre 2015 Clos des Tessons  (Meursault)

description: Smoothly toasty wine, the wood element broadening the light apple fruit without overwhelming it. This attractive, basic Chablis has a fine, taut layer of acidity, grapefruit and apple juice crispness.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2014  Chablis
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Alive and dainty with soft orange blossom notes paired with fresh red apple slices and a touch of nuttiness. The mouth is more of the same, with a distinct peach pit flavor unfolding on the medium-length finish.
title: Domaines Astruc 2015 dA Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: A rich and rounded single-vineyard Chardonnay. It has weight and a smoky character to go with the peach, kiwi and lime juice flavors. The acidity is light, but does give a line of freshness.
title: Cave de Lugny 2015 La Carte  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This offers a tight texture, toast and spice flavors, and intense juicy acidity. With a firm structure and concentration, it has potential for long-term aging. The yellow fruits are beginning to open up while the more citric character is already giving the wine great freshness. Drink from 2022.
title: Chartron et Trébuchet 2019 Les Embazées Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wine is closed and firm in character, but has considerable potential. It has the makings of a mineral and spice-flavored wine that is textured while showing ripe yellow fruits and a citrus backdrop. It needs to wait; drink from 2021.
title: Chartron et Trébuchet 2019  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This structured, mineral wine has a fine tension between tight acidity and zesty acidity that gives it a nervy, crisp character. It is still developing, with its steely structure still dominant; drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Carrette 2019 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: While Savigny is better known for its red wines, its whites have a rich, soft character that makes them accessible when young. This wine, from 40-year-old vines and aged lightly in wood, is structured, mineral and full of crisp green and white fruits. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2018  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: This ripe and full-bodied wine has a wonderful balance between pure acidity and ripe yellow fruits. From chalk and clay soils, it's both mineral and rich, both fresh and warm. It could be drunk now, although it will be much better from 2020.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2019 Authentique  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Bringing together old vines from a number of the Chablisienne cooperative's vineyards, this wine is concentrated and finely structured. Its rich creamed apple and tangy orange zest flavors are lit by acidity and a mineral edge. Drink from 2022.
title: La Chablisienne 2020 Les Vénérables  (Chablis)

description: This wine is rich and rounded, with some wood flavors and plenty of spice. Creamy with swathes of ripe pear and quince flavors, it's just now ready to drink and has a great balance between acidity and richness.
title: Domaine Dugois 2021 Terre de Marne Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: Strongly wood-aged, this is a ripe, toasty wine. The citrus and creamed apple fruits are still working their way through the wood flavors. It's going to be richly fruity wine with a round texture that is cut by acidity. Give it time and drink from 2022.
title: Louis Jadot 2018 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The wine is structured and concentrated, showing a strong sense of minerality. Citrus and ripe apple fruits are complemented by richer apricot, always cut through with acidity and a tense texture. It needs to age, drink from 2020.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2018  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This soft wine is ripe and creamy. With fruit mainly from the southern Burgundy, it offers warm apricot and spice flavors. As a contrast, the zesty texture adds a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Boutinot 2021 Domaine des Terreaux  (Bourgogne)

description: Ripe tropical fruits permeate this ready-to-drink wine. Pineapple and mango flavors have just enough acidity to keep this generous wine crisp. Drink now.
title: Château de Lavernette 2021 Cuvée Jean-Jacques de Boissieu  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a rich style of Burgundy, broad and full of yellow fruits. These are cut by acidity, a lime-zest character that pushes the fruitiness right forward. Drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2021  Bourgogne

description: A simple, soft Chardonnay from the Mâconnais region, this is rounded. A touch of caramel adds extra flavor to the warm fruit. Green plum and melon dominate this wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: Without any wood aging, the wine shows just the yeastiness from aging on the lees. That fills the palate with spice and a touch of pepper. The wine needs a little more time. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Sauvat 2021 Anthéus Chardonnay

description: While this shows the ripeness of the vintage, it remains very minerally in style, with a lemony crispness to match with its white fruit flavor, tight texture and taut finish.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is a ripe and smoothly textured wine. It is already finely balanced, rich with toast, apricot fruits and a tight, mineral character. It is enjoyable now but will age well until 2022.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2018 Quintessence  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: From vines planted in 1955, this is a ripe, fruit-packed and mineral-driven wine. It has succulent green fruits, laced with lemon zest and firmly textured. It needs to age for several years to reveal its full potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2018 Fourchaume Premier Cru Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: Fine and fresh, this has clean fruit, a touch of caramel along with crisp white peach and creamy apple. The wine is light, soft, accessible now.
title: Henri de Villamont 2013  Saint-Véran

description: Caramel aromas give this wine a rich, full and almost sweet character. It has weight, a warm feel cut with pear and quince acidity. It needs to be drunk now.
title: Clos des Rocs 2019 Clos des Rocs Monopole  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: The aromas suggest this wine has too much wood for its own good. The palate is just rich enough to sustain all that toast, while also allowing room for some crisp white and green fruits. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2019 Sur la Carrière  (Saint-Véran)

description: Soft and fruity, this lightly spicy wine has refreshing acidity over orange and lemon fruitiness. It is lightly structured with some minerality, leaving a delicious, fragrant character. Drink now.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2019  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: This is a spicy, fresh wine with cinnamon alongside fragrant acidity. It's crisply fruity, full of balanced acidity and deliciously aromatic. With its ripe apricot flavors, this wine is ready to drink.
title: Christophe Cordier 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Yeasty aromas and a tangy herbal character certainly make for an unusual Chardonnay. It is closer to the Jura's Vin Jaune than it is to any normal fruity wine. Drink now for its fascinating flavors.
title: Domaine de Savagny 2017 Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)

description: This ripe wine is still young. It has a taut texture that's dominated by the lively white fruit and crisp acidity. There's a mineral streak that cuts through the wine to give a steely texture that will soften over the next year. Drink from the end of 2022.
title: Voirin-Jumel 2016 Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Fermented and aged in four-year-old French oak barrels, this wine is ripe, creamy and fruity. It has a rounded character with flavors of pears and apricots to give richness. Refreshing with its zing of acidity at the end, it is ready to drink. Robert Perroud's family has been making wine since 1789. He began a vineyard conversion to biodynamic practices and considers making wine an art.
title: Robert Perroud 2020  Beaujolais-Villages

description: There's a distinct salinity to this Chard, complementing the green apple and hard peach flavors. Notes of sweet lemony citrus linger on the mouthwatering finish.
title: Marrenon 2015 Les Grains Chardonnay (Mediterranée)

description: Jacquesson is proud possessor of top quality grand cru vineyards in Avize. This vintage is subtle, a wine that takes a while to show all its richness, balanced with elegance. The fruit is ripe pear, peach and orange zest. It has a great streak of minerality. Worth aging.
designation: Avize Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Jacquesson et Fils 2006 Avize Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Balanced and brightly fruity, this is laden with acidity and a ripe apple flavor. With its touch of vanilla, this is full and crisply delicious. Ready to drink now.
title: William Fèvre 2016 Champs Royaux  (Chablis)

description: Crisp and cool, this shows a vanilla flavor that softens the attractive tight, acidic fruit. It's light in texture, with a prominent tang of citrus.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2016 Clos Philippe-le-Hardi  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: This is delicate and crisply fruity. Its acidity and citrus presence offer a fragrant character that contrasts nicely with the more creamy texture.
title: La Chablisienne 2017 Pas si Petit  (Petit Chablis)

description: A delicious, refreshingly crisp wine, this has an excellent balance between acidity and bright apple fruits. In the background, the wood aging and vanilla flavors give an extra dimension. Drink now.
title: Domaine Ferret 2021 Tournant de Pouilly  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The white wines of Pernand-Vergelesses have managed to preserve a cool, crisp character even in warm 2019. This wine has the citrus well to the fore along with flavors of wood aging and spice. It is tangy and mineral, with a bright textured aftertaste. Drink from 2024.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2021 Sous Frétilles Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Soft, rounded and fruity, with apple flavors, this is pretty anonymous in character. Drink now.
designation: Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly
title: Eric Louis 2022 Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This light-bodied wine shows citrus and green fruit touches. It has a soft aftertaste that makes it attractive and ready to drink.
title: Tussock Jumper 2022 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: With just that extra bottle age, the wine shows ripe quince and apricot flavors, with a suggestion of artichoke and a rounded texture. Soft and open, this is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Garnier Fils 2014 Grains Dorés  (Chablis)

description: This creamy wine has soft fruit flavors and light acidity. It has a touch of spice as well as pear and melon fruits. The texture is warm, ripe and rounded with just enough acidity at the end to keep the wine buoyant. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Colombier 2021 Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

description: This wine is rounded, rich and full of ripe fruit. Its wood flavors, giving spice and vanilla, are a backdrop to the generous apricot and pear flavors and good acidity. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2021 Sous Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This premier-cru vineyard, wholly owned by the Devillard family, has produced a broad, ripe wine. It is generous, somewhat muted at this stage although promising plenty of citrus and yellow fruits and acidity as it ages. The wood aging creates a smooth hint at the back. Drink from 2021.
designation: Château de Chamirey La Mission Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Château de Chamirey La Mission Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This balanced wine, full of ripe fruits, also has good acidity and a crisp citrus edge. It conveys a warm character, the apricot freshened by lemon flavors and given a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Yves Giroux 2021 Les Raidillons  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Beaujolais is an increasingly attractive source of inexpensive Chardonnay. This perfumed wine is warm with yellow fruits as well as crisper green plum and citrus flavors. With a touch of toastiness and caramel it is ripe and smooth, ready to drink now.
title: Château de Lavernette 2020 Les Vignes de la Roche  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Notes of chalk, bread and stone precede the bruised apple notes on this beautiful, elegant vintage Crémant. On the palate, the apple notes become fuller and rounder and appear like mellow, baked Golden Delicious. There is purity, structure and precision in the autolytic notes which are supported by pure citrus and apple freshness, leaving the palate impressed but not weighed down. Hints of spice develop in the background while all the freshness makes for a lip-smacking, long and savory finish.
title: Boeckel 2018 Extra Brut Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: From a small vineyard in the north of the Côte de Nuits, this is a rare white wine in a red-wine region. Lightly toasty, it has spice, pear flavors and perfumed acidity. It's bright and crisp, ending with lively acidity.
title: Alex Gambal 2020  Fixin

description: This ripe, full wine has an attractive spice and toast character. Warm yellow fruits and a rich feel indicate the generous, rounded potential. The wine has a crisp side as well as a mineral touch. Drink now, but better from 2021.
title: Christophe Cordier 2020 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This Blanc de Blancs has shed its initial minerality and gained rich fruitiness. Apricots as well as more citrus flavors abound, bringing out a full and round character. From Grand Cru vineyards on the Côte des Blancs, this is ready to drink.
title: Ayala 2013 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: While the wine has all the steely crispness you expect in a Chablis, it also offers ripe fruitiness that gives a full-bodied, round character. Acidity cuts through to give a lift to the fruit and to the tight texture of this young wine. It should age until 2019.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: At this stage, this is a wood-dominated wine. Its potential is considerable because beneath this wood and toast awaits a wonderful range of ripe apples, apricots and mango that promise to develop into a full, generous wine. Keep until 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2018 Poruzots Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Although this wine is labeled Brut, it is in fact right at the driest end of that category. Bone dry, therefore, while full of white fruits and crisp lemon zest flavors. The texture is tight, steely and speaks strongly of the chalk of the soil. It is still young, so this vintage wine can be drunk now for its fruitiness or left until 2020 for a more rounded, toasty character.
designation: Cuvée Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2015 Cuvée Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A soft and round exterior hides the concentrated, structured core that sets this wine on a long road to maturity. Creamed pears, quince and tight acidity are developing to come through and fill the wine with a crisp character allied to steeliness. Drink from 2021.
title: Damien et Romain Bouchard 2018 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is the best Delamotte vintage since 2000, a ripe and rich wine that brings out the chalky soil character with a strong mineral content. It has weight along with a relatively high dosage that gives softness. It is balanced, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Delamotte 2010 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This wine comes from a single vineyard in the heart of the appellation. It is soft, just hinting at the lime acidity while focused on ripe yellow and green-plum fruits. This wine can develop further and will be at its best from 2021.
title: Cave de Lugny 2019 La Carte  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is a rich, fruity wine that has a definite minerally character. The chalky texture is laced with lemon and apricot flavors, leading to a crisp, tight finish.
title: Bret Brothers 2016 Climat en Combe  (Saint-Véran)

description: Made from fruit sourced from a parcel in Fourchaume, this fruity wine offers green fruit flavors that are cut by the minerally texture. It is crisp, taut and nervy, and it needs a few years to show its best.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2017 Les Vaupulans Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This has apricot and pear flavors, plus a nutmeg hint and intense, refreshing acidity.
designation: Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2017 Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: Fruity and fragrant, this rich and complex wine also has a strong sense of acidity. Putting it all together, the wine has weight, aging potential and a fine, zesty, tight texture. It needs to age, so drink this fascinating wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Labet 2017 Fleurs Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)

description: This wine is fresh, crisp with acidity and an attractive zingy character. It has a lift and brightness along with hints of yellow fruits and a touch of spice.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2020  Bourgogne

description: This wine is ripe, full of yellow fruits that are balanced with crisp acidity. That gives a balanced wine that is juicy, perfumed and rich. The aftertaste is equally attractive, showing lemon-zest flavor.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2020  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: This wine is young, surprisingly fruity at this stage for this normally textured, structured Grand Cru. A pure line of sliced apple and green-plum flavors are shot through with tangy acidity. The fruitiness and intense acidity will pass soon and the wine will develop the proper steely, tight and mineral character. It will drink at its best from 2024.
title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2020 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This demonstrates a fine balance between the crisp white and peach fruits and the nervy texture that keeps this feeling taut and sharp. Beneath the fruity surface there is structure and a mineral character. Age for another 2–3 years.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2016 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is ripe and finely balanced, with its wood-aging character showing well with the yellow fruit flavor. It has weight and a fine sheen of brightness, while the finish shows a crisper side.
title: Bzikot Père et Fils 2016  Bourgogne

description: Rich and soft, this is full of pear and quince flavors that pack a punch of acidity. The fruitiness is offset by a yeasty character that adds notes of almond and spice.
title: William Fèvre 2016  Chablis

description: This is initially round and ripe, with a hint of vanilla, before showing a more structured, steely side. It shows fine balance between its intense texture and fruitiness, promising 2–3 years of aging.
title: La Chablisienne 2016 La Pierrelée  (Chablis)

description: This is aromatic, with ripeness that balances the bright green and white fruits. Wood and spice notes are followed by a touch of lemon jelly and minerally acidity. It's a wine that is still developing, waiting for the ripe fruit of the vintage to surface.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Clos St-Jean Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Crisp and fruity, but also with some weight, this dense, textured wine has a very minerally character, with a straight line of tight acidity. This is complex and tense while also refreshing.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This impressive wood-aged wine shows both the rich side of Pouilly Fuissé and its taut, minerally character. It is full and rich, yet always expressing a nervy, zingy edge. Age for at least three years.
title: Château Vitallis 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This has a warm, rounded character, with pressing minerality. Notes of apple, pear and a touch of vanilla all add richness and an open character. It has warm, rich fruit on the finish.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2016 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Made from grapes sourced from vines that were planted in 1955, this is ripe and rich. The fruit is still reticent, but it will develop into a concentrated, full-bodied wine. Its density is balanced by a firm, minerally structure. Age this for 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2016 Vieilles Vignes Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is complex and ripe but also mineraly and very structured. It offers many facets of the village: its richness and its strong sense of terroir. Bright, clean and fragrant on the finish.
title: Louis Latour 2016  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Big and opulent, this has ripe tropical fruits, with a soft, toasty texture and full-bodied feel. With its richness, this is developing quickly and is already ready to drink.
title: Michel Picard 2015  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This rich, delicious wine is still bursting with young apple and grapefruit flavors, giving it a fruity start with great long-term potential. Then the concentration and the richly mineral texture kicks in, lending the wine intensity and the possibility of aging. Drink from 2023.
designation: Marie-Amélie Fleur de Vigne Brut Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Millésime
title: Henriet-Bazin 2018 Marie-Amélie Fleur de Vigne Brut Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Millésime Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: With just a touch of yellow fruits, this is a ripe, concentrated wine. It has something of the Chablis minerality that is combined with intense fruits and acidity. The wine is young but very drinkable now, although likely to age at least until 2024.
title: Domaine George 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: This is a creamy wine with soft fruitiness. The roundness is happily cut with acidity and with a citrus edge that lifts the melon and pear flavors. The aftertaste is tangy and zesty. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021  Viré-Clessé

description: Round, soft, with the fruit dominating its mineral character, this wine shows richness, but doesn't have huge aging ability. It is more a wine that charms, is open, lively, spice and dried apricots working together with ripe acidity.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Blanchot Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Perfumed white flower aromas lead into a wine that is dense and ripe. As the palate opens up, white and yellow fruits, cinnamon and buttered toast all work their ways into a wine that is almost a meal in itself. Still young, of course, already fresh, it will surely deepen and broaden as it ages. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Les Blanchots Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Still young, this is a wine that needs to open and ripen. But already there are signs of richness, a wood- and tropical fruit-flavored wine that is typical of the full character of a Corton Charlemagne. It would be worth keeping 2–3 years for the wood to soften, the fruit to round out.
title: Bertrand Ambroise 2012  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Showing the typical power of Corton-Charlemagne, this is a classic wine that offers full-on fruit allied to a strong wood element. It is rich and bold, flavored with white fruits, apricots, almonds and spice. While it is drinkable now, it would certainly repay cellaring for 3–4 years.
title: Maison Champy 2012  Corton-Charlemagne

description: This wine from a parcel in the Fourchaume vineyard is a step up from the Fourchaume premier cru wine. That's because it has an extra edge of minerality, of apple skins and tight, ageworthy green fruits. With its final burst of acidity, this will certainly mature over the next 3–4 years.
designation: Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent Premier Cru
title: William Fèvre 2012 Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: An impressive wine, with its tense structure, its ripe pear and melon flavors and its layers of richness. The smooth wood shows slowly and gently as it underlies the fruit flavors. There is also power here, and a definite ability to age.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2011 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: There is a definite richness to this wine, the ripe white fruit and melon flavors aided by a judicious amount of vanilla and toast. That makes the wine seductive, but Laroche does not forget its Chablis origins and leaves enough room for a core of grapefruit, steel and tight acidity. Screwcap.
designation: Réserve de l'Obédience Les Blanchots Grand Cru
title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Réserve de l'Obédience Les Blanchots Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is one of Olivier Leflaive's benchmark wines, showing how his winemaker Franck Grux keeps lightness, freshness and complexity all in play. To start, it is firm and austere, then it bursts out with green fruits, toast, white currants and lemon, integrated and balanced. Drink now, or age for 2–3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012 Abbaye de Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: With fruit from the chalk vineyards of the Côte des Blancs, this wine named after Alain Thiénot's son Stanislas is tightly textured, mineral-driven, steely and crisp. Apple skins and lime juice feature along with a continuing freshness despite the wine's age. It can be enjoyed now, although it will be better from 2021.
designation: Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millesimé
title: Thiénot 2012 Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millesimé Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: There are touches of toast here, allowing the wine to broaden and become riper. It's still young, showing a future of yellow fruits contrasting with a tight and nervy texture. The aftertaste is full, ripe and generous. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2019 Vosgros Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From vines planted to the west of Chablis, this is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has some tension from the minerality while keeping the white fruit flavors to the fore. Drink now or, better, from late 2020.
title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2020  Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre

description: This ripe, still very young wine has a tangy, mineral texture that cuts into the white fruit flavors. Acidity, creamy texture and flavors of melon and apricots all give this wine the potential to be deliciously fruity. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: Chardonnay in Gascony retains the freshness of the region. In this wine, there is the richness of the grape, with touches of caramel and a floral perfume. It is balanced and fruity, needing a few more months in bottle. Drink from the end of 2019.
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2020 Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This domaine is now sold through the Jean-Marc Brocard family. This is a rich wine with yellow fruit as well as crisper citrus. There is a touch of pepper that lifts the fine acidity and the ripe apple and peach. At the end, the wine is crisp and clean.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2021 Les Grandes Vignes  (Chablis)

description: This wood-aged wine is rich, spicy and with a stylish combination of acidity and rich yellow and white fruits. The acidity cuts through the ripe texture and gives the wine its full-bodied character. The aftertaste shows a wine that is still young and will be best from 2022.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2020 Les Chaniots Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: This wine from the Côte Chalonnaise is a lighter style of Chardonnay than Leflaive's rich Côte de Beaune wines. It's a delicious lightly toasty wine that has crisp acidity and a strong and refreshing dose of lemon juice. The wine is creamy at the end. It will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Les Cloux Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: With fine concentration and crisp fruit, this is a young wine with a future. Ripe apples and lemon zest are balanced with a strongly mineral texture as well as spice. The wine is rich, and will develop over the next two years. Drink from 2022.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2021  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Savigny-lès-Beaune, better known for its reds, also makes small quantities of white. From a three-acre parcel, this wine is ripe and tangy with orange peel and mineral acidity. It is a wine that is aging fast and that will be ready to drink from late 2021.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2020  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: This is a structured wine, almost tannic in character. It has a rich, textured character that will allow the wine well. Apple and pear flavors are dominant along with the spice from wood aging. Drink from 2024.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Les Charmes Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2020 Domaine du Pavillon Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This is a structured wine, almost tannic in character. It has a rich, textured character that will allow the wine well. Apple and pear flavors are dominant along with the spice from wood aging. Drink from 2024.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Les Charmes Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2020 Domaine du Pavillon Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This is a rich and rounded wine, full of yellow fruits that shine through the tense texture. It is ripe, showing minerality as well as tropical fruits and red apples. The wine is going to age relatively quickly, so drink from 2023.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Great white fruits, hints of peach and tight citrus-zest texture all give this wine its great freshness. At the same time the texture suggests minerality and a nervy edge. Hints of the wood are just right for this intensely fruity wine.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2020 Les Combettes Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: La Carte is a small vineyard in Lugny, producing this delicious crisp fruit-driven wine. It is lively with acidity and ripe with peach and baked pear fruits. The texture is just enough to allow it to age, so drink from mid-2021.
title: Cave de Lugny 2020 Lieu-Dit La Carte  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is a ripe creamy wine. It is all fruit: ripe apples and sweet pears. There is a fine touch of spice as well as attractive acidity. It may be young but it is certainly ready to enjoy for its rich fruit. The producer's vineyards lie under the dramatic cliff of Solutré.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2021  Saint-Véran

description: This is a light and crisp Petit Chablis that is soft and totally ready to drink. Apricot and citrus flavors combine in a wine that is lightly mineral and very fruity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2021  Petit Chablis

description: There is an obvious vanilla, toasty character to this wine from the wood fermentation. That balances with the lemon and pear fruits and the tight texture. The wine is still young with great fruit potential, so drink from 2022.
title: Domaines Devillard 2020 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: A rounded wine, although still young. It has ripe fruit, creamed apples and fresh acidity. The wood flavors give an extra smoothness as well as a more complex long-lasting finish.
title: Domaine Emmanuel Giboulot 2015 La Grand Chatelaine  (Côte de Beaune)

description: This wine is closed and tight at this stage of its development, which is not a bad thing because it will age well. For now, it offers crisply fresh fruit layered with wood aging and with a tight, tangy texture. Spice and toast flavors complement the fruit. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2018 La Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Structured and tight, this mineral-driven wine is still in its initial stages of development. It has crisp acidity, layers of spicy wood and a rich palate. Apples and white peach emerge from the firm, young structure. Drink this wine from 2022. The vineyard is next door to the Grand Cru Montrachet vines.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2018 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: There is a fine mineral-driven backbone to this ripe, concentrated and fruity wine, which gives its dense apricot and pineapple flavors great structure. It needs to age for at least four years.
designation: Château de Rully Saint Jacques Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2016 Château de Rully Saint Jacques Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: Full bodied, rich and ripe, this wine has a minerally texture and is loaded with tropical fruit, citrus and apricot flavors. It's a serious selection that needs some aging. This is one of a series of single-vineyard wines from the Comte de Ternay estate.
designation: Château de Rully La Bressande Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru
title: Antonin Rodet 2016 Château de Rully La Bressande Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: Initially smooth and rounded, this wine opens to reveal a structured character. A note of tangy lemon zest cuts through the pear and quince flavors, which creates a balance between richness and tautness. Ready to drink in 1–2 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This is a fruity wine with lively acidity and a brisk, zingy character. Freshness shoots through the wine, making it lively with hints of yellow fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and ripe.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2020 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: The steely character of a young Chablis is very apparent in this wine. It is crisp, lemon flavored and with a mineral edge. The wine has a juicy freshness, still young at heart and needing to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Max 2020 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With its appealing toast and fruit aromas, this is a rich wine. It does keep plenty of steely texture while allowing the yellow fruits, ripe pear and toast to shine. In style it hovers halfway between the ripe, buttery Meursault of the past and the crisper style of today, a fine compromise and ready to drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019  Meursault

description: Tangy and mineral, this is a crisp apple- and citrus-driven wine, full of fruitiness while also having a tight texture. Its acidity just adds to the generally ripe character of the wine. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2019 Réserve Personnelle  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Rich and round, the wine boasts ripe toast and creamy pear and peach fruit. The lemon touches give point to this full wine, adding attractive freshness.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2014 Les Trois Pêcheurs  (Saint-Véran)

description: A wine that seems designed for some aging, with youthful green fruits, a vibrant texture of apple juice and good depth of flavor.
title: Nicolas Maillet 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: Delicious freshness here, with crisp fruits, citrus and apple and a touch of caramel. Very fresh, great acidity, hints of mineral and flint.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine Drouhin-Vaudon Réserve de Vaudon  (Chablis)

description: This is a soft wine from a major Rhône valley producer. Attractive acidity gives it a crisp, bright feel. Tangy citrus and clean, light fruitiness are all there, balanced and ready to drink. Drink now.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2021 La Châsse Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a gentle and easy-going Chardonnay. It is soft, lightly buttery and conveys apricot and ripe pear flavors. The aftertaste just touches on acidity.
title: Café du Midi 2021 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a beautiful, ripe wine, flavored with quince, pear and apricots. It is above all the zesty texture that gives this wine its character and attraction. Fruity, structured and likely to age well, the wine should be drunk from 2019.
title: Domaine Daniel Dugois 2018 Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: Based in Burgundy, Tramier should know something about Chardonnay. This wine has some structure that tastes of cool vineyards. It is crisp, with refreshing white fruit and green-plum flavors, and is ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Romantic Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Rich and powerful, this is a spicy wine flavored with caramel and apricot. There is a layer of high toast that is out of balance with the fruit, and needs time to calm down. Wait 6–9 months.
title: Faiveley 2013  Mâcon-Villages

description: A light, crisp, fresh wine, with attractive lemon grass and orange zest flavors. It is juicy, the green fruits full of intensity. There is good minerality as well, underlined by toast from wood aging.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine Béranger  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Like many of Denis Pommier's wines, this comes from old vines, and the concentration is testament to that. The texture is rich, touched by honeyed wood, with peaches in syrup ripeness. As a contrast, there is also a fresh, red apple acidity, which gives a lift to the aftertaste.
title: Domaine Pommier 2013 Croix aux Moines  (Chablis)

description: A rounded wine that exudes a flavor of warm yellow fruit. With its weight, the fruitiness comes through strongly, leaving an attractive tang of acidity on the finish.
title: Louis Max 2016  Saint-Véran

description: Very buttery aromas lead to a wine that is ripe, rounded and full in the mouth. The acidity is masked by the richness, leaving apricot rather than citrus as the dominant character.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2018 La Roche  (Mâcon-Vergisson)

description: Rounded and warm, this wine shows ripe yellow fruits and spice from the wood aging. It's richly endowed, full of toast and with a generous texture. The minerality and acidity are a hint in this rounded wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2021 Les Referts Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Rich, fruity and with a full texture, this smooth, creamy wine has great fruit, deliciously cut with acidity. The wine is smooth, hinting at toast, with a tighter, more textured aftertaste. Drink from 2024.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2021 Les Corton Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: In this smooth wine, toasty flavors mingle easily with the ripe yellow fruits. It offers minerality as well as juicy citrus flavors, making for a rich wine that needs to age. Drink from 2021.
designation: Les Clos des Mouches Premier Cru
title: Seguin-Manuel 2021 Les Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Soft, light and fruity, this wine is already approachable. It is an apple- and apricot-flavored Chardonnay, with just a tang of lemon zest that lends the finish some bite.
title: Antonin Rodet 2017 A. Rodet  (Bourgogne)

description: Ripe yellow-fruit flavors and a soft texture are the hallmarks of this wine. Full in the mouth, this has a warm southern Burgundy feel. It offers touches of spice and green herbs, and it has orange-zest-like acidity on the finish.
title: Antonin Rodet 2017  Mâcon-Villages

description: Warm and round, this Mâcon has ripe melon and peach flavors that come with a citrusy edge. It has an attractive floral character that brings out the light minerality and acidity on the finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 2017  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a light, bright white-flower-perfumed wine, and it offers fresh, apple-like acidity, a crisp texture and an edge of lemon zest. For drinking soon.
title: Château de Pizay 2017  Bourgogne

description: With balanced fruitiness, this is a taut, mineral wine with juicy pear and apple flavors as well as a touch of spice. Perfumed, fruity and ready to drink, it is a fine, terroir-driven wine.
title: Pascal Rollet 2020 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Bright and fruity, this wine has a warm, ripe streak that gives it richness. It also has all the freshness and crispness of the vintage while showing a more creamy character that's typical of Saint-Aubin. It is developing quickly and could well be ready to drink in 2020, certainly by 2021.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2019 Pitangerets Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Vincent Leflaive was the uncle of Olivier Leflaive. The wine, from old vines, is made in homage to him. Impressively rich and full-bodied, it has some toastiness as well as fresh acidity and apple and citrus flavors. It's tight at the moment, showing a steely character that will soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2018 Oncle Vincent  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine is structured and concentrated, showing a tight character that is closed and firm. It has enough fruit for the future to show its potential richness. Concentrated, very mineral, the wine should not be drunk until 2021.
title: Henry Fessy 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: From a parcel of the Fourchaume premier cru vineyard that is on the same slope as the Grand Crus, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine, packed with fruit while still firmly structured. Tropical and yellow fruits, hints of pineapple and apricots give richness, set against a mineral, textured aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Vaulorent Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Structured and with a strongly crisp and textured character, this wine also has a touch of toast from wood aging. Ripe green and yellow fruits are part of the concentration and dense flavors. It is still young, so wait until 2022.
title: Domaine Pinson 2019 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This beautifully balanced wine shows toast that counterpoints the generous yellow fruits and acidity. It's a ripe wine, touched by honey, spice and peach flavors. The aftertaste, with its total freshness, is crisp, lively, mouthfilling and refreshing. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Jadot 2019 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Vaulorent is on the same slope as the Grand Crus, giving it an extra structure. Very ripe and forward, this wine shows both power and the approachability of the vintage. It has plenty of freshness while also showing off yellow fruits and pineapple richness. A more textured, steely, crisp aftertaste will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: William Fèvre 2019 Vaulorent Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: There is just the lightest touch of toast in this full-bodied wine. The fruit, structured and dense, is forward and ripe at the same time. Spice and crisply fresh acidity give a lift to the concentration of the wine which finished with ripe apricot and vanilla flavors. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2019 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: There are plenty of toasty aromas to this rich, generous and structured wine. It is now almost mature although the fresh apples, spice and vanilla are still offset by the tightest, refreshing acidity. The wood flavors are well balanced by the fine fruit. Drink now.
title: Domaine Vincent Dauvissat 2016 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Lemon and lime flavors cut through this wine that's crisp with a mineral character. It is packed with acidity, with a touch of wood that fits well into the fruit and texture. It's a beautiful wine, not fat although it will fill out. Drink from 2022.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2019 Perrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A touch of spice and vanilla from wood aging is balanced by ripe yellow fruits and honey. This wine is freshened by lime-juice acidity that gives a crisp texture. Behind all this fruit is a dense structure, weight and concentration. It's a generous wine that will age further; drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Rich and rounded in character, this is already a beautiful wine, from 80-year-old vines. A line of acidity shoots through the wine, giving a long lift to the green fruits and orange zest flavors. It does have weight and a generous texture that reveals itself slowly. Ripe apricots mingle with acidity and toast at the end. Drink from 2023.
designation: Le Clos de la Garenne Duc de Magenta Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2019 Le Clos de la Garenne Duc de Magenta Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Bougros produces rich wines, and this wine comes from the extra-ripe vineyard at the base of the slope. It is generous, giving a weighty character with the flavors plumbing the depths of richness. On top, a beautiful, almost sweet acidity leaves a fresh feeling in the mouth. Drink from 2023.
designation: Bougros Côté de Bouguerots Grand Cru
title: William Fèvre 2019 Bougros Côté de Bouguerots Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: The wine is full of ripe yellow fruits that give a rounded, full character. Its texture is rounded, generous with a light touch of a more mineral, nervy character. The aftertaste keeps up the rich, full theme.
title: Pascal Granger 2019  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Properly opulent, this is a generous, subtly wood-aged wine. Ripe apricot and peach fruits are shot through with crisp apple. The wood and the rich fruits give this structured wine a warm character. It is still young, of course. Drink from 2023.
title: Albert Bichot 2021 Domaine du Pavillon  (Corton-Charlemagne)

description: This beautiful wine has great potential. It already shows good balance between the acidity and ripe yellow fruits that are woven into the toasty texture and the spice. The wine will take time to develop but will become impressive. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2021 Champ Gain Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This fine, ageworthy wine is rounded, smooth and full of ripe yellow fruit. There is a zesty tang on the back palate that will allow it to mature, its richness shining through a frame of crisp texture. Drink from 2024.
designation: Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru
title: Alex Gambal 2020 Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Plenty of wood aromas, but the palate combines the wood notes with smoky acidity, textured green plum and vanilla flavors with a refreshing acidity. There's a tang here: a wine that has bursts of great fruit to go with the wood.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014 Hauts-Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A short wood-aging has given this wine an extra dimension that's both ripe and ageworthy. Yellow fruits are spiced up by the toast and ginger flavors, whlle intense background acidity provides wonderful freshness. This wine deserves to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2019 Quintessence  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a beautiful, bright wine, still very young although already hinting at the warmth of Fourchaume. The steely texture is right up front, along with crisp apple and citrus fruits. Underneath, a vanilla, toasty character shows promise for aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2019 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Rich while firm, this wine is structured and dense. It has great fruit potential that is still developing through the tight texture and the concentrated structure. It will be a fine wine, but give it time. Drink from 2024.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Perrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: With wood aging and the rich flavors from lees stirring, this is a ripe wine, gently oxidative as well as full of yellow fruits. It is a broad wine, typical of the vintage, although happily with a crisper citrus aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2021  Bourgogne

description: This warm, ripe wine is smoothly creamy and ready to drink. Touches of yellow fruits are balanced with just the right amount of acidity. The wine is rich and generous.
title: Clos des Rocs 2021 Les Barres  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This wine has strong wood aromas that also dominate the palate. Happily, the yellow and citrus fruit behind the wood is ready to shine through. Give this rich wine time to balance out, from late 2022.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2021 Pommard Carette  (Saint-Véran)

description: Ripe fruit aromas show alongside an equally rich, creamy palate. This wine has attractive lemon and crisp apple flavors, touched by wood to give a smooth, rich aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
title: Sylvaine et Alain Normand 2022  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: Intensely ripe wine, with melon and pear flavors, spiced with just the right amount of wood and structured fruit skin tannins. So classy, this is a beautiful wine, boasting the richness of 2013 while still keeping a sense of nervy texture.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Demoiselles  (Chevalier-Montrachet)

description: This wine has a zesty structure, with good minerality and ripe yellow fruits.Tightly structured with acidity, it comes from one of the cooler villages of the Côte de Beaune and shows a lively, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2021 En Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This wine is ripe with yellow fruits and apple acidity. The richness of the year is balanced by crispness, minerality and delicious fruitiness. It will age well, so drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Tangy and zesty, this crisp wine shows a strong sense of chalky terroir, with a mineral edge and tight acidity. These elements mean the wine will take time to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2021 Le Porusot Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Although the oak imprints strong flavors in this wine, it's still young, so all the spice and toastiness will integrate. The fruit is there, showing a rich medley of apples, pears and citrus. As it matures, the texture will flesh out to result in a generous wine with a promising future. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2021 Les Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This smooth wine is rich with yellow fruits, an opulent texture and a sprinkling of spice. The acidity and the crisper citrus flavors in the background give the essential lift to this ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2021 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The Côtes d'Auxerre, west of Chablis, is the last outpost of Chardonnay in Burgundy. That results in this cool style of wine, light and fruity with apple and green-plum fruitiness. There is a zest to the wine, a lightly mineral texture and attractive final acidity. Drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2021  Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre

description: This premier cru is on the cooler left bank of the Serein river, making this vintage a crisply mineral wine that's tight with zesty lemon and fine crisp acidity. The hints of yellow fruits are still to develop. The wine is structured and needs to age, so drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2021 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The vineyard lies just below the great white Grand Cru vines. It has something of the same power although in a more immediately approachable style. The fruit is juicy, crisp, open with generous white stone fruits and a lively line of citrus acidity. Drink this beautifully balanced wine from 2023.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Enseignères  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: The wine is ripe and firm with great concentration. It comes from old vines in this southeast-facing vineyard. Rich and full of white stone fruits that are cut with citrus, it is a wine to age. The aftertaste has spice and strong minerality. Drink this wine from 2023.
designation: Les Vieilles Vignes Montmains Premier Cru
